Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MO-dancemom
Reviews.Content: We have been Bluegreen owners for several years and this is one of their premier properties. The property is large and off the busy part of International Drive which is a plus when it comes to traffic. You won't waste time creeping on Int'l Drive. The pool area has a zero depth area for the young ones, water slides, and a hot tub and is very large. There are a variety of bedroom choices to choose from. There are several places that you can eat on site and a Publix a few blocks away. This past visit we stayed in a 3 bedroom Presidential Suite. The Suite was awesome, but a huge let down when we came into the room and discovered we had Street/construction view, rather than the beautiful pool view. It would have been nice to know that some of these high point rooms do NOT have pool view. Also, the wifi service was TERRIBLE in the room. It would not stay connected at all and was very frustrating. Other than that, the resort is great and I love the close proximity to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon D
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay at this hotel on March break a year or so back, it is just now I happened to remember how great it was. It isn't too much of a car ride to Universal Studios or even Disneyland, it has a great location, and quite a bit of property, allowing for many buildings to house customers. Rooms: The rooms were stellar, they weren't the 'Top of the line' but they were certainly modern, and very clean. The well kept apartment style rooms also contained the full amenities that you would expect from a nice resort. Fully loaded kitchen, etc. The bedrooms were also very nice, nothing that really comes to the top of my head, but none the less a very comfortable stay. The resort itself had a couple of pools, and lovely fountains that were located in the middle of the resort. While the pools were big and well kept, so was the ground itself. Personally took a couple of walks around the resort because it is just stellar on a sunny day, and large enough to get a good walk in even. Staff seemed to be well mannered and helpful, certainly a very comfortable place. Would stay here again - - Jon

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mommiesRN
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at The Fountains with my in-laws, husband, and our 2 yr old son. My in-laws had signed up to go to the sales pitch, so we got a free vacation...I was totally surprised at how much I liked it. I went into this thinking it would be an "okay" little condo, just like any time share kind of place. Oh no...it was more like a 4/5 star resort! My in-laws talked up and down about how they weren't interested and they ended up buying into the BlueGreen resorts! The pool's were amazing. We spent most of our time at the larger pool, it was very clean and heated to a comfortable 82 degrees. There were play areas and a splash pad for little ones, and dual water slides for older kids. The little grill at the pool had delicious hamburgers (although pretty overpriced...about $10.00 just for a burger and fries) but it was good none the less. The other pool was a bit smaller and was half indoor half outdoor, there was another kiddie pool there with fountains in it for the kids to play in. Plenty of lounge chairs to lay out at both pools. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. I've recently spent time at a brand new Sandals resort in St. Lucia and the rooms were comparable so I'm not really sure about the reviews that say the rooms are outdated. The entire place was always clean actually. The resort is only a 10-15min. drive to Disney, depending on traffic. It is also minutes away from all of the restaurants and nightlife on International Drive. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Webbfamily_2011
Reviews.Content: We have owned at this resort for over 12 years now, and after the demise of Airtours were concerned at the new owners. Well we needn't have worried Bluegreen have taken the resort from strength to strength, It must be one of the top resorts in Orlando. The welcome you get is personal and makes you feel very much like you have just got home from a long journey away. The care that is taken to check you in, ensure you have everything you need is something i really like. The only downside is that when you collect your parking pass they like to book owners like us to "update" meetings, we refuse and never get pushed in hard. What follows for the rest of your vacation is pure luxury. Two bedroomed apartments, with the most comfortable beds ever ... the master en-suite shower is amazing an wakes you up beautifully every morning. We are lucky enough to have lake front apartments for our time and the bigger apartment which can sleep 8. They have just been remodelled and look amazing. The furnishings are new, comfortable and leave the rooms with a tranquil feel Activities always have something going on, whether you are six or sixty, so get to the poolside and have fun with the team!! Otherwise just enjoy a chill out around the pool/hot tubs or even go fishing on the well stocked lake. Free wifi is a new bonus which we were very happy get this time. I can not sing this resorts praises enough, it is my home from home and despite leaving tomorrow i know i will be back soon :)

Reviews.Title: “March Break Party time.”
Reviews.Author: gonecode6
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the fountains before and stayed in building 4 which was wonderful. But we didn't stay March Break before.....What a difference. The last time we stayed it was beautiful and for familes with those beautiful pools and friendly staff. I would venture to say they have new management ! It is a beautiful resort but from the time we showed up to the time we checked out (EARLY) ,it was a stressful vacation. We go away with young kids try to get rest and relaxation. We don't book party resorts or anything where March Break Students overrun the place. By Monday we wanted out. We were put in building 7 which is nothing like building 3 or 4 ,which is what we had booked but they overbooked and lost our confirmation... The units in the other building are smaller and about 500 square feet packed together. This would not be an issue unless you are packed in with March Break teenagers. Security had their hands full and music was cranked everywhere until 1 or 2 am with kids screaming and parties everywhere....Is this a family resort anymore ? No it is a timeshares sales resort now ! They want your money and give away 2 night vacations to everyone to get you here. Our best was when we showed up to book in , they didn't have our reservation. We booked with a timeshare because that is what Bluegreen is. A timeshare resort that wants your money. We actually couldn't get to our unit until the next morning because they didn't have our name on file and never had a room for us. Wonderful ....Twice this week someone lost our reservation.....What is going on ! Hotels overbooking and just putting bodies in rooms and customer service gone. Finally we got our room after standing around for two hours the next morning and managers coming out and saying it is not their fault , it is RCI's fault.....OK ! Do I care ? I have a confirmation in hand and would like my room please. Next comes the, sorry we have to put you here(building 7) because we double booked building 4 and you have no choice. OH GREAT ! Then comes the timeshare presentation push...Ok ! We went because it was supposed to be so different and and an easy experience for $80.00 Visa....BULL ! They sell a points based system and want $60,000 for a week with over $1200.00 maintaince fees....What a joke and it took over 3 hours....AVOID IT ! We had to call Security after midnight about three times because parties where rocking above and beside us....We have little kids who go to bed before 11pm. Security response from Maria at the front desk....I quote " we cannot control what goes on inside units and banging the floor does not concern us". Wonderful.....Security was no help at all and the parties continued until 2 am somedays. OK ! maybe without kids ,we would be into it but the kids go full tilt all day and at night we are wiped out ..Between parks and sunshine. Sleep is needed. NOT HERE ! You won't get it . Just be advised ....Beautiful resort but Management is putting bodies in the room for $$$$.. You can tell from the time you get in the door .....All about the money ... The timeshare sales is a joke and they state you could never buy Bluegreen resale ever. Check e-bay........EASY to buy aftermarket. Many people were here on the Bass Pro deal where you come for 3 days and do the timeshare tour.....Give me a break ..... We were the only ones who paid to be here in the preview ....What does that tell you.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: BuckRussell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just a couple of days, which didnâ€™t make it seem like much of a vacation, but we had a great time and found the resort to be very clean and enjoyable. We swam in both the large pool and the smaller pool by the clubhouse and found both to be very well maintained and clean. We had only a small problem with the TV remotes, but we called late the first night and asked for someone to look at it the next day. We left the room early in the morning and returned mid-day to find the remote problem corrected and a message on the phone informing us that the repair had been made and if anything else was needed to be sure to call. Otherwise the room was very clean and everything worked as it should. We checked in way before check-in time and were told our room was not yet ready. Before we could even get out of the lobby we recieved a call to inform us that it was now ready so we were able to get into our room about 1 PM. The only real complaint was that the bars and restaurants on the property were not open very late. After returning from a long day out on Sunday we found the bar next to the pool closed by 7 PM. I realized that because it wasnâ€™t quite Spring Break season the resort was only really busy on Saturday night so that may be the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Late Winter Relaxation in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: LawnRanger69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. This remains a beautiful resort. The landscaping is exceptional and the building 10 is very nice. The outside pool is great. The indoor/outdoor is also great but the water is warmer at the outside pool. Free wireless is coming so the last complaint I had in the past is resolved. The activities are varied including Lake Eve which is stocked by Bass Pro for catch and release.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience while running Disney Princess Half Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Tripper4141
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a "girls trip" to run the Disney Princess Half Marathon and had a wonderful time. The condo was well furnished and clean. The pools were wonderful as were the hot tubs. Our only comment was that the toilets were water efficient and they were loud - especially in the middle of the night ! Great location and very easy to get to the Disney parks and the Outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - Can't wait to bring the grandkids but wonderful as a couple too!”
Reviews.Author: CAMerrill1
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip to a Bluegreen resort. We arranged this through a timeshare presentation. Plan 3 hours for the promised 90 minute presentation, but, overall this is a very pleasant place to stay. Of course they want to sell you a timeshare BUT the presentation was painless and definitely not a hard sell. While we did not purchase a timeshare, we plan to return with the kids & grandkids in the future. We stayed in a two bedroom unit in Building 6, Floor 6. The first unit we stayed in ended up having a leak in the bathroom ceiling so they moved us to another unit on the same floor. Although inconvenient, this was very minor. All the guests I spoke with were impressed as well. Many have been long-time owners that come every year. I can see why! Oh, they do not allow you to ride bikes in this resort except on a rather short promenade area....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: sarah h
Reviews.Content: My family of four (two adults, 11 yr old and and a 3yr old) stayed here in Dec 2011. We actually purchased this week on ebay and paid a total of $381 for the whole week with no resort fees added. We were a little worried when we got there (because we had never purchased anything like this on ebay before) but everything far exceeded our expectations. We were never asked to sit through a presentation (although we did ask if we could and nobody got back to us). The room was amazing..very clean, large, nice balcony, master bed with corner tub, and seperate bath for the kids. We used the corner tub each day after long days in Universal and Disney. The pools were very clean and large. If you want maid service, you do have to pay extra for this, however, that is typical of timeshares. I would certainly recommend this place and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “JUST WANT YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: MJB15
Reviews.Content: This was a nice resort. There was two different pool areas, club house, bars, resurants on site. In the club house you had to pay to play the games in arcade with Bluegreen card. The timeshare meeting lasted over two hours and we were the first to leave from our group. We had a 3year old that was waiting with grandpa in the room. Too long for us and a waste of the day. That's all they do is try to get your money!!!!! They will try and try!!!! We just said we can't aford that and finally got to leave. The free Cruise they say you get ISN'T FREE!!! We had trash piled in up with nowhere to take it. They said there was a bin to put it in and we never found it. A lady called the day before our arrival date and ask it we wanted to spend and extra $270.00 to get a room with a balcony, washer/dryer and a kitchen. We of course said are you serious NO! Which I had read that all room already had it all!!!! After we said NO she said well how about $135.00. We said we will stay where we are. She said we were in a Hotel part (there isn't a such a place). At meeting we told them about what she said and sometimes they put in a off resort hotel if rooms get filled up, but it's not that much money to get an upgrade (less than $100) they told us. They just try getting your money!!! We got there and our room had balcony, kitchen, washer/dryer. They lied to us! We arrived at 3:30 and they said our room wasn't ready yet and it would be 4 before it was ready. We didn't get a call for our room until 4:30. We were already tired from flying, renting a car, ect.....We also tried to call for directions and put us on hold for 30 minutes. We hung up and tried calling back twice and no one would answer the phone. Terrible customer service! We used the whirlpool bath tub once and when we turned on the jets MOLD came out! Light in other bathroom had a short, both toilet handles were cracked and 1 broken. Needs better maintenance for sure. Close to Disney, Sea world, ect.....We were in building 6. They just reopened building 4 from renovaion. You have to pay for a maid per day! You have to have a pool towel card (2 towels per card)! Have to return card or they charge you $20 per card! Have to return towels at pool area, too! Have to pay for spa services, steam room, ect. Swimming is the only free activity here! My father in law has a timeshare and he never goes through all this crap!

Reviews.Title: “Scam”
Reviews.Author: KDohner
Reviews.Content: We booked a vacation in September 2011 for a week stay in April 2012. We called Bluegreen reservation department in February to see about adding another Night. The rep said she would need to send the request thru and get back to us in 24/48 hours. Well, we not only did not get an extra night, but someone accidentally canceled our original reservations so then we had none. We signed up with them during a visit at a Bass Pro shop so we were given a $25 gift card. Not only did I spend 8 hours of my day fighting with Bluegreen reps about getting our money back (We had paid in full already), they actually refunded us minus the $25 gift card. You would have thought they'd just throw that in for our "Troubles". Don't ever sign up with them. I wonder how many more have this happen to them and don't fight for their refund back............

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Fountains resort on the 10th Feb, 2012. Check in was effortles and the 2 bed apartment was clean, well maintained and well equiped. The staff were very helpful and the resort was excellent, it had every thing we could have wanted, great swimming pools, great clubhouse. I had read some of the not so good reviews prior to visiting this resort but can assure anyone who visits this resort, you will not be disappointed...........we will return

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvler1
Reviews.Content: Great resort in a great location. It is close enough to Disney, without being right on top of all the action. Great restaurants and shopping nearby, plus the resort does have a bar/restaurant on site. The indoor outdoor pool is a great idea. Rooms are spacious and the kitchen was well appointed. We like it a lot, so much so that we've tried to get back into it and every time it's booked. I'm sure we'll get back there at some point, but this is a pretty cool place to stay. Just next door to Floriday's resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lowrie_MN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times. We have our timeshare here. The last time we were there we stayed in the presidential suite. It was beautiful and worth the extra cost! It was on the top floor and we had an amazing view of the pool area. There was an outdoor grill area on the suite that we enjoyed. The staff is normally friendly but we have run into a few occasions where they are not always friendly and have been rude. We have stayed in the 2 bedroom units multiple times. Some times the rooms are not always up to my standards in cleanliness. The pool area is really nice. It is a good hotel for kids too.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome”
Reviews.Author: DRhodesNewEngland
Reviews.Content: 4th trip in 8 years to Orlando, each time staying in a time share / condo location. When the only complaints I can give are lousy shower curtains and fairly dated televisions, I am lucky. EVERYTHING about this property is outstanding. From the moment we checked in until the day we checked out, nothing could have been better. The condos were ideal, nothing extraordinary, just what we needed. I often read complaints about rental condos and the lack of everyday things like toilet paper, dish liquid, laundry detergent. This place had plenty of all. However, the 2 pools, full size basketball court, clubhouse, on site stores............best property we have ever stayed. And to make things better, right down the road to Sea World, an easy 12 - 15 minute drive to Disney and about the same via side roads to Universal. Beautiful property, ideal location and a terrific staff ! If there was a 6th star to allocate, Fountains would receive it

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: jkl25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fountains in February of 2011 in a two bedroom unit. The resort is huge with a very large outdoor pool, walking trails with barbeque units everywhere. The condo was very nice and spacious with a beautiful screened in porch/balcony. It had a nice full kitchen with a washer and dryer there to take care of any laundry needs you had. We were in a building next to the heated pool indoor/outdoor pool which was nice since it was a cooler time of the year. The property was very clean and only guests are allowed through the gated area.

Reviews.Title: “timquin”
Reviews.Author: danigirl1
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed staying at the fountains, room was plenty big for us and the pools were awesome. Two out of six days we just hung around the resort and there was plenty to do. The staff at the fountains were very hospitable. Over all a fine place to stay on your Disney vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Sunbather08
Reviews.Content: We had a very busy week in Orlando for our Disney trip. One regret? We didn't get to have a down day to take advantage of the incredible amenities at this resort! We left wondering how much we missed & when we can go back & skip Disney to enjoy the resort! WOW! We loved our room (in the newly refurbished towers) and had plenty of room with our family, totaling 4 adults, and 3 children. There was plenty of kitchen space with modern furnishings & decor. It was very clean. The location on International Drive was convenient for our trip. We liked the security gate safety. We just wish we had gotten to spend more time there during the day! We weren't happy with sliding doors on the master suite and not a real door with lock. When staying with small children, this was risky! The tub was open to the room so we couldn't really take advantage of that without a locking door. But the foldout couch was comfortable, we had plenty of seating for all of our guests at the table & snackbar, and cooked breakfast each morning & prepared snacks. We loaded the refrigerator upon our arrival for healthy options for the week's Disney days and we had plenty of room for everything our family needed. The property was beautiful and the view from our room was a great way to wake up! We're looking forward to returning & having more fun on the property with all the things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, nice pools!”
Reviews.Author: DEMCPITA
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed in a two bedroom unit and absolutely loved it. This is one of the prettiest resorts I've been to in Orlando. The pools were awesome. They had an inflatable large movie screen at the end of the pool for the kids to watch disney movies each night which was neat. Lots of things going on with daily activities around the pool. The room was large enough that we all felt comfortable. The "master" bedroom was really nice, with a whirlpool tub. The Kitchen was a little tight, but enough room for me to cook. Had stackable washer and dryer which was nice to throw kids' clothes and swimsuits in. The grounds were well kept and our balcony overlooked the pool and lake. The location provided easy access to all of the theme parks. The only complaint I really had was parking was difficult to find and you were only allowed one parking decal. My oldest son drove down and "guest" parking was infront of the main building, which was a good 2-3 blocks away. This is a large complex and you will have to do some walking to get to the pool, your car etc. but it would not deter me from the resort. Definately going back this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrMarcR
Reviews.Content: This is a time share but you can rent apartments when they're available. They are all 2 or 3 bedroom with 2 bathrooms, full kitchen, dining and living rooms. The pools with water slides were great for our child (and us), and there are always great activities going on. We really enjoyed just hanging around the resort on days that we weren't visiting the local attractions. The staff is friendly and helpful, and they addressed any issues we had immediately. All around this is a great place to stay and it's central to all the major attractions. WiFi works well. Cons: food selection onsite is not great, but there is a Publix just down the road. The Business Center is a waste of time, and almost useless unless all you want to do is access the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and cozy”
Reviews.Author: ozarktraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable location even on a rainy day. Having a 2 bedroom unit with a full kitchen is so comfortable,quiet and we slept very well last night. Everything works perfectly and is close to the parks,if you want to go. We have stayed on the Disney property before and that is the most convenient but you pay so much more,for less space and amenities. The beds are great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime255
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 Bedroom unit in January 2012. We do prefer a 2 bedroom lock off, but the condo is lovely. The only thing that I can comment about is that the beds were on the harder side. Some people enjoy this, I don't! I like my "comfy, cozy" bed. After the second night I slept fine, and everything in the unit was lovely, and top notch. The Grounds were just Gorgeous, immaculate, and well kept! Pools were heated, and clean! I just loved the kiddie area, and so did my 3 year old. We did attend the timeshare presentation which was somewhat pressured, but for the most part was fine! We did get $80 plus a 3 day 2 night certificate for a hotel room which was just fine! This is the second time that we've stayed here, and we really enjoyed it, along with our kids!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but will not be back”
Reviews.Author: chasenakl
Reviews.Content: My family went to this hotel for our Disney trip. My in-laws have the time share (which are stupid in my opinion) but I will not get into that. The hotel is fairly new and had nice features like granite countertops and a full size kitchen. It was like having a 2 bedroom apartment. Some things were broken in the room when we got there, bathroom related, but was fixed within 24 hours. The things I did not like was there was absolutely no housekeeping unless you did it yourself. The hallways smelled of an awful odor and even being on the 10th floor, I could still smell Dominoes in the lobby. My in-laws were pressured into a "90" minute time share update meeting that lasted more like 160 minutes. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia J
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on a family trip with parents, and am absolutely delighted once again. We stayed at The Fountains last year as well, and we knew we had to come back. What more can I say about the rooms? They are gorgeous and spacious, each with their own screened-off balcony, and two bedrooms and a comfy living room area. The 2-bedroom suite had everything we needed and we often did not want to leave the comfort of the room. Pizza is easily delivered to your suite with the Dominoes menu on the counter(very convienient by the way). The one downside with this hotel IS the price, both for the room, and any on-site restaurants. Mug-O-Joe's is fantastic for breakfast, although quite pricey, not so much for lunch. Lots of activities to keep you busy in the resort and the customer service was one of the best I've had. I definitely recommend the Fountains, and we look forward to once again staying next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Missy D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fountains 2 times, and there is always a lot to do. The front desk staff could use a little training on niceness, but otherwise it was great.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: suga_8
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 weeks amazing time .it is at the southern end of international drive not far from sea world and aquatica.walmart and publix nearby ,lovely big pool and nice staff,love to visit again.a well and truly enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “How did I forget to rate this great place?”
Reviews.Author: Hlavinfun
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 year old son and I visited the Fountains in March 2011 and are going again in ten days. We stayed in a newly remodeled unit not too far from the front of the resort. It was conveniently located near the activities desk, the indoor and outdoor pool areas and the basketball hoops. The 2 BR unit was huge..and it appeared it had JUST been remodeled...almost not completely...everything was new: pillows, lights hadn't been plugged in and there were no wall hangings or decorative items. The tv hadn't been set up yet, but my hubs did that. The kitchen was stocked, and the washer/dryer were a huge convenience. The furniture and beds were comfortable. We were there during some of Orlando's worst storms ever...parks closed, roads closed and flooded, traffic lights not working. Still, we never had power loss in our unit. We enjoyed having so much space to spread out since we were trapped inside. The bar-like restaurant in the common area was mediocre at best because of very very slow service each time we ate there. Perhaps because of the storms they had more diners than usual, but still annoying ot wait so long for average food. One of the reasons we stayed here for 6 nts was the advertised kids activities. Unfortunately, activities for the kids were greatly lacking and the team was not very friendly, flexible or knowledgeable...I suspect they had no bad weather back up plan and were expecting kids to be at the pool. When Spring Break season guests are feeling trapped by the weather, be sure to have lots of fun, non-weather dependent fun things ready...how hard would it have been to give the kids some t-shirts or prizes for a few games, or break out the ice cream cones? Crabby workers mean crabby kids. Closing the bar because the indoor pool was closed was also not a wise move. The area was deemed unsafe to swim (which made sense) but safe enough to play games (like bingo) in that area. Still they said the pool bar is closed if the pool is closed. So silly! A drink or two would have made parents more willing to shell out 20's to the kids for arcade games!! lol We are hoping for better weather this time...the accommodations were a great value and the check in staff was great. Weather permitting, we won't be on property as much this time and won't need the activity center anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Another fun, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bethjos
Reviews.Content: Love the Fountains and will be back again...but...will request the OLD style rooms. Did not enjoy being in Building 10 as it was too far away from the club house and pools. Also we were facing the main road and it was noisy most of the night out our bedroom window. Did not like the new style/decorated rooms. The 2nd bedroom is a little smaller. The master has a beautiful shower basically right in the middle fo the bedroom with no way to take a shower in the mornign without waking up your partner. Also no towel bar near the shower! Weird. The light for the shower area illuminates the entire bedroom, also waking your partner unnecessarily. The master bath was HUGE beyond need. The garden tub is in there but not in the main sleeping area as in the old style where you could relax and watch TV or watch TV while the kids bathed. Too bad. Main living area is a little smaller too which was a shame. Not enough room to sit at the dining table as it was too cramped into the space. Still love having the washer and dryer and kitchen was stocked perfectly. We liked the interior access to the room vs. the outside access at our other visits in bldgs. 5 and 2 but would take exterior entrance to get back the other amenities of bigger living space and more sensible master. Overall, will just request older style rooms going forward and try to get closer to the club house and indoor pool. Still an awesome stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “We Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: awesomeallthetime
Reviews.Content: Checked in Dec 11th and out on Dec 16th. We had a beautiful two bedroom condo with a view of the lake and fountains just outside of our baclony. The staff were extremely friendly, professional and accomodating. The unit was pristine, and we liked it so much we were taking photos on the way out because we didn't want to leave. It was very conveniently located for daily trips to the Disney parks, and for dining at night. This was my third stay at the Fountains, and each time it gets harder to leave. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern, newly remodeled, you will LOVE it!”
Reviews.Author: MiaVal
Reviews.Content: I'm very excited to share my review of The Fountains Resort I had the good fortune to stay at over the Christmas Holiday. The unit I was assigned (Building Three) was just renovated top to bottom including new bamboo floors, ceiling molding, walls, fixtures...everything; nothing went untouched/unreplaced (even the IRONING board)! Granite counters, stainless steel appliances and a glass tile backsplash in the kitchen. Modern fixtures, new neutral colors, three flat screen televisions greet visitors on entrance. Screened balcony off the living area and another balcony off the Masterbedroom, both overlooking Lake Eve and the Seaworld Tower (enjoy viewing the fireworks every night at Seaworld from the Balcony). Large soaking tub replaced the old jacuzzi tubs in the Master baths, separate full shower and water closet. The Guest Bedroom also has a pullout couch to sleep four and private bath. The Livingroom couch also converts to sleep an additional two people for a total of eight people per unit (if needed). Every possible appliance you might need including the instructions for use. There are Security gates to keep the uninvited out, however The Fountains is in a very safe location, away from the heavy traffic on International, but only a few shuttle stops away for all the hub-bub. Lots of activities and amenities on-site to keep guests busy while away from visiting the parks. I did not rent a car, instead took advantage of the I-trolley for a 7-day/$10 pass. It took me everywhere I needed to go when I supplemented it with local shuttle transportation to the parks. Total cost for Christmas week was under $70! The local Publix was walkable, as were a few restaurants. Great Dominican restaurant in the block where the Publix is located, fresh-squeezed orange juice and delicious, flavorful beef dishes. I was allowed in my room early because it was ready and I found the staff very helpful and open. I highly recommend The Fountains and would not hesitate to stay there again. Feel free to email me with any questions. Building Four is currently under renovation, it will be a mirror to the units in Building Three (where I stayed). Frankly I toured the Presidential Suite and can't say I thought it was better than these units except for the private pool table.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Looking forward to coming back!”
Reviews.Author: RetiringAt62
Reviews.Content: We checked in Dec 24 and out on Dec 31. We had a two bedroom condo in building 2. The unit was spacious and had a balcony overlooking the Wakoola Springs pool complex. Everything was pristine - staff was amazingly friendly - from the guards who always gave you a wave as you entered or left the resort to the maintenance staff that always asked if we were having a good time and if we had any problems they could address - one saw us coming down the hall and pushed the button for the elevator so it was waiting for us by the time we got there ! We never passed an employee who didn't ask us how our stay was going. There was even a channel on the TV that made the point that their goal was to be rated all 10's on their survey and to contact them about ANYTHING we had concerns about. Their online survey even offered to forward us to TripAdvisor to make a review after we completed the Fountains' survey. Now that's confidence! Pool facitlies were beautiful! Didn't try any of the restaurants but they looked nice. Resort even has an onsite Domino's - so you didn't have to have a pizza delivered from outside the resort. Unit was great - two bedrooms - one with king - other with 2 queens. Two bathrooms. Full Kitchen with granite countertops. Furniture was in good condition. Tube TV's were beginning to show there age but I understand they are in the process of being replaced by flat screens (2nd bedroom already had one). We'd definitely go back. Although we think we'll skip the week after Christmas next time - the theme parks were so packed that they became basically unusable. Couldn't take more than a few steps without running into someone. Everytime I tried to take a photo someone would step in front before I finished. Waiting lines were all well over an hour - some many hours. The fast pass Disney system was giving out tickets for around 8 pm at noon! They actually had to close several of the parks because they had reached capacity (Magic Kingdom was closed 3 different times on Christmas Day). The Disney Hollywood Studios were even parking folks on one lane of the approach road the day we visited. Traffic was horrible all through the resort area. Since we are now retired, we'll visit before Christmas and leave this week to families with school age children.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 spent Christmas week at this resort and we had a great time here. The 2-bedroom condo (in building 6) is spacious, super clean, nicely decorated and has everything we need for a week. The staff is extremely friendly, the swimming pool is nice and huge, the landscape is very well maintained and lakes/ponds in/around resort are environmentally well maintained. We stayed in some other resorts in Orlando and around country, this is definitely one of the best. Unfortunately, we booked multi-day tickets to theme part so we did not spent enough time in the resort, so I will take my family back there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds- Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: vegascupcakes777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my inlaws last Spring. The brochure was breathtaking so I was excited to get there! The grounds did not disappoint. Check in took a little longer, but it was Spring Break time, so the 15 minutes we waited was understandable. We were housed in building 7. It's at the end of the resort, but perfectly fine because it was quiet and the view was awesome! The resort is at a very good place on I Drive. We walked to Subway, Outback, Publix, 7/11 and the Helicopter tours. It's a rather long walk to get out of the resort, but not bad at all. It's a "gated" resort, so not just anyone can come through the gates and go there. I like the added security. The pools were the best I've ever seen! They have a huge one in the middle of the property. As big as the resort is, it wasn't crowded at all. The bar is great that is beside the pool and you can charge drinks to your room so you don't have to worry about lugging around your wallet. They have ice cream sundaes on special during a certain time for everyone, for $2. I loved it. Sometimes the bartenders gave them to us free. The only bad thing is, this bar closed early. I want to say by 6:00. h20 was okay. We ate there twice. I didn't love it. The drinks were good and strong though. The heated indoor/outdoor pool was nice. It was also open much later than the big pool. The hot tubs were being used everytime we were there so I can't comment on those. The security guards are AWESOME. When people were getting too rowdy or too drunk, they threw them out. You will not be disappointed in this place! The only bad experience we had had nothing to do with the resort. We ended up having some people in the room above us that had a kid that woke up every single morning around 3AM. They weren't paying attention to him because he was bouncing a basketball for a good two hours every morning. We called security every morning and they went and talked to them. They'd knock it off for a half hour or so then be right back at it. The last night it happened, it woke us up at 3:30 AM and since we had to be at the airport at 6, we just stayed up. It was ridiculous, but it wasn't the resorts fault, really. The security guards came fast and tried their best.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TammyKas
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom condos have everything you need. We stayed for the Christmas week and loved it. A grocery store is just down the street along with the outlet mall. The iride trolley system is amazing and it took about 15 mins from our door to Seaworld. The complex is clean, pools are huge and the kiddie pools are great. Would recommend. Really had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “spacious and affordable”
Reviews.Author: lilalubean
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort while visiting Universal studios. We had a 2 bedroom in Bldg 6. It had a large master bedroom with jacuzzi, which was wonderful after a long day of walking through the park. Our girls shared the other bedroom, and also had their own bathroom. The rooms had a great kitchen, that we could easily have cooked in, a big dining room table, and a nice porch with views of the pond with fountains flowing. There were lots of amenities, including grills outside that could be used, multiple pools, outdoor jacuzzi, kids swimming areas and water play areas, games and activities. This is a time share hotel- with tours going on. We took a tour (they said it would last 90 minutes- it lasted about 150 minutes), and they gave us a night free. It is about 15-20 minute drive from Universal studio, but closer to Disney

Reviews.Title: “Great condo rental in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lmbourque
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week early December to see the Disney Christmas shows and relax a little. We were very pleased with the resort and the ammenities. We would certainly return. The pools and hot tubs were great, and there is food, entertainment and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at timeshare resorts for the past 25 years. In fact, we own at 2 Marriotts and 4 Sheratons. The one thing we have learned over the years about timeshares is that even though they are a great value, you have to anticipate and accept some sort of downfall in service. They are just not the same caliber as a hotel. However, we have found the only exception to this rule with The Fountains resort. We celebrated Thanksgiving with 9 people very comfortably in two suites. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The rooms were very clean and well stocked. They have an extremely helpful and friendly staff. We would highly suggest this resort weather your in town to visit the theme parks or just getting together with family.

Reviews.Title: “What and asome time at "The Fountains"”
Reviews.Author: beachbum1998
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at â€œThe Fountains resortâ€� ( Owned and operated by â€œBluegreen Resortsâ€�) in Orlando Florida from October 27th through November 3rd. I would recommend this resort to anyone staying in Orlando for a fun family vacation. The resort is located close to just about every major attraction that Orlando has to offer (Disney, Universal, Discovery Cove, Sea World ectâ€¦) The Resort is made up of 10 buildings with rooms ranging from sleeping 4 people to rooms that sleep up to 10 people. All rooms have a full kitchen, dining room and living room, 1 to 3 bedrooms, and 1 or 2 bathrooms. Also every room has a screened in balcony. Our room was designed to sleep 6 people, and had 2 bathrooms and had a great view overlooking the resort. Very clean and very modern dÃ©cor. The resort has 2 swimming heated swimming pools and daily fun stuff planed for the kids. One of the pools has waterslides and a kiddie pool for the very young and also 2 hot tubs for the adults. This pool also has a restaurant/ bar poolside. The other pool is part indoors and part outdoors and also has a kiddie pool for the very young and 2 hot tubs for the adults (1 indoor and 1 outdoors). The resort also has boat rentals with everything from canoes , paddle boats to pontoon boats. There is also a game room for the kids in the main building and a bar for the adults, a restaurant in the main building. The staff and service at this resort was incredible and we will be sure to visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains during Thanksgiving!! Being there was something to be thankful for. It was incredible!! Our room was amazing, the staff was fabulous, everything about this place is just unbelievable. It will be hard to ever stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDadof4
Reviews.Content: We have visited this Hotel 3 times now and each time we have visited we have consistently found great improvements to the grounds and buildings. What a great hotel this is. The service is excellent, the cleanliness is unbelievable, the staff is friendly and helpful and the pool and exercise room are second to none. The food is also great. I visited once again with my wife and four children (ages 8-14) and, as always, found everything to be absolutely perfect. We will be back again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Have the time of your life at the Fountains Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkinhome
Reviews.Content: The Fountains Resort was truly a wonderful place to stay for our family vacation to Orlando. The staff gets 6 stars for their friendly attitude and pleasant interaction. We never passed an employee who didn't have a smile and cheerful greeting. The staff was superb! The rooms were spacious and well appointed. We had all of the utensils and kitchen ware needed to make most any meal we chose to. The rooms were very clean and inviting. We had one problem with the in room hot tub which was resolved quickly and courteously by on site staff members. The enormous pool with water slides and hot tubs was super and the kids really enjoyed their pool time! The resort offers bbq grills and hammocks, fire pits and loungers for the outdoor inclined. A really lovely setting and not too far from all of the main theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, Greedy Management”
Reviews.Author: Denandkate
Reviews.Content: We I have always loved Bluegreen resorts and were really looking forward to staying at the Fountains, as this was supposed to be one of their finest. I was very disappointed in that, apparently the management thinks they have to squeeze every dime out of their members. You cannot do anything there unless you pay more money! Not even use the internet! We paid for ownership in Bluegreen already and yearly dues on top of this for use of these properties, so this was very offensive. Pools closed to early and for every storm close by. Even after storms were gone the pools were not opened, so the only free thing was not available to us a good part of the time. I was looking forward to going out on the lake but rentals were ridiculously high. I left articles in the room when I checked out. No one was interested in helping me recover them. I would not not go back to this resort. I just felt so cheated. If you have lots of money to throw around then you might enjoy it because facilities and pools are very nice and staff was very nice and worked hard to make us happy.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could hope for in a resort”
Reviews.Author: LM40
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying i purchased this accommodation on ebay for what worked out to be $47 a night !!! Seller was called "redweeks4less" and these are timeshare apartments. We didnt get the hard sell which was appreciated. Stayed here for 2 weeks in a 2 bedroom apartment that slept 8 (1 king, 2 doubles and a double sofa). There were 5 of us and apartment was a perfect size for us. Full kitchen, bathroom, laundry, ensuite and spa were appreciated. Grounds are beautiful and pools were wonderful. Cabanas are available for a daily fee ($50) resort runs daily activities - some have fees. Staff were helpful and polite. Resort has free wifi in the club house which is open till 10pm. Although we were only a 5 minute drive from the entrance of Disney world please be aware that it takes another 15 minutes in the car to actually get to the Disney parks. Universal was about a 20 minute drive away. This resort is enormous and it's a long walk to/from the entrance if you are in one of the further away buildings. The "I ride" trolley stops right out the front of the resort and will stop at most of the places you want to go (trip to Disney and universal will require a change of tram and will take quite a while to get there). Supermarket and outlet mall is 2 trolley stops away. I would recommend staying here to anyone. You would still be getting your money's worth if you pay full price. BUT, before you do check the above mentioned seller on eBay first - it saved me a fortune !!!

Reviews.Title: “Something for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel1147802
Reviews.Content: This property went out of their way to accommodate us due to a mix up that was not theirs but who we booked through. The staff was caring and very professional. The property is immaculate and beautiful. We will definitely be staying there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly adequate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaChic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains Bluegreen resort in Orlando because we had some timeshare points to use. We were a little disappointed that our unit did not look like the one featured in the Bluegreen magazine. But it was roomy and clean with some wear on the furniture and decor. The balcony was screened in and overlooked a little pond. The master bedroom was large but lacked space to put things. There was no dresser and very limited counter space by the sink. We moved in a bench from the second bedroom. Check in and out was quick and convienient. Bluegreen owners beware of the hard sell pitch to "review what's new". The kitchen had two packs of coffee - but they were out of additional packs of decaf to purchase. The resort is an easy 10 minute drive to Walt Disney World and a large grocery store is close by. Overall, it was an adequate place to stay but nothing outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay at the fountions”
Reviews.Author: wegedog
Reviews.Content: only stayed here for two days but loved it, stayed in building six close to both pools, it was mid week when visting checked in around noon no problem, only hassle was getting the parking pass , but not to painful when we told them no on owner updates ,as owners one of the nicest resorts we visted so far ,room was clean kitchen was well stocked with pots and pans, beds were comfortable , they are currently remodeling building four , number six could use some new flat screens but not that bad to stay in

Reviews.Title: “Great Week at Bluegreen !”
Reviews.Author: sattnan
Reviews.Content: Spent the week here 9/30-10/7. We are Wyndham owners and exchanged for the week here thru RCI. We arrived at 4pm, which is their chrck-in time "start". They didn;t get 5 stars from me becasue my room wasn't ready. This to me would be the beginning of off season, the resort could not have been at 30 percent capacity which to me means....be ready for me to check in at 4pm. They told us they would give us a call when the room was ready so off to Publix we went to get our supplies for the week. We returned at 5:30, with out having received a call that our room was ready...but we did get checked in. There apparently is a resort fee of about 11.75 a day that we did not have to pay. We are not owners here, we had exchanged but apparently the fee is only assessed to those who rent independently. You are then sent to Guest Services to pick up your parking pass...and of course be asked to attend a breakfast meeting...remember...this is a timeshare. If you are not interested simply tell them that. We indicated we were not interested and not once the entire week did we receive a phone call or a flyer slipped under our door. We were placed in Bldg 10, on the 3rd floor. If I HAD to find something to complain about it would be the pool view from my balcony was blocked by the tree tops :) Great 2 bed 2 bsth unit with absolutely anything you need. No complaints. The pool area by Bldg 10 was quite large, and becasue it was off season, hundreds of available loungers, tables, chairs and umbrellas. There were cabanas available for rent...we passed on that....it was 2 loungers and a box fan. Cabannas at the Hilton by the Convention Center were filled with furniture, ceiling fans, a flat screen tv and a fridge, fruit, water and a Cabana Boy named Jay. So...again we passed on the Cabanas here. There is a pool bar, a place to order food, temp tattoos, hairbraiding, water slides for the kids, kiddie pool are, DJ, games, and a little store to sell every nice weather related item you forgot. There is a second pool..smaller and heated.. that we visited closer to Bldg 2 also. We decided Bldh 10 was the plae to be...Bldhs 2 and 4 were close to the smaller pool. Looked to me like everyone else needed to walk quite a bit to get to either of these pools. I am not interesed in that with a bunch of bags and kids in tow :) We spent all out time at the pool...we were not here for the Disney experience....Typhoon Lagoon and Downtown Disney were it for us. The days we did go there....boom....4 minute ride, right around the corner. This really is a great location to Disney, the Outlet Malls and every restaurant you can imagine. I get so frustrated when someone leaves a negative review and focuses on the timeshare piece. Guess what folks...this is a timeshare...they will ask you to attend a meeting, owner or not. They are not going to change your sheets everyday or empty your garbage. If you can't handle doing that for a week I would suggest you spend your week in a 1 room hotel room. That said...we would absolutely go back !

Reviews.Title: “Avoid building/tower #4 at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun724
Reviews.Content: We are owners at another resort in Orlando and traded through RCI to book this vacation. We were disappointed to say the least with our room accomodations! The rooms in building 4 have not been remodled since it's building in 1998 and the decor shows. It is in every way in need of a remodel/rennovation. My kids ages 9 and 10 had to share a bed in the front bedroom as they didn't have twin beds - not fun to say the least. Every time we tried to get results, all we heard was excuses. They said that the rennovation was postponed a year later than expected. Well my question is why would you postpone rennovations at one of your number one resorts, especially at the most requested vacation destination - Orlando. This is suppose to be a gold crown resort, however, this is the worst gold crown we have stayed at based on the room and accomodations. I wish we could have been moved into another room, however, we had to wait yet another day to talk to a manager. We gave up and checked out early. I would give this resort another try but also make sure that had a newly rennovated room for an enjoyable vacation. Do not stay in building 4 until at least fall of 2012 when rennovations are expected to be started.

Reviews.Title: “Great family rental space with more amenities than you can do in 1 trip!”
Reviews.Author: RN4FL
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Blue Green resort. Our family of 6 had more than enough room in the 2 bedroom, 2 bath, full kitchen villa. We were in building 6 on the ground floor. Lovely layout in the villa. They are available for nightly rental or time share. Unlike most time share properties, they ask only 1 time @ check-in if you want to attend a property meeting to join. No pressure! We passed this stay. The pools are a great draw for families. They have a large recreation pool are with 2 water slides, a children's sprinkled area, as well as a zero entry sprinkled western themed large play are less than 3 ft deep. Then they have pool basket ball area, long board pool lesson area, as well as 3 or 4 other main entrances to this multiple clover shaped pool fun. Also in this area are rentible cabanas. Pool side massages, hair braids, food drinks & a wonderful children's DJ/ free activities director. Then they also have an indoor/ outdoor pool in the main club house, where there is a 2nd children's play sprinkle pool, 2 hot tubs, a stream room & a sauna. In site lots of dinning choices as well as a publix grocery store a few minutes drive away to stock the full service in room kitchen. A fun time was had by our entire family!

Reviews.Title: “Regular Visitor but as owner avoid updates unless you wish to spend!!”
Reviews.Author: BRIANCAMPBELL
Reviews.Content: Having visited this location since 1999 as owner at Oasis Lakes now known as the Fountains, I cannot fault this location or surroundings as they are both unbelievable. On arrival we received the normal welcoming however were advised to go along to the 60 minute owners update meeting so we could be updated on the new locations available to my family through Bluegreen. We were assured that this would not be a sales pressured meeting due to our status however on attending we were constantly offered reduced incentives attempting to get us to agree to paying a vast amount of money. Apart from this the quality of the pools,accomodation, surroundings including barbecue areas, hammocks, variety of sport facilities, staff friendlieness and helpfullness well exceed this negative issue. Do not expect to be able to socialise at Bar areas after 10pm as they will be more than likely closed.; The location of the Fountains is well serviced by the I Ride Trolley and the Lynx Buses 8 and 42 so do not feel the need the need to have a car to benefit this facility. The Fountains are a location well worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Family Resort :-)”
Reviews.Author: stitch440
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four ( we have a 12 and 2 yo daughters). I don't want so sound redundant but the pools are great. We stayed at the Bldg #3, 3rd floor. The room/condo was amazing. Everything was new from beautiful wooden floors to a top notch full kitchen with everything that you might need to bring friends and family if they live in the Orlando area. The building #3 has his own pool with an indoor pool area with a bar and it's tailored for the entire family. It has a small kiddie pool right next to it, they also have kayaks, water sporting stuff like water volley ball, and those fancy floating swans where couples paddle in their beautiful lake. Our room had a BEAUTIFUL view to that lake which was perfectly aligned with the sunrise on every Florida morning (I enjoyed it with a warm cup of coffee as I watched the birds from the full balcony where it had a full size table and sun chair. This balcony has screens so don't worry about any bugs. Be advised that the main pool of the Fountains is located in the center of the resort, and I tell you its quite a view (I will post pictures of it). All parks are within a few miles from the resort and yes we visited all of them for 50 bucks a pot with those discouted tickets at the mobil station (no issues to report on the tickets) :-) After visiting the Disney parks and Universal we all agreed to stay on the main pool the final two days and there was no need to go to Sea World because the kids just loved the main pool areas. Over all it was great, the staff members were also very attentive and no buggin you to go to any "time share brieffings" since we are a military family and used the AFVC, they have great deals for us military and retired personel :-) If interested just google afvclub. Hope this little review helps out and hope that you guys enjoy as much as we did ...now let me post our pics :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend family get away!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsgatorbranch
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. The staff ask if I wanted to do the timeshare presentation, when I said no they were not pushy. The Resort grounds are beautiful!! The pools were clean and large. My kids loved the waters slide's, the lady in charge of saftey ( she's not a life guard) was wonderful and patient with all the kids!! The rooms are super clean! Very spacious!! The master suite bed way comfy!! I loved that there weren't any comforters, just many sheets. ( I hate those comfoters that you know arent washed) Tons of Linens in the room along with extras in the closets. The washer, dryer and kitchen where WONDERFUL. They supplied paper towel, toilet paper, dishwashing detergent and laundry detergent.We had aa beautiful view of the pond and fountains!!We loved our stay and will def be back, and next time I might even listen to the timeshare presntation, because I would actually love to own a unit!! If you are traveling with your family and want a comfortable and home like place to stay with lots of luxuries....This is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family resort, great rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: S_Florida05
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (includes one teen and one tween). The resort pools are great for kids with the main pool having a large waterslide. Also, the workout gym has new equipment. The room we stayed in was recently remodeled with marble countertops and stainless steel appliances. The resort does have a "treasure" hunt that my tween enjoyed. There are also family BBQ grills available for cook-outs. The resort also has on-site dining which we did not try. The resort is close to several area restaurants and the Orlando Premium Outlet mall. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We have stayed in several resorts in the Orlando area and this is definitely one of the best,

Reviews.Title: “love this place, satisfied with last 6 visits over 6 year span!”
Reviews.Author: rcrsteph
Reviews.Content: Pools are awesome, accomodations on 2BR are huge, clean and very comfortable, I would highly recommend, in fact will be staying again this weekend to make a trip to Disney & SeaWorld (VERY close to Sea World parks).

Reviews.Title: “3rd time close but less than a charm”
Reviews.Author: apaulowe
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time to the Fountains. We had a variety of annoyances and hassles this time around that we hadn't had to deal with in previous trips. However, for the most part it was an enjoyable stay. The director of housekeeping, Thomas, was extremely helpful and understanding when I talked to him about what he referred to as "challenges" that we experienced at the hotel. The rating is honestly more a comparison to previous stays at the resort. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Space to breathe”
Reviews.Author: MikeWNewport_Uk
Reviews.Content: after 2 weeks the four of us (16 to 61 age group) in a car we were looking forward to some space, well we got it. Perfect layout, seperate bedrooms and plenty of living space, nice balcony and well managed site but again so many rules you alwyas needed your glasses with you. The fact that there is no breakfast included adds $10 a day to the cost effectively but the quality of the room AND the fact that you had printed english papers free by 1000 was worth it. Someone shoot the ducks on the lake though early morning .....they also sometimes forget to switch the Sauna on in the morning while the steam room thermostat had afiled but it helped clear my sore throat in 15 mins...

Reviews.Title: “Just Awesome - We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Jill W
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, great location and the staff was very accommodating. Our room was beyond our expectations, we wanted to move in for good. A lot of activities for the kids. Very centrally located to the parks and attractions. Fun for the whole family, great DJ on the weekends that took us on a trip down memory lane with his selection of music. (Great job DJ Bob) our kids loved him.

Reviews.Title: “All 5 Star ratings for the Fountains Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Ginnysang
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned from the Fountains in Orlando, Florida. We are from the NYC area and stayed there for 8 nights (Reservation #3963656) with our children. We had a very pleasant experience from the beginning to the end. We enjoyed the pools, the Club House and all the other amenities. Our villa had everything that we needed, were very spacious for a family of six, and all the appliances were new. It was like a home away from home. The staff provided excellent service, were very attentive and attended to all our requirements, from the extra towels, dining table, etc. The children loved the pools and extra activities at the Club House. I must mention Marina, Margaret and Carmen. Marina was quick in putting us through to reservations when I called to explain that we might have to adjust our schedule due to the weather conditions that would affect our departure. Margaret was very understanding and added one more day stay even at the same original rate of the initial reservation. Similar places would have been quick in charging us even more for the added stay. Carmen at the Club House would see us walk in and immediately make us our cups of coffee right away. By the way the coffee is complimentary, is delicious and an added touch; and a newspaper to go with it as well. We truly loved our vacation! In general, enjoyed our stay at the Fountains Resort and would love to return next summer!

Reviews.Title: “great stay again”
Reviews.Author: tessy28
Reviews.Content: we were now the fourth time at the fountains and everything was great again,from the friendly staff to the rooms,we stayed in Building 2 on the 6 floor for 8 days, the villas were beautiful and well maintained, really good food and not expensive,the cleanest grounds to our Florida trip.This is by far the best Resort we have stayed. A great Bluegreen resort property

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JennaAndJosh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in a good location to many attractions and resources. The villas were beautiful and well-maintained. The pools were also stunning. The entire place ran smoothly and was very relaxing. All staff incredibly friendly, even the time-share sales folks. Looking forward to my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Fountains and will be back...”
Reviews.Author: JoJo725
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Fountains August 13 - August 19 with family. Upon check-in our room was automatically ready and when we walked into the condo (Building #3) it was beautiful! All the rooms were modern and spotless. I had no problem hooking up my laptop and it worked like a charm the entire time. The resort itself is quite large and beautiful. The staff were very helpful and pleasant at all times. The resort is located on International Drive and we took the trolly whereever we needed to go (one way $1,25 can't go wrong). I thought the prices for food and drinks at the resort were reasonable and pretty good; especially the burgers and I can't forget that awesome potato salad!!!! We had a great stay at The Fountains and are already considering going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “"MAG NIF I CENT"”
Reviews.Author: Georget R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all Westgate Resorts, Vista Cay and Floridays and this is by far the best we have found our home in Orlando. Activities, activities, fun, friendly staff no need to leave the grounds most definitely my number one in Orlando. I can't stop thinking and talking about it no doubt about it I we have found it everything in one.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: bethjos
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Fountains! Kids-3, 9, 11-want to LIVE here. Pools are clean and fun. Rooms are awesome, updated, clean, with living space for all. You can save lots of money by cooking your own meals in the full kitchen and doing your own laundry in the facilities in room. So close to Publix, restaurants and all the parks. Very close to Sea World. Nice, safe area. Gated. We look forward to going back every fall. See you Fall 2011 Fountains!!!

Reviews.Title: “second time round and still as good”
Reviews.Author: Bar200
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at this resort hotel and it will definetly not be our last. The resort itself is huge with indoor/outdoor pools, water slides, small water park for younger kids, restuarants bars, BBQ areas and much more. The area is constanly being maintained and upgraded and constantly being cleaned from dawn till dusk.If you wish to use a BBQ, you make a call at the nearby phone and they come to clean and light the BBQ. The whole feel is that you are on holiday (vacation) and that they staff are there to do everything for you. We went for early morning and late evening walks to feed the huge turtles that live in the lake. We travelled with a 15,14 & 9 year old and all had a fantastic time. The apartments are huge with 2 double beds in the second bedroom alone, this also has its own bathroom. The kitchen area is well equipt as we cooked in it a lot. I can highly recommend The Fountains for familys.

Reviews.Title: “If you head to Orlando this is a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug6476
Reviews.Content: If you are in Orlando for anything remotely related to Disney this is an ideal hotel area to stay in. It's location can't be beat as well as the staff, the daily planned activities and the rooms. Although it was completely crowded while we were there the pool(s) are big enough to accommodate the amount of guests staying there. The only complaint would be the level of music out by the main pool (waaaay too loud).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a hit, but a few misses”
Reviews.Author: JKobr
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two boys (4 and 9) and I stayed here along with another family July 23-30th. Our stay was in connection with attending a timeshare seminar where the owners of the property, BlueGreen, had us attend a 3 hour sales presentation (although they originally told us 90-120 minutes max). The hotel itself is nicely situated, a short drive to all the major attractions (Disney, SeaWorld, Universal, etc) as well as close to shopping and restaurants. The hotel room itself had all the amenities that we both expected and needed for a family with kids - two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen and washer/dryer. Grocery stores were nearby which allowed us to stock up with drinks and food at a fraction of the price we'd pay inside the parks. And served as perfect spot to enjoy breakfast in our rooms as opposed to having to get up and out before breakfast service ended in a restaurant. The ability to do our own wash meant we could pack less items (wash and re wear them) plus doing a couple of loads the day before leaving meant coming home with next to no dirty clothes. Fast and easy to unpack. The grounds were very nice, lots of green space, well manicured, flowing lakes and clean. The pools were outstanding. It was very hot when we were down, but the pools were mini water parks in their own, plus on nights when at the hotel, we swam until the pools closed at 10pm. Our concerns were around our check in and the low level of organization and customer understanding that was applied. When we made the booking over 6 weeks prior to arriving, we advised we wanted both families to be in the same building (believe there were 8-10 five storey buildings in all). We arrived at 4:30, a half hour after 4pm check in, to find both of our families rooms were not ready. With check out time being 10am, we found it surprising that 6 hours later the rooms were still not ready. We were one of MANY families who we saw questioning this situation, we witnessed some families complaining loudly about still waiting for over 2 hours. The check in staff was not rude, but at the same time, not displaying an elevated degree of concern that our rooms weren't ready. They were quite indifferent about the situation, and advised us they'd call us when the room was ready. We left the hotel, only to be called 15 minutes later on our mobile phone to say room was ready. We went back to check in, to find out just one room was ready. We left, 15 minutes later, get call 2nd room is ready. We go back.. but room is in seperate building. Wait another 15 minutes while they fix that. I don't understand why instead of having us run back and forth, they couldn't just give us our room number and keys but advise us the room wouldn't be ready until "x" time. Very unorganized and frustrating, especially after just going through a day of traveling. The room itself had all the amenities were wanted, but the furnishings were very out of date. Not dirty, but dated and stale looking. Conversly, the other buildings and sales display rooms were immaculate with new and updated kitchen cabintry, electronics, carpets & tiles and furniture. Example, we had dull pine cabintry, faded countertops and old TVs with the huge backs on them. The sales room had dark rich cabintry, granite countertops and flat panel TVs throughout. Our bathrooms were clean, but all the tubs had huge hard water stains. The water itself was on the smelly side and tasted awful. We had to use bottled water to brush and rinse our teeth. When we told the timeshare people that the room was not as advertised, they told us our building (number 4) was the only building that hadn't yet been updated with new furnishings, but not to worry about our future visits. I told them this was not a strong sales pitch, telling me "I know the room is not what we promised, but trust us, it will next time". I advised them they have one chance to sell me, and they blew it. I found it odd they would make this mistake, setting some one up in an old and tired building when you are trying to sell them on their 5 star world wide accommodations, but again attribute it to a young and inexperienced front desk check in staff. Would I return? No. Would I recommend it to others? Yes, but with a warning. not. WHile I enjoyed our time there, I will stay with a better known and trust worthy name in Hotel suites such as Marriott or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT! WE'RE ALREADY PLANNING OUR RETURN!”
Reviews.Author: courtneylynn65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited in Feb. and absolutely loved our stay! The staff was very inviting and the rooms were gorgeous! We are already planning on coming back later in the year!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: Jaylasmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an awesome rate that was offered to us while we were at the Bass Pro Shop. I think we got to stay 5 nights for $200.We did have to sit through the sales pitch of them trying to sell you the timeshare to get that rate. This place has awesome pools that the kids will love and also has games to play and activities. I would say the only downside is some of the rooms are very dated. The room we got was obviously not updated in awhile. It had big old tvs and outdated decorations. Other than that, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “HATED THE PLACE, IT YOU LIKE TO HAVE FUN AVOID THIS PLACE.”
Reviews.Author: dougbrit2222
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at this place. We used our time share and booked two rooms. Most upscale resorts have swim up bars for their guest. This one did not. That is not the problem. This resort actually had security guards walking around the pools telling guest they were not allowed to bring drinks in the pool......or near it!!!! They stated your cups had to be 6 feet away. This was not drinks in bottles or glasses. It was plastic cups. To make the drinking environment even worse is the fact that the pool area is huge and they do not have cocktails servers. The pool closed at 11:00pm. We did not have a problem with that either. However we were sitting outside the pool at a table talking. Just talking, 4 adults. They kicked us out of the pool area. NOthing like catering to your guest. Appartently you have to go to bed at 11PM and cant be outside. We are in our 40's and felt like this resort was being runned and had policies of a senior citizen housing complex. We haved stayed in other resorts in Disney, Universal, Disney Village and the Orlando area. NEVER have we had a hotel with such ridiculus rules. We will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Besides the Great Pool, what is there?”
Reviews.Author: Tachybana
Reviews.Content: Stayed during 6/27 - 7/2. Got an amazing deal (full week and 2x - 7 Day Tickets to Universal Studios) to sit through the 90 MInute sales pitch (they do a tremendous job to sell you a timeshare. Funny how the systems has gone from weeks to a Points system. At the end of the day is all about the kids. Do take your time (you only have 90 minutes) to figure how if you can shell all that dough. When we arrived there from a long drive from New York, the staff was very courteous. Got there early and was able to check into my room within 15 minutes. The room was a bit dated (as were the TV Units, but then again we weren't going to hang too much on the rooms to watch). The A/C worked on 75% of the suite. Had my kids sweating for 2 days out because some how the unit would not vent to their room (check the a/c unit once you check in). The kitchen was okay (had all the utensils and pots needed. We enjoy cooking on our trips). The fridge rattled on and off for a few days (call maintenance for this. funny how it would come back to normal once they showed up) The bathrooms were okay. Warning! when checking in, immediately check the master bath. I had an issue in where a horrible smell was venting from the Master Bathroom's Shower. Ended up turning up the vent fan the whole time i was there till the smell would go away. The bedding. Warning! I strongly suggest to immediately check your bedding. I found the sheets on both the bed to be stained and dirty looking (regardless of whether they smelled nice or not). The hotel area was beautiful. Lots of green and fresh air and clean all over. The pools are the highlights of this place. They have a massive pool (can't recall the name) in where they have a slide (kids of all ages will have a blast with this), as well as a play area. Plenty of beach chairs (and if you dont' want to sit out in the sun there are rental of tents). In addition on the other side of the hotel there is a covered pool (also a portion of it sits outside and it is heated) with a walk up-to bar (good drinks). My family is a tennis family and found it a bit of a downer when we noticed they didn't have a tennis court in the hotel. We were told they had one nearby in another affiliated hotel (which as guests we could use). Drove for 15 minutes to get there and ridiculously it was shared with a basketball court. Every serve and forehand was interrupted by other players in the basketball end. Booooo downer. The hotel was right along International Drive in the event want to take the family walking in the Boulevard. I found to be extremely close to Disney and Universal Studios (10 minutes no traffic) and Also a Publix Supermarket 5 minutes out in case you want to get your groceries. Overall our experience was really nice for the price we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some things need some work”
Reviews.Author: Huskerfootball
Reviews.Content: To start, it is a lovely place. But, one would think the hours for the bars, pools, and slides would be more user-friendly for the high Rex season of mid-July. We were never sure what bar was open at one time. There was no rhyme or reason for the bars' hours. It appears they didn't schedule staff very well and just closed down. They were not on the same page with resort drink specials. With one bartender, one could get a drink special and then not get the same special from the next person. Isn't it all the same resort? And what is with the wallops bar closing before 8? The pool areas are wonderful, but the slides close at 7. Really? It is summer, and many people get to the resort from the attractions- perfect time for the kids to use the slides. Not when they close so early!
