So, beautiful place in great location, but as an owner who is paying big money, keep the pools and bars open AND lower the booze and food prices!! Needs some adjustments and then it'd be incredible!!

Reviews.Title: “20th anniversary fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: deedee11Scotland
Reviews.Content: condo with 2 rooms, each with private bathrooms and spa bath, we shared with another couple, big balcony overlooking the lake with loungers supplied, kitchen with washer,dryer,large fridge freezer, cooker, micro and ice maker, lounge 2 huge couches which we hit after a long day!, we stocked the fridge with water and juice from the supermarket although there are machines in the landings, our condo was pre-re furbishment but was still excellent, large tv with information channel,air con, private resort, beautiful pool especially to jump straight in after the parks, towels supplied, lovely bubble spa and bar, quiet terrace area if you prefer, all in all a great place with lovely staff and imaculate would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: dciffarelli
Reviews.Content: Loved the pools! Our 2 bedroom/2BA condo overlooked the indoor/outdoor pool in building 6. Our room was recently renovated with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, 42" flat screen tv's in bedrooms and kitchen/living room area. Outdoor screened balcony overlooked the pool which was beautiful view too of Lake Eve. Busy at night though so if you like it quiet, don't choose this one. Hardwood floors throughout condo were beautiful! Queen size bed in master suite- Tempur pedic bed which if you enjoy this mattress would be great. We are used to the Sleep Number. Both the indoor/outdoor and the 75,000 sq ft pools were very clean! Only time we saw anything in the pool was after strong rain showers! Hot tubs were nice but they could use 1 more of them at both pools as they were always full. Also, would suggest they get another ping pong table for the indoor/outdoor pool. It would be great if they could come up with another method for using the amenities at the resort. Instead of leaving a cash deposit or leaving your drivers license with an attendent for using ping pong paddles, basketball, etc-- perhaps getting the person's room # or scan their card somehow?? There were lots of planned activities daily at resort.. we didn't participate however.The internet fee of $5/day for using your own laptop was very reasonable compared to some other resorts. Otherwise you can use hotel computers for a fee. We did use theirs to print out our boarding passes. We purchased a $5 card to access our airline and then it's $.75 to print too, but cheaper than printing at airport! We were not impressed with the initial greeting we received upon check-in. The lady at front desk was not personable at all. It was our first visit to The Fountains, where we are owners, thinking we would get some information and a welcome to our resort.. it was rather disappointing. We asked about checking in prior to the 4 pm and she asked if we were aware of check in time? Also, we explained in booking almost a year ahead, we asked about a room overlooking the pool. She was unable to tell us where we might be. We simply didn't get that 5 star resort customer service from this lady. We ended up having someone else help us.. as the first room we were given was definitely not acceptable! It was an older room and it overlooked the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Tammys3monsters
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort is great! All of the staff are very polite, upbeat. Everytime you pass a bluegreen employee they always say "hi", "how are you"! There's so much to do right on site from swimming in 1 of the 3 pools, 1 which has a water slide which is fun for all ages!! Hanging out at the club house which has lots of video games, or enjoying a drink by the bar! There's daily activities for the kids! the rooms are amazing, everything is very high tech and up to date, very clean and just plan beautiful! We had a great time here and will be back very soon!! Thanks for making our 1st time in Orlando awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice will be back”
Reviews.Author: tclark85
Reviews.Content: Booked online so we did not know what to expect. Turned out great. Things you should know but should not be a problem. No maid service unless you pay extry. Must take out your own trash. This was no problem for us but some people my not like this. We were here for the parks so we did not have a lot of time to enjoy the resort but you could spend your whole time here and have a wonderful vaation. This is a resort so they try to get you to go to a sales presentation but we told them that we did not have time and they did not press the issue and did not hassle us trying to sale us on the resort. They charge a resort fee of a $11.75 a day. this includes internet and discounts on food a and activities. Nice landscaping. Enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: khler
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious rooms, awesome outdoor and indoor pool w/ pool bar! We celebrated our daughter's birthday in one of the villas and they accomodate our request for a room on the ground floor. The only annoying thing was the timeshare people calling our room every 30 minutes even at 7:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains - a Fabulous Resort Experience”
Reviews.Author: foodwinechickie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a newly remodeled 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom condo at The Fountains and absolutely loved the experience. The unit was beautifully appointed, both luxurious in look and feel yet comfortable and fully stocked with every amenity an active family could want. From the spa tub, to the huge walk-in shower, to the high-end kitchen appliances, to the washer and dryer, we had all and more than we could need. Milk, cereal, eggs and bread (from a nice walk-in distance grocery store - Publix) saved us from going out to breakfast everyday and snacks and adult beverages kept us on site for happy hour. There are two pools to enjoy, but the one we were near was the newer facility with kiddy water park and water slides for older kids and adults. Towel service and a tiki bar were nice touches. Great resort for families with young children or with teens and would also be a nice couples getaway with the split bedrooms. The 5 and 7-year old in our party enjoyed the pool at the resort as much as the theme parks!

Reviews.Title: “$511.00 a month and no coffee”
Reviews.Author: Bishop59
Reviews.Content: customer service was sparse-- I don't feel that for what I pay for my membership I should have to pay for one packet of coffee a day.. I hurt my toe on the bottom of the main pool. My room was outdated and had a poor layout.. The stove had been taken apart and left that way when we arrived, we could only use part of the burners Use of pool towel was bothersome. .

Reviews.Title: “A few highlights, a few disappointments.”
Reviews.Author: kschwend
Reviews.Content: The pros: The pool areas were very nice. Our children are 6 and 9, and had a blast swimming and listening to the music and DJ in the afternoons. They had trivia and games that were enjoyable for all ages. They also encourage recycling - which for me is very important. We have stayed at about 10 different resorts in the Orlando area and this was the first one which actually made recycling on the grounds easy, as well in our room. The nighttime activities were also enjoyable. The cons: We are owners who had never stayed at the resort. (Don't expect any perks for becoming an owner, btw..) We circumvented the owner's breakfast pitch pretty easily, and got our room keys right away. BUT, they put us in a room with 2 beds. My kids do not sleep well in the same bed, as I am sure most don't. It took quite a while to move us to another unit, which was in a newer building, (#6) but the floor plan was TINY. We have been in many resorts in the Orlando area, never have we stayed in a unit so small. Not only that, it was filled with very sharp metal furniture. I stopped counting how many scrapes and bruises we got trying to move around each other. To get wi-fi, we had to buy a card for $12/day. This card also got you 2 free small coffees/day, a newspaper, 15% off resort activities/drinks/food, and free local phone calls. When I checked out, I noticed phone calls were billed to our room, so asked to have them removed. SOME calls placed in the Orlando area are free local calls, OTHERS are not, I was told. We were supposed to peruse the manual in our room to figure that out on our own. I thought that was a cheap shot, for the money we paid up front. I was VERY allergic to the sheets on our bed. This has never happened to me before. I had to go to a local walk-in clinic and get a shot of cortisone, followed by a prescription of prendisone. At first, the person my husband spoke to said there was nothing she could do, but when I called back and asked to speak to a supervisor, they jumped into action. Security came and took a statement and photos. They sent a housekeeper over who washed sheets and towels in a laundry soap that we purchased, then she re-made the bed. It was annoying to me to have to turn in pool towel cards to get pool towels, as well as give your ID and a cash deposit on anything you wanted to borrow. (Bean bags for games, etc.) These things take away from the vacation environment and make you feel like they don't trust you. They also upcharged for most activities. Over-all, as an owner, I'm not really impressed. We have been to many other resorts better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Collar, slightly above average, fits the bill”
Reviews.Author: dkaoufkeiythakid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains the first week of Jun 11. The accomodations were nice, clean, more than suitable, family oriented. Most of the residents appeared blue collar. We'd stay there again, but would prefer something a step up from The Fountains. The scheduled activities were great events, especially the Tie Die T-shirts. The aracade is your typicle rip-off. My 6-year old really enjoyed the Treasure Hunt.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay ~ 2nd visit and just as good as the 1st...”
Reviews.Author: Wokkoone
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, all pre-stay requests met ~ high floor with a pool view in block 8 (one of the latest to be built). Good standard of cleanliness, no hassle to view the ownership packages, and absolutley nothing to moan about ~ other than you dont get housekeeping for free... Would stay again for sure ~ if you want a home from home experience with all of the facilities such as three beds, a bubble tub, fully fitted kitchen with a lovely lounge, big TV`s and patio area then you cant fault it. Booked through TravelRepublic at an excellent rate.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sarataylor76
Reviews.Content: This place was one of the most beautiful places we have ever stayed at, everything was perfect. The people were great, the grounds were beautiful and 2 awesome pools along with a few hot tubs too. I would recommend it to anyone, especially for people with children. There are plenty of activities for them to do along with separate pools for them. Perfect time of year to go, weather was great and the resort was not crowded at all just the right amount of people. Very convenient location to attractions, shopping and restaurants. I would rate it 5 out of 5 and if we had the opportunity we would definately stay there again. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable, you all do a great job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Palacial”
Reviews.Author: funkytown6755
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Fountains for 2 gorgeous nights in Orlando, took the tour of the place, had a wonderful 2 bedroom suite and enjoyed the quiet. Ate our meals in the room, enjoyed the jacuzzi tub and relaxed! We'll be back someday with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great, fun family atmoshphere”
Reviews.Author: f1onvixens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April with 2 children. We were very skeptical at first, but after we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. THere were endless amounts of activities, everyone was very friendly, and made you feel welcome immediately. It really is a great value - less tha $150/night! The rooms were so big, plenty of room for the entire family. The pool is a must, it's practically a waterpark. the kids had a blast. We'll definitely be coming back to The Fountains, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Refreshing, Awesome Pools”
Reviews.Author: cab8285
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Fountains. We were in Bldg 8 which has not been renovated but was still in good shape. The furnishings were nice and the room was clean. We had a large balcony that overlooked a small water area not far from Wakoola Springs pool. Would not recommend the H2O or Water's Edge restaurants as they are close to the indoor pool and arcade area and very loud. The grill at Wakoola Springs was very good but closed early as we were there in early May. The pools were very nice and there was a lot going on for all ages. Do not waste your money on the trolley down International Drive as it stops at all the parks and takes forever to get anywhere. There is ample parking for restaurants and shopping if you drive. The resort does charge additional fees for most of the activities. Grills were very nice and the evening fire pits were very relaxing. You will hear music from the pool until 11:00 no mater what building you are in. Bldgs 6 and 7 are pretty far from both pools and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Opal77
Reviews.Content: We checked out immediately. The furniture was ripped and run down, it was dark and depresssing, the beds looked broken and on top of it no maid service (sorry I am on vacation the one timed I don't have to make beds). I requested on my reservation early check in and pool view. We had to wait until 4pm for check in and no pool view, I am not even sure where it was. Once we saw the condition of the "deluxe suite" I called the front desk and told them that the room was unacceptable, they agreed but that there was nothing they could do about it and that the renovated rooms were for the owners. We checked out and they had nothing to say about it, not an apology or anything, like they deal with it all the time. Do not stay here! Now at the time we went everything in orlando was booked, we ended up going to the Carribe Royal who had availability luckily and it was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: DessertsDivaFL
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. From the friendly staff to the fully equipped rooms to the first class clubhouse to the clean and secure surroundings. You can't go wrong here. We stayed in Building 3 which was perfect. Yes, it is a timeshare resort. We got the package through Bass Pro Shops. So glad we did because is was well worth it! We did the timeshare tour but didn't buy as this did not fit our needs for the time being. Maybe down the road it will. We think everyone should try this resort at least once. You'll be glad you did. If you want to see more photos of this resort (I took over 20) you can friend me on Facebook "Danielle Mulkey" in Cape Coral FL. Just message me that you saw this on Trip Advisor. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra4_11
Reviews.Content: We were in building #3 - the room far exceeded our expectations. The grounds were well maintained, the pools were great. The location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great space for a family”
Reviews.Author: mommyjennifer
Reviews.Content: We travelled to The Fountains over spring break with our family of five (kids 9,6, and 1). We loved the spaciousness of the 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom suites. We were able to go to the grocery store and pick up breakfast and snacks for the week (being on vacation, I refuse to cook full meals). The quality of the rooms and furnishings were also very high. Huge walk in shower with a separate whirlpool tub in the master bath. We barely used the screened in porch but we did enjoy having it. The grounds of the resort were very nice too and the big pool was gorgeous. Given the choice between an afternoon at the amusement park and an afternoon in the pool both of the older kids picked the pool. We did have a few small issues but I feel that the resort handled them very well. When my daughter's meal came out wrong twice, the kitchen manager came out unsolicited and profusely apologized, got her something different at super speed and gave us $20 in resort bucks to spend during our stay. When one of the kids bumped her head at the pool we went over to the poolisde market and asked for an icebag. Immediately the lifeguard and security people were right there checking on her and I had to fill out and accident report. I thought it was a bit of overkill but they obviously cared and wanted to make sure she was all right. Our one biggest complaint about the resort is that it does not have a dedicated indoor service restaurant. In the clubhouse, up to midafternoon you have to order your food from the snack bar/gift store area and then you can go sit in the lounge to eat. After midafternoon, you order at the bar but then the snackbar'gift store is closed so when I wanted something from the gift shop I had to go to the bar and get someone to come open it up and hover while I quickly looked around. Ther e is also food service at both pools but there you also have to go to the bar to order and then take your food somewhere else to sit down. Of course there are hundreds of restaurants in Orlando, but sometimes we didn't want to have to get in the car again and go find a place to eat. Overall - we loved the spaciousness of the rooms and gorgeous pool.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find one fault!”
Reviews.Author: Juice82
Reviews.Content: Great spacious apartment and really good value. All amenities inclduing washer, dryer, coffee maker, fridge freezer, blender, toaster dishwasher, TV in each room, large jacuzzi bath. Two great pools both with nearby bars. Dominos on site is handy after a long day at the parks. Seaworld is less than 10 mins away and all other attarctions are within easy reach. Not many English visitors so it seems like we were very lucky to stumble across this great resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better and better, 4 stars and great price”
Reviews.Author: wysfam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fountains 4 times in the past 4 years and it just keeps getting better. We have a 6, 14, 17 and 2 grandparents with us. We stayed in 2 condos for the price of one condo in most resorts! You can't beat the space! Love the screen porches, all with great views. Washer/Dryer in the unit great. Bed VERY comfy. Amenities nice and kitchen totally complete. The big pool a little cold but had a great bar, great snack food, cool slides and play area for the kids, tons of chairs and space and this is during spring break, massages available and sun and fun music playing. We actually stayed a whole day just at the resort and it was great fun. We like the indoor/outdoor pool area too and the water a bit warmer. Six blocks from Publix, we saved tons on just 3 breakfasts, easy to rationalize staying here vs. Disney property. 5 minutes from Seaworld, 10 from Universal and 15 from Disney if no traffic. On the downside and just trying to be objective, H20 adult bar now combined with kids arcade space, cheapens it, hope they change that. Kids inside play area too small, no one would really stay there long. Staff very friendly but they don't engage to get you involved, you have to show up at the right time and place for activities. By the pool for instance, announce the activity, it's a big pool and we didn't know where you were doing things. Feels like they hope you won't show up, but if you do, they are quite nice and fun activities. Not much to do on a rainy day. No big areas inside for activities which would have been nice. And the light over the kitchen table is ugly. Ok, see, that's petty but really, this is a very nice resort. I have stayed on Disney property and I would trade the space and the amenities of the Fountains any day over the overpriced, undersized Disney accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: BlackHawkMotel
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to The Fountains. Very nice accommodations for a family of four-six (four in ours). Two bedroom w/ 2 double and king with private bath, plus additonal bath, fully eqipped kitchen with sofa sleeper in the living/dining room. The staff doesn't hound you to take their timeshare tour and will simply ask you when you get your parking pass. Gated resort, nice pool areas with two waterslides, great location to Sea World and Disney, Publix grocery store near by also. A worker taking trash out of the trash room dropped what he was doing and went out of his way to catch the elevator for us. Wi-Fi will cost you 4.95 a day. We hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was terrible at your resort”
Reviews.Author: teamhealth
Reviews.Content: This by far the worst customer service I have ever received. The rep was extremely rude at check in time after checking in at 3:50 PM for a 4:00 PM check in time I was told that my room was not ready and it was not 4:00 PM yet its 3:59 PM. and it a first come first basis and I needed to go in another line for car tag and then wait until we call you to get in another line to pick up keys and room number. I don't mind waiting 10 or 15 minutes for a room but 50 min with very nasty attitude from your custom rep really ruin my day and stay. I will never recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Fountains - quiet and peaceful and near to everything”
Reviews.Author: pvbooster
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 4 nights at the Fountains last week from 3/17/11 â€“ 3/21. We stayed in building 5 on the top floor which I highly recommend for itâ€™s quiet and itâ€™s view. It looks out over the lake (well Iâ€™m from Milwaukee and lake is something a lot bigger to us so itâ€™s more like a large pond) where they have swan shaped paddle boats and one small pontoon with table and chairs. There is apparently good fishing on this lake which is stocked by the state even though itâ€™s privately owned (so no permit is needed). I heard that an 8lb and an 11lb bass have been caught but there is a sign that you have to throw them back when you catch them. Another nice thing about this building is that itâ€™s very close to the clubhouse where the smaller indoor/outdoor pool is (and sauna & steam room and inside hot tub) and bar and restaurant and the fitness center. We never used the fitness center but it seemed to be quite new and have lots of equipment, both for lifting and for cardio. I would guess there were at least 7 or 8 treadmills, 2 or 3 cross trainers and 2 reclining bikes. We ate at the pool and had a wonderful salad of roasted veggies and chicken. We didn't find this pool to be very noisy at all. The buildings on either side of the clubhouse are the two original buildings and are laid out differently than ours but they seemed very nice from the outside. We never cooked so I canâ€™t say anything about the kitchen except we did make a frozen pizza and the oven worked and the microwave worked. The 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo with screened in porch was lovely. The couch and loveseat upholstery could have been more comfortable but when we were there we spent most of our time on the porch. It faced the lake and the east so it was cooler at night. It was kind of strange that we had an older TV in the living room and the Master bedroom but a large flat screen in the second bedroom (???). The master bedroom had a large corner tub in the bedroom which I took advantage of and a large shower in the bathroom. Very nice. We spent one day at the large outdoor pool and it was fine. There was pool service and massages available at the cabanas (need cash or credit card). All In all this was a great place and we had fantastic weather. Itâ€™s about 20 â€“ 30 minutes from Disney but most everything else is too. Itâ€™s closer to Universal and Seaworld but only by about 10 minutes. It's in the middle between those and Disney. We never did find a market on the property but there is a small gift shop for snacks and several snack bars both in the clubhouse and by the big pool.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm your reservation.”
Reviews.Author: ricoMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We booked by phone, but did not get what we had booked (2 br with 2 double beds and 1 king). Our condo had a queen and fold out in the second br. Not ideal for 2 teenage kids. The pullout sofabed was so uncomfortable that we had to buy an inflatable mattress to put on it. The hotel staff offered no help at all for this. Also note that maid service costs $25 per service. We felt the condo, though not that old, was already showing some wear. Carpets were stained and the bathrooms looked like they had some earlier damage.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Gracious_Grace
Reviews.Content: i had a good time in this hotel.I traded through rci and even though they have a ant problem the rooms are great the beds are so comfy.I find you can get great deals if you stay here .Its a great location and on the other side of international drive.I could go on talking about this place any questions send me a message ill help.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains!!”
Reviews.Author: WeLovetheFountains
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fountains the long weekend of Feb 27 and loved every second of it. I went with my husband and son, for our son's birthday and his first trip to Disney World. We got there at 12:00pm, as we only live a few hours away from Orlando. Our room wasn't quite ready, so we walked around the resort, ate at the grill by the main pool and our room was ready by 1:00. Our room was great! And it wasn't even in a renovated building. The absolutely only complaint- the couch was not good, at all, in looks or in comfort. Our son loved that he had his own room with a t.v. We got our things unpacked, which I never do in a regular hotel. I'd brought laundry detergent, dish detergent, etc because I wasn't sure if they would supply it but they did have everything needed. (and I did multiple loads over the weekend; it was nice to come home with clean clothes). We had a great view from the screened in balcony, of the pond and the 3 fountains, palm trees and could just catch a glimpse of Wakoola Springs.Then we went down to Wakoola Springs. It was VERY cold but beautiful! And it was only about 80, 85 degrees outside so we didn't expect it to be very warm. We tried out the heated pool but it wasn't much better as far as warmth but just as nice and my husband and I got in the hottub, while our son swam, 4 feet away from us, in the indoor pasrt of the pool. Our son didn't want to leave the hotel that night or the next day. We did the timeshare tour the first full day and it was fine, except that it took too long and the second set of sales people, not the one who does the initial presentation (he was wonderful), were not great. We were really thinking it over because we loved the Fountains so much but couldn't come up with an amount that would work that day. Their solution- can't you just put it on a credit card? If they would have been more flexible and let us finance some of the down payment too, instead of forking over $2,000, while we're already spending extra on vacation, we would have bought. And they were as nice as could be till my husband finally said, for the 3rd time, "Look, if we have to pay a large down payment today, we can't do it" and said it very firmly , then they acted put-off and showed us the door. Oh, well. The 3rd day we went to Magic Kingdom and just had a blast. It was SO nice coming back to a "condo/ apartment" and not a one room space with 2 uncomfortable beds and a tiny bathtub with no water pressure. Oh, and the bathtub. We had a garden tub jacuzzi in the master bedroom and then the shower was in the area with the toilet. I've heard some people say they wouldn't like this but our family is very close and our son is still very young so it wasn't a big deal. And he loved "swimming" in it every night. He normally hates to get baths but every night there, I had to force him to get out; he was already begging to get in. I have been to Orlando many times, always stayed in a typical hotel room, and I'm sure I will go many more times but I have to say, it's going to be difficult now to stay anywhere else. And its location was great. It is on the quiet part of International Drive, down past the Sea World Entrance and just literally a left turn and right turn away from the Disney Resort. We went to Downtown Disney 2 nights and it took 10 minutes to get there and back. In the weeks leading up to the trip, I was looking up things to do on the day of our timeshare tour because we weren't going to a Park that day but it turns out that we all just wanted to stay right there. I would definitely liked to have had more time at the resort. The game room wasn't all that great but they were renovating part of that building. Around the resort is another pond with paddleboats, though I don't think they were available then. There were also fire pits and charcoal and gas grills set up around the property. We definitely would have grilled out if we had more time. So if you couldn't tell, we just had a wonderful time and the Fountains had a lot to do with that. We still would have had fun but it wouldn't have been the same. We weren't cramped up in a little room with our dirty clothes in trashbags and all our stuff crammed on the little sink, with paper thin towels and wash rags and no fridge to put drinks in. Our son could watch his cartoons and we could watch what we wanted, we had the balcony to go sit on at night and in the morning when we got up, just like at the beach. I've read some people complaining about no maid service. Good grief- stick the towels in the washer when you go to bed, put them in the dryer the next morning, leave out one to use. I did have to wash some clothes, towels and a few dishes but it was different because I was on vacation and not doing it at my own house. My husband didn't even complain about taking out the trash. Everyone who has looked at our pictures has said how nice it looks. Check out was at 10am, which was a little early but no big deal. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: All_About-Da_Family
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 7 nights while on Spring Break. We booked through a 3rd party timeshare company, and although the experience with them was a little lengthy and unpleasing it was well worth it when we got to the resort. Everything exceeded our expectations. We have children with us ranging from 2 to 15 and their is truly something to keep EVERYONE ENTERTAINED. We loved it so much that my husband and I decided to buy. I love the flexibility with their timeshare plan and the tour guide we had "Roberto" was absolutely the best. We originally turned down the offer to buy and he let us go with no hard feelings or pressure. My husband and I discussed it later and were able to come back and take them up on a great deal. I would definately reccomend "The Fountains" for families to vacation, even if you don't buy. Well worth the money. We didn't even have to go to the LARGER MORE EXPENSIVE amusement parks. We hit a few of the smaller tourist spots in Orlando but based it around resort activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations! Especially for a family with 3 young kids.”
Reviews.Author: Mikecbecker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have 3 sons, ages 9, 7 and 3. When you have a family like ours, there is bound to be lot of luggage to deal with and meals can become a total hassle. A typical hotel room just doesnâ€™t work for us. Bluegreen really addresses the needs of a family like ours. I can not stress this enough - this is not a typical hotel. You essentially get a 2 bedroom apartment with all the amenities of a fully furnished home. The kitchen comes with all the necessary items, like garbage bags, pots, pans, plates, spatulas, forks, knives, etc... Thereâ€™s a washer & dryer right in your apartment. You will need to go to the supermarket and get what you are going to use, although they give you enough soap and the like to get started. There is a â€œrealâ€� supermarket close by. This place really worked for us. We did not spend all our time at the resort. We were gone most of the time at the parks and activities in the area, but it was so nice to come back to a comfortable place and not be on top of one another. We were able to eat at the breakfast table together in peace without first having to get ready and make it to the restaurant. It was a nice way to start our days and we did not have the expense or hassle of going out to eat. The place was definitely spacious and the beds were super comfortable. The pools and the facilities were also very nice. There was no maid service, but I think you could get it for an extra charge if you wanted. I would definitely recommend this to a family like ours. If you are looking for a hotel room like you would get at a big chain hotel this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travelfamilyof7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Fountains with my family. (2 adults, 5 children) We have been to Orlando 3 years in a row now, and this is the best place ever. The variety of activities are excellent, and the staff the same. Kelly at the activities desk was awesome (according to my children) The way she interacts with children (and adults) is hard to describe with words. It is hard for parents to trust your children with anyone, even if you are in the next room. We trust Kelly anytime. To the management of The Fountains; make sure you keep her employed. The rest of the staff is very good at what they do as well. Our children range in age from 2 year old twins to our oldest son at 12 years old. They all had a good time. Even with 5 children we found it easy to find something to do for everyone. They actually have a soccer field within the resort. So, to all other Europeans, want to play soccer when on holiday in Orlando. This is the place, maybe the only place that have a soccer field. (You may notice that our family loves soccer). The soccer field was good but not great. But it was brand new and we are sure that improvements will be made. It ican be quite expensive, so make sure you get a good deal. It is possible. All in all, we had a great time. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Trip offer - caller hung up on us”
Reviews.Author: OldVacationer
Reviews.Content: Was called and offered a package deal - it was late in the evening so we asked if we could investigate and call them back - the company rep hung up on us! If this is how they act for a "special offer", I have to question their integrity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay! Would definitely do it again!”
Reviews.Author: CityGalIL
Reviews.Content: Needed to go to Orlando for a conference. I decided to bring my husband and daughter along with me. Glad I didn't stay at the conference site and decided upon a villa/condo option. This place is huge and very nice. We stayed in building 10 so I can't comment on other buildings. We arrived late at night around 11:00 p.m. and were greeted by friendly and knowledgeable staff. The villa was a 2bedroom/superior. Well furnished and faced the beautiful pool with a screened patio. Nice plasma tvs in each room and well stocked kitchen. The walls are a bit thin but it didn't bother me. If I had to complain about something it would be the pool hours at the main pool were from 11:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. and the internet was not free. However there is another pool area that stayed opened later. This was Presiden'ts week and I was told that lots of people tend to come to the area around that time. Not sure what it would be like in the summer time as far as the crowds. We plan to visit there again. Great deal for the money spent and very very spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Need a clean sweep of new employees!”
Reviews.Author: vivrya
Reviews.Content: Check in is at 4pm so we arrived promptly... Amanda at the front desk (no smile at all) said she'd call when the room was ready.. I said um.. but check in is at 4 right? she said "yes but its not ready yet so you can go walk around or go in the pool and we will call you when its ready" ....(how could we all change for the pool with 2 kids if we didnt have a room?) Anyway....She said she'd call us when it was ready!!!! I said how long? She said about 15 minutes Anyway... we came back 45 MINUTES later since no one had called us!!!! and by 5pm after waiting in the line AGAIN they went to the back office to try to see if the room was ready!!!! Mind you, we had reservations a month in advance!!!!!. .... We then went to the ticket desk to ask for brochures for magic kingdom again no smiles from the 3 people there either.. (working in sales myself this is a great turn off for customers!!!!) I shruged it off as just a mishap.....and forgot about it... The kids were eager to try the slides by the gorgeous pool so we changed quickly and got to the pool at 5:20..the kids went down the slide 2 times and at 5:30 they closed the slide and the pool closed at 6! :( so the hour they wasted on checking us in took away from the kids only pool time. We were told by a passing GUEST that there was another pool in the club house opened until 11.. Also, no one told us that they dont bring you new towels to use.. If I had known I would have thrown the used ones in the dryer for when we came back from Disney at midnight... it would have been nice to have dry towels to come back to!! When customer service called to ask how check in was I told her and she said "ok if you have any more questions let us know!" I then mentioned the experience to one of the sales guys during the tour and he said oh that was probably just becuase of the Daytona Race this week and we were booked... (but thats what reservations are for!) The room itself was very nice but wasn't upgraded (like old tv's which we didnt get to use) we were in building 8 which I found out was not renovated yet like the others.. Upon check out... the girl at the desk stared into my eyes with no smile at all... blank expression and I will not be going back again because of the service and also not consider a timeshare here because I am afraid I woul be greeted liek that all the time.... NO WAY! I will go where they are friendly and make you feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE-Wide range of quality of rooms at this resort”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior248
Reviews.Content: Came here for winter break in Feb. Pictures online show the remodeled rooms. Not all buildings here are remodeled yet. Check in was smooth, but they put us as far away from the pools and clubhouse as we could get with a view blocked by a palm tree. Asked several time to be moved, but was told that no other rooms were available. Once we got to our room, we were greeted by a heavy, musty smell, like the room had not been used in some time. Maintenance is an issue. had two light bulbs in our unit out and fan in bathroom was hanging from the ceiling. Had to ask for extra pillows and linens that were missing. Pool area is nice and has a lot of activities for kids and adults. If you go, make sure you ask in advance for one of the newly renovated rooms, or find somewhere else. Too many other timeshare resorts in Orlando that are nicer for same money.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: laurannie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and comfortable, well stocked kitchen and baths. Lots of staff on site. Indoor/Outdoor pool is great, lots of seating area as well as a sandy beach section, the Wakoola Springs pool is amazing, it closes early and is not always heated but is alot of fun on nice days. Steam room, Sauna, Excersise room, free coffee and newspaper daily, on-site resturants....they have it all. We have stayed at alot of timeshare resorts and this one is at the top of our list. We didnt get a chance to do many of the resort activitys, but they had several each day, gas grills on site, fishing available....something for everyone. Resort fee includes internet, free coffe and newspaper, and discount at resturants...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, value, quality, and atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: 123456mb
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! This was our first trip to Orlando as a family. We wanted an indoor pool, since it would be cold outside...indoor pool is attached to the outdoor pool. Really neat! Our condo was a spacious two bedroom-two full bath accommodations with all the amenities described within the website brochure for $120 with tax and resort fee. The room and the grounds are well maintained and beautiful. The staff is professional, courteous and helpful. Two of our days were spent just at the resort, since there is so much to do...live alligator show, giant twister, bike rentals, and the water slide...and we were exhausted from visiting theme parks. There are no dull moments here but not rowdy. We spent a lot of time finding a resort that would work for us, and this was definitely the catch. Our family liked how it was on International Drive, one mile from Sea World and 20 minutes from Magic Kingdom, but away from the "touristy" hustle and bustle of the busier sections on the I-Drive. This resort is a two minute drive from Walgreen's and Publix and many other stores and restaurants. We said no to the timeshare tour, and we were never bothered again with the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here often”
Reviews.Author: zesty007
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Service could be better but for the price in off season I found for 79.00 per night! Rooms are big and most accessible to the some sort of hotel activity. My boyfriend and I stay here all the time because its away from the hussel and bussel of Disney and Universal. Although it is still a close drive, it give us that space to relax in our quiet hotel room. Publix and restaurants are less than 5 mins away! I believe they have a shuttle but I've never used it.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us.”
Reviews.Author: pickyguyMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Overall, we thought very highly of our experience there and would go back. (Note I am very picky). I'll get the negatives out of the way first. Check-in was slow and the person helping us was not well-informed and forgot to issue the required parking pass. The lighting in our rooms was not great - typical hotel CFL lighting. Plus, we had a couple burnt out bulbs. The TVs are analog models and ours automatically came on at a very high volume. The hot and cold water on our kitchen faucet were reversed. The main outdoor pool (Wakoola Springs) is not heated, so we were not able to use it. Now the positives. Overall it was a vere well taken care of property, inside and out. I assume our unit was recently renovated. It was tasteful, and nicely furnshed. Sleeping was very comfortable, with lots of pillows of various firmness. We have 2 small kids, so a 2BR unit with a full kitchen and laundry was great. The huge Wakoola Springs looked like it would be great in better weather. The weather was OK while we there, but that pool is not heated. The other small pool at the Clubhouse is heated and has indoor and outdoor sections. Given we had a couple real cool days, we were really glad to have the indoor option. The indoor pool area and pool area bathrooms were not perfectly clean, but with an indorr/outdoor area, you kind of expect that. There were great kids activities, some requiring fees, but those fees were very reasonable. The grounds are well maintained, and we used the two toddler playgrounds. The Fountains is easy to get to from the airport, very close to Sea World, and about 15 mintues from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to relax, beautiful location and lovely pools”
Reviews.Author: JennieR_11
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the accomodations. Nice place and beautiful pools indoor and outdoor. Wonderful place for children.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely not recommend!!!!! :-(”
Reviews.Author: dayzeehaze
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start. One thing is for sure, the price is way too high for what you get!!! I called a couple days prior to our stay to add an additional night & the lady I spoke w/ made it seem like it would not be a problem to do so. Upon check in, the guy at the desk acted like we were putting him out just by being there. Our reservations were all messed up & it took almost 20 minutes to get checked in. He was not apologetic or nice to us at all. Then they asked us if we wanted to watch a time share presentation & acted really offended when my husband told them that we were not interested at all. This place was supposedly built in 2005, but it seems older than that like mabe mid 90's. I had requested a renovated unit when I made the reservation...we think we got a renovated unit, but it appeared they cut corners b/c the TVs & appliances were old & the furnishings looked cheap. In fact, the fridge kept making some loud noises the whole time. The only thing we noticed that seemed new was the granite countertops. The luggage carts are limited for each building. The fire alarms & security alarms kept going off in our building and others. Their was a deceptive "resort fee" charged each day during our stay, which included internet access, which was the worst, slowest connection we have ever experienced anywhere. The master bathroom started smelling really musty & moldy a few days after we got there & we noticed that the toilet had mold all inside the rim. Their is no housekeeping, not unless you want to spend $25 a day extra. You have to take your own trash out too & they only give you limited supplies. There were annoying phone messages every day from the staff. The bigger pool (Wakoola Springs) was not heated & the pool bar was not open the entire time we were there. We did not get to use that pool (which was the better of the two). The smaller one by the lake was heated, but it was crowded & cold once you got out. They have outdoor grills around the man made lake area, but the ingition switches did not work. There are no fitted sheets on the beds, so they kept coming off every night. The couches in the living area are extrememly uncomfortable & worse than sitting in a dr's office. Our key card to our unit stopped working the last night of our stay. The security guy came to assist, but he had no personality or customer service skills whatsoever. He made us wait a while before he got there too & never apologized or explained why this happened. Instead of offering to bring us new cards, he told us we would have to go down to the front office to get new keys.We have never stayed at a Blue Green Resort before & this will definitely be our last. We normally stay at Marriott Vacation Club or Hilton Vacation Club, but this place was less expensive & we thought we would give it a try. Never again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: deevrees
Reviews.Content: Wow! This place has just about everything. You can't really enjoy it's amenities because there are so many theme parks close by. Everything you might need is provided in your rooms. Dishwashers, full kitchen, great place to be with kids. Price is very reasonable for what is offered. They do want you to invest in a "time share", but they offer you a reimbursement for your time (I can't tell you what it involved) . And they don't allow smoking, Yeah!!!!) Great security, gated, I highly recommend this place for grandparents and parents with small children. I'd go back here in a NY minute.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW"- It has everything !”
Reviews.Author: ali2010Orlando
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all !!! From great friendly service , to great food , beautiful CLEAN rooms . the pools were awsome and we have a 6 year old and thay had lots of activitys for them and transportation what more could you ask for i would stay again and again . You will truly enjoy your stay !

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: klh0376
Reviews.Content: I visited the fountains again, and had another wonderful visit, but this time brought my mom, 6 year old nephew, and one of his friends. We had Sea World passes and this location was perfect! Only 2 miles away. Knowing how busy this resort stays, especially the weeek of Christmas, I was thankful and lucky to get a room booked last minute. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted by the front desk with a warm welcome and a smile. Check in went smooth and quick and we were off to our room within 5 minutes. Also, the lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and we were told about specific activities that week just for Christmas. Our room was spacious and clean. 2 bedrooms and 2 baths-the master had a huge tub, king bed, private bath and door leading to a screened patio that overlooked Wakoola Springs pool. the guest bedroom had 2 beds and a private bath as well. both rooms had plush beds that were very comfortable. The kitchen was fully stocked, with a full size fridge, stove, dishwasher, washer and dryer and microwave. There was a breakfast bar with barstools and dining room table for 4. The living room also had a pullout sofa that the boys fell alseep on nightly watching movies on the dvd player. It was very cold this week but that didnt keep 2 six year old boys form enjoying the pools. At night they swam in the heated indoor/outdoor pool and during the day, despite 50 degree weather, they LOVED the slides at wakoola!!! A special treat was an evening activity where Mr and Mrs Claus read stories and served cookies with warm apple cider. They provided paper for the boys to write their christmas lists and give to Santa- I couldnt resist either and we did a family photo with santa and the Mrs!! Another great activity and my favorite was the bonfire. We missed the smores and singalong they do on Sundays but were able to enjoy a weenie roast on wednesday. very relaxing and the fire was perfect to fight the chilly weather. They also just opened their fitness center which was under constuction my last visit and it was amazing!! top of the line equipment with nice tvs on all machines, weight machines, ab worker and even a Yoga/pilates studio. There is a publix grocery store just minutes away, along with the premium outlets. Checkout was a breeze! Only a few people in line and at checkout they offered us an ipad to fill out a comment card! Very cool i thought and a great way to try out an ipad before buying one. We have passes for aquatica and looking forward to warm weather and another great stay here. This is my new favorite place to stay in orlando!! I cant recommend it enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: just4kids
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week at The Fountains from Dec 18 thru Dec 25. Before arrival we were contacted by their time share sales dept and were offer discounts for major attractions and restaurants if we sat thru their presentation and at that time I agreed to do it. I took the opprtunity to comment on how I would love to be placed on a renovated unit. Upon arrival we were told we were going to be the first guest in bulding 3 and our unit was all new. We loved the room the furnishings ,decoration, linens and ammenities in the room. It was a 2 bedroom with 1 queen in the master and 2 twins in second room and a pull out sofa in the living room. It had some minor issues ,but mantainance came right away and fixed them . We inquire about a larger unit as I had some relatives coming to spend Christmas Eve with our family. We were shown another 2 bedroom unit but this one could accomodate up to 8 people. The difference was night and day. If I had been assigned that unit my review would be totally different. The Pools were fun for the kids they went a couple of times. Did not eat at any of their food outlets so can't comment. Did eat at Benihanas just next door. The location is central to all the area parks.

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: klschen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains for two weeks over Christmas. We will not return - the indoor/outdoor pool was disgusting with clumps of hair floating around and hair balls on the walkways. The staff notified of this early in our stay, but nothing changed. The indoor hot tub was out of service several times during our stay also. The master bathroom shower had mold on the ceiling which appears to be a recurring issue as it looked like it was patched up several times. The beds were decent and comfortable - the setup of the rooms were nice. It was nice of the hotel to send maid service to the room halfway through our stay so that was appreciated. The location is close to everything. The outdoor pool was nice and the kids enjoyed the waterslides. We didnt get the requested buildings we wanted even though we were guaranteed that the morning of check in. The two 'cribs' they said we could use were actually pack-an-plays which were soiled. Overall, do not stay at this resort and find somewhere else. We were so much looking forward to staying here and were completely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: innairis
Reviews.Content: First time visit, very nice place for kids, teens and adults. Stayed for 6 days. Location is perfect for all the Disney activities. Pools were very nice. I would have to say that the service was extremely wonderful!! Margaret at the front desk for check in was our Xmas angel!! She helped us out with all of our requests. We will be coming back for sure. Thanks Bluegreen for another wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a few tweeks, but had an amazing holiday here!”
Reviews.Author: bethm3883
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for 2 weeks in September and had an amazing holiday. The location of the fountains is great, we didn't have a car so used the I-ride alot which stops directly outside the resort, it is on the Red line which is much more reliable and frequent than the Green! There is also a lovely Publix 2 stops away (2-3 mins) which is pricey but WELL worth it for the service alone. The staff at the Fountains are good, not great but no complaints, just not the really fluffy enthusastic type service you will find elsewhere in Orlando. The pools at the resort are amazing, yes the main one has music playing all day but we actually liked that, makes for a great atmosphere around the pool. Drinks are expensive so we only visited pool bar once. The apartments are great, they are huge and are equipped with everything you need, my only gripe, I spent far too much on wireless internet, this really should be free, if they did this + complimentary housekeeping I would give it 5 stars! A great resort that you will not be dissapointed with, we really did have an amazing vacation and would definitley return to the Fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip and Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: dukeybear
Reviews.Content: My husband had to travel to Orlando for business, and I joined him while leaving the kids at home. Although they would have loved the resort the alone time we had and being able to let loose was priceless!!! The fountains offers so many activities for people of all ages, some of them do cost extra but they are definitely worth the money!! Their pool was the best pool I have seen at a resort, and their villas were immaculate and up to date. All of the staff was extremely friendly (and although I was nervous about checking in due to the reports I read) was worried for no reason. We got there and checked in right away!! We did do the timeshare tour because we signed up for it when we made our reservations through Orlando Welcome Center .com. We just thought we would save extra money, and never thought we would purchase, but we fell in love with the resort and are now proud owners!!! This vacation was truly amazing and now I can't wait to come back with the kids! The fountains is truly a top notch 5 star resort in my eyes!! Can't wait to use our vacation ownership. It is also in a perfect location, close to all the theme parks as well as shopping!

Reviews.Title: “A nice condo that allows family to relax and have room.”
Reviews.Author: A_Florida_Traveler
Reviews.Content: For a weekend trip to Orlando for the theme parks, this condo hotel was perfect. We had plenty of room and a great location near all the parks. Two points that were annoying only one parking pass per room and they did not clean up between days. But, with it being a condo/time share that is not surprising.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: CincyJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Fountains. There were 6 in our group, 3 adults and 3 children, and the room worked out great. We stayed in building 8 and it was a short walk to the pool. The kids loved the waterslides and kids activites. Overall, it was hard to beat the room rates and location.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved”
Reviews.Author: palo1348
Reviews.Content: My wife and my two young children stayed in The Fountains for a whole week during our recent vacations. We never stayed in a villa before during our previous vacations. Two beds hotel rooms was our normal stay. But after spend a week at The Fountains we will never go back to hotel rooms anymore. The two bedroom villa we got in Building 10 was beautifull and fully equiped with everything you need to have a superb vacation. The pools are outstanding, the indoor heated pool is clean and relaxing and the outdoor pool is huge and super fun. All the staff is very friendly, professional and they did everything possible to make a memorable stay for us. Food and Beverage is available at afordable prices at the pools and at the Clubhouse and they also have an in house Dominos Pizza that delivers to your room past midnight hours. We visited the parks and did all the Orlando family experience, but what really will make our vacation unfforgatable was the stay at BluegreenThe Fountains Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jenifer173
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance and his sister. We were able to check in early. The place is beautiful. Everything was spotless when we arrived. The condo was very spacious and came with everything you need. Just bring your toothbrush. The pools were great, not crowded at all. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for your family”
Reviews.Author: JSB228
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando with my family two or three times every year fo several years now. Since I am traveling with two young boys my wife and I enjoy the extra room a time share type room offers. I have stayed at Marriotts, Hiltons, and varios others and I happy to say the Foutains is on the top of my list for the next trip. Our two bedroom was clean updated and spacious. The beds were excellent and the full kitchen well stocked. What impressed me the most was the activities for the kids. Our 2 down days that were spent pool side my 7 year old had fun at the pirate games, learned to paddle board surf ,held a aligator, made ice cream sundays and went down the water slide 100 times. Most time shares have activities the Fountains do it better. Hotel personel were great, I travel for a living and they could work at any upper class resort. Grounds were kept nice the hole resort was clean. My only complaint was the couch could use some help, new and clean but comfort not so good.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!! Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: tennesseetitans
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for about a week and never had any problems. The music at the pool was just right and we had a very relaxing vacation. The music is like jimmy buffet/bob marley .........etc. The pools were awesome. We never had to call anyone about any issues so I could not say anything about maintenance. The front desk staff was helpful and nice. The rooms were extremely nice and clean. The balcony had an excellent view of the pool as we did stay in building 10. The Domino's on site is fairly priced. 5 star stay at the Fountains. Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by first impressions”
Reviews.Author: bargainchris
Reviews.Content: After staying a week at Port Orleans on Disney I was looking forward to moving to the fountains for the space (had 2 teenagers and a 7 year old). Check in was very swift didnt feel it was very welcoming and another staff member came over and told the lady who was checking me in that she had checked someone into the wrong room (which i didnt think was very proffessional). We were put into building 7, and on arrival i wondered what i had let myself in for - the corridors and the lift area was very dirty, and by the time i got to the front door of the apartment my stomach was sinking - the front door was very dirty as well as the outside of the apartment and i was dreading opening the door, however i got a pleasant surprise, the apartment was lovely, big spacious and clean. There were dishwasher tablets, washing powder, washing up liquid and coffee and was pleased to see a recycling bag for paper and cans (although when i had a clean halfway through my stay - the cleaners put the dishwasher on for 1 plate a cup and a couple of pieces of cutlery which i thought was a waste of energy!!). The safe was big and held everything we had brought, and there was plenty of storage space. However the room where you put the trash was very dirty,and smelly. The resort had two pools a noisy one (where they had music all day) and a quiet one behind the the club house- we did like the noisy pool as alot going on especially for the kids - but the music was just too loud and you couldnt really relax so we did spend a lot of time around the quiet pool. My son of 13 and his friend - did the xbox tournemant and the dive in movies and they really enjoyed those, and there were barbecues around the resort which we saw lots of people using, there were also free computers in the club house - that you could use for 30 mins - never had to wait for these and got to check emails daily. We didnt eat on site so i cant comment on this - there is a publix nearby and a walgreens and a few minutes drive is the premium outlets, there is a trolly stop outside it you dont feel like driving - we used this when going to seaworld (as the kids go free) only a few stops and saved on the parking. I did like the driving directions which i found in my welcome pack they were very useful (even though been many times before - and dont take a sat nav - with these found a few short cuts that i didnt know about). The resort did shuttles to the parks but you had to pay for those not sure of the cost though. This resort would definately be doable without a car as the bustop and trollystop was outside the resort. It was very relaxing in to come back to in the evenings - we would definately stay here again - although would not request building 7 or 6 as they were furthest away from things, and the hotel say the are constanty striving for 5 star standards - the outside of building 7 (floor 2) really let that slip with the cleanliness but everything else was fab.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't plan to relax, then stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kim54946
Reviews.Content: Our trip started on the wrong foot from the minute we walked in the door to check-in. No one greeted us with a friendly smile, no one. After getting checked in we were directly to the ticket sales counter to pick up our Universal tickets (we booked at a discount with free attraction tickets if we took a tour of the property) at which time we were told that we would not be able to take the tour the following day as scheduled, we would have to wait another day. We were also told that the Universal tickets were not good at Islands of Adventure (the only reason we went to Orlando) but that the two day passes at Universal could be traded for one day passes at I of A. Once we got to Islands of Adventure, we were told that, no, the passes could not be traded in, but we could upgrade to two-day, two-park passes at a cost of $150. Wonderful. Now I've spent $150 more that I intended to at the park (good-bye Express Passes). Thanks liars. What was I supposed to do? Tell my son that he couldn't go to I of A because someone lied? My husband wanted to suprise me with Disney tickets (I've never been) but when he went back to the ticket sales counter (they supposedly sell tickets to attractions) he was told that "The price is the same, plus I'm going to charge you an additional $5 service fee so just go buy them at the park". I appreciate the honesty but could do without the attitude. Besides the disaster with the park, the resort is LOUD. There is loud music playing everywhere, you can not relax at the pool (more loud music), almost all activities cost more money, and items in the room were broken. Our room was across from the Operations Center which only added to the noise. Beginning early in the morning we woke up to extremely loud conversations in Spanish being yelled across the parking lot. Not one of the housekeeping staff ever greeted us with a smile and at no point were we made to feel welcome or at home. I spent most of my vacation wishing I was back at home - and broke.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and great with children!”
Reviews.Author: ambyrne33
Reviews.Content: Resort was beautiful and onsite amenities make it a perfect place to just get away with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place with friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: skoromilas
Reviews.Content: The place is very clean and beautiful. The pool area is awesome. The pool is extremely large with slides and basketball hoop. We ate at the grill and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Njb52
Reviews.Content: After hours of researching hotels online we finally settled on The Fountains, and glad we did. The resort is beautiful. Way better than a hotel! We arrived early (noon) and asked if we could check in early. They didn't have our room ready yet but took our cell phone number and said they would call when it was ready. They handed us pool cards and said we were welcome to relax by the pool. They have two pools. One, Wakoola, is enormous with water slides and the other is smaller but is an indoor/outdoor pool which goes under the clubhouse. We were called at 2:00 and said our room was ready. At check in they did ask if we wanted to go on a tour for discounted tickets however there was no pressure. We declined and they said if we changed our minds to let them know. The unit was perfect, Spacious with King bed and jacuzzi in master and two double in 2nd bedroom. We stayed in building 8, one of the newer buildings. It had a small kitchen, dining room, living area, the two bedrooms, two baths and a screened in balcony with a nice view of the fountains. The beds were slightly uncomfortable a little too hard but not bad. All in all the unit was very clean and well maintained. The grounds are meticulously maintained and very beautiful. The resort was very quiet and the pools were not crowded despite the many activities they had planned for children. The clubhouse has a couple of pool tables and a few arcade type games as well as complimentary internet. It is $5 for internet in your room per computer. We had two so it was $10 per day. Although they have a few places to eat/drink (Wakoola Grill, H20 Bar, and Mug O'Joe's} we really didn't try them. The property also has a lake where you can rent paddleboats, etc. Don't come for the fitness center though, it only has two treadmills , tow bikes and some free wights. The pools were awesome, we swam just about every day. The larger pool was only open until 9pm but the other pool was open until 11. Both pools played music all day but it wasn't annoying as others had said. The location was perfect, close to attractions but at the quiet end of International Dr. Would we stay here again? Most definitely!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Large Family Gatherings!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptFun_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family this past weekend at The Fountains and the resort was clean, beautiful, the staff was fantastic! At the check in desk, several staff members were very nice to my family and I, Roberto, Jose a Star in Training, Marinet, Serrena, Alex, Emanuel and Pedro. We needed a few replacement items while there, a towel exchange, extension cord and Ramon G. and Kevin S. left us cards and the items we requested were delivered quickly. The food & beverage staff and pool side staff were great too; Roy at the pool, April, Mary, Ryan, and Rafael were all very attentive and made you feel welcome. Thank you again, we will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Beautiful, Fun for the entire family!”
Reviews.Author: myfavorite8899
Reviews.Content: We purchased a preview package through Bass Pro Shops and decided to start our vacation there in Orlando, before driving over to Tampa for a 5-night cruise. The condo was updated, clean, and very comfortable. Everything you could possible need for an extended stay was provided right down to soap for the dishwasher and laundry detergent! They even gave a courtesy call in the evening to ask if we needed anything and if we were enjoying our stay! My toddler was able to watch her DVD's while the hubbs and I relaxed on the screened patio, it was very relaxing. My husband enjoyed the jetted tub when his back began cramping :-) The outdoor pool was a vision and very clean! It was oversized, so it never felt crowded. You could order food and drink right on the pool deck, although we prepared all of our meals in the condo. There were waterslides and a spray park attraction for the kiddies to enjoy. I thought that was great since it kept the energized kids and family-types pretty separate from the honeymooners and solo vacationers. Here's the drawback... the timeshare tour was waaaaaaaaaaaaaaay too long!!! Did I mention that I have a 3-year-old?? They put a large group of us in a room for a presentation that lasted TWO HOURS!! The paperwork stated that the presentation would last 90-120 mins. so we were relieved to get out of that room when the 120 mins. were up! BUT THEN, they separated us into families to meet privately with a consultant who gave us a tour of the pres. suites. THEN they wanted us to meet with a financial consultant to crunch all of the numbers and go over the cost of the timeshare!! By this time, we had been there for 2 1/2 hours and our 3-year-old was crying, "I'm hungry!" I had to cut the woman off, apologize for having to leave, and we left. My husband and I were actually open to the idea of owning, but after being stuck in a room for 2 hours, we had no desire to stay and find out the cost. Bluegreen should SERIOUSLY cut the presentation waaaay down so that potential owners have enough patience to meet with the consultants! We only had ONE full day at the resort, and we had to go to Magic Kingdom all in ONE afternoon, so we just COULDN't spend all day in a sales presentation! That is my only complaint about Bluegreen. Sorry guys, we enjoyed our stay, but you lost us at 2 1/2 hours of babble. We're "show us the numbers" kind of people....

Reviews.Title: “Great pools but some rooms need refurbishment.....”
Reviews.Author: 4AussiesTravel
Reviews.Content: On Initial approach this resort looked very impressive, especially the lobby, swimming pools and grounds. However at check in we found the front desk staff seemed uninterested and treated us more as a number. The actual apartment block we stayed in had no external appeal but rather looked like a block of flats. The external stairwells had not been swept in some time. The apartment itself was clean except for the balcony, but very dark, uninviting and tired. All light fittings were very dated, the sofas were very uncomfortable and the second bathroom was very dark and unappealing. On the positive the beds were very comfortable and the activities offered by the resort looked interesting although we didn't participate. We actually checked out early and as there are many other resorts in the area would not go back to this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: suziern
Reviews.Content: If I had to rate this place with stars I would give it a 4/5. We went down for a five day stay in Orlando to do all the usual Disney stuff with my husband and son, both of who had never been to Florida. We got there a few hours early and tried to check in but only got the key about a 1/2 hour early (check in is 4pm). they did offer to let us use the grounds for the pool and restaurant. Once in our room (BLDG 10) we settled in to a very nice 2 bedroom condo. We booked the timeshare tour in advance so we got a pretty good deal and nobody hounded us about the sales pitch at check in because we had already signed up for that. We actually got a 2 bedroom condo and 3 5day park hopper disney tickets all for $975.00!! The next morning we were booked for the 0730 sales presentation which they claimed was 1 1/2 hours long....WRONG. We did not get out of there until about 1130. That part was very annoying but no biggie, we were on vacation! After hearing what they had to say we turned down the offer without any pressure from the salesman. Our salesman was named Leroy, he was very nice and we seen him several times after that around the resort and he was always very nice! The pools were very nice but the 2 water slides are good for kids but not all that exciting for adults. The grounds were kept very nice too. I do not recall having a bad interaction with the staff, they were all very nice. We even complained that there were no darts to play with in the club house and one of the staff went out that night and bought some! The poolside massage therapist was very nice and did a great job! I would stay there again as long as we got one of the remodeled rooms in building 10. I didn't get to see the rooms in the buildings that have not been remodeled (they are in the process of remodeling all of the buildings eventually). For the price I would do the sales pitch as long as you have an afternoon to spare!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wilster006
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times in the past yr. I have learned that each building has been remodeled at various times so you need to request a newer building. The first 2 units were still very nice but had older 19 inch tv's and poor reception. I asked for a new room this past weekend and it had all flat panel tv's and good reception. The floor plans are identical in every condo. Granite counter tops, mini washer/dryer and full size appliances. All cooking wear and utensils are included. A nice whirlpool in the master suite. Travelzoo often has $99 a night specials. 5 minutes from Sea World. The pool is very large and staff is pleasant. A lot going on around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINITELY COMING BACK!! We had such a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsinthecity
Reviews.Content: I have a teen and 2 smaller children (5 & 9) and we go to the Orlando area at least once a year. Disney, Epcot, SeaWorld, Universal....we've stayed onsite at the attractions, offsite, used vacation home rentals, and it seems like everything in between. I cannot BELIEVE we didn't find this resort before now. I believe it was recently bought from another company, but everything is up to date, as if it were just built within the last year or two. There are several other vacation ownership type resorts, brand names, big names, and to be honest.....they are all OLD. A lot of the Disney area resorts have amenities galore, but there's nothing worse than an old, smelly room, with grandma's floral wicker furniture from the 80's. I cannot tell enough friends about The Fountains! For the investment you make into taking a family on a week vacation, or just in general to that area, there is nothing in comparison. The property is huge! There is a lake with paddle boats, fishing and everything. And they have it organized perfectly so that the big, main pool is open for all guests exactly when it needs to be. Then, the other clubhouse pool that is a not as large, but indoor/outdoor, stays open later at night. They have everything from grills, to swings/hammocks, game rooms, fire pits, I could go on and on. I was MOST impressed with the activities. We've all seen finger paint day, or water balloon day.....but not here....they have a LIVE alligator show, live DJ with Bingo going for the whole pool, there is a waterslide that my kids stayed on forever, airbrush tattoos, exotic bird shows, ice cream socials where you can build it exactly how you want it. Believe me, it's not your typical activities schedule. They have all kinds of exercise classes, water fitness, etc. I truly cannot think of a thing they missed. The rooms are astonishing. I read some of the reviews and I think they must have posted their negative comments on the wrong resort. You walk in to all updated/new furniture. Dark woods, modern lighting, and the two bedroom that we stayed in was HUGE! The kitchen was full size, 3 flat screen tv's, balcony, washer/dryer, pull out sofa in living room and a full size glass dining table, where you could serve a meal, rather than just pull up a chair to the kitchen counter. Speaking of food.....again, wow! The pool menu was incredible and the kids menu was the best selection I've ever seen. I've always wondered why they all have the same thing, but here they had at least 8 things to choose from, and my kids were so excited. I doubt we'll ever look for another place to stay, because it was such a different experience, and it made the vacation so comfortable. You will not be disappointed! Take it from a mother, who wants their kids to enjoy the vacation, but also really wants to enjoy it herself.....it's worth it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! From the first step onto this...”
Reviews.Author: Psshaffer
Reviews.Content: WOW!! From the first step onto this property, we knew we were going to relax in style. The island music as we registered, made us immediately feel like we were on vacation. Our unit (which really more like a spacious 'home away from home') was immaculate and beautiful. The activity schedule was incredible. It was just as much fun being at the resort, as it was going to the parks. The 2 pools were my favorite. We relaxed in a cabana, played basketball in the huge pool, enjoyed the water slides over & over, and loved the unique indoor/outdoor pool. At night, walking around this large property, overlooking the lake and enjoying the fountains was a great experience. This was a top notch managed resort. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip was as perfect as 1st!”
Reviews.Author: dontstayathome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains Resort from August 10-19 and this was our second stay. Check in was painless (clerk was so-so in the friendly category), declined the offer to sit through the timeshare meeting that they say will be only be 90 min because the last time we attended it it lasted 2 1/2 hrs, received our keys and proceeded to our villa in building 10! Once again, we were thrilled with everything about our accomodations! Place is very large, bedrooms very large, fully stocked kitchen, washer/dryer, 2 bathrooms, and 3 t.v.s.
