We did not pay for housekeeping so I ran the sweeper a couple times during the week and that was fine! We requested clean towels quite a few times and they arrived in about 30 minutes. Maintenance dept. was GREAT.....our washing machine broke and it was replaced within 20 minutes, we requested a few new lightbulbs when a couple burnt out and they arrived within 10 minutes. Within 30 minutes of any maintenance calls we received a follow up call asking if our issues had been solved....super customer service! I had a few random questions that I called to the front desk for answers for and more than once they couldn't answer them but connected me with other departments and they also couldn't answer them so customer service in that area wasn't the greatest. We used the fantastic Wakoola Pool (with 2 waterslides) everyday and found it to be in perfect condition each day. Food at the bar was excellent and very fairly priced. They do add a 15% gratuity to your bill but that is advertised so it is not a "hidden" charge. Also, we used the other indoor/outdoor pool a couple times after the Wakoola Pool closed and it was nice too but we liked Wakoola better! The indoor/outdoor pool also has a bar and you can order food. Parking was never an issue and 3 of the nights we were there the place was sold out. The Wakoola Pool had either a d.j. or kids activities going on each day which was perfect since we were there with 2 11 year olds and 1 8 year old. The very worst thing about the resort is the workout room! 2 treadmills, 2 stationary bikes, Natulis weight set and a few free weights just does not even come close to being suitable for the amount of units that is in this complex. Square footage in the so called workout room is no more than 250 sq. ft. HORRIBLE! There are a few people we would like to personally mention. First .... Ricky who worked the Wakoola Pool taking food and drink orders was FABULOUS. This guy worked so hard and gave perfect service with a smile! He didn't just serve people....he made each guest feel special! Second.....Roy who worked around the pool area too doing a little bit of everything was a special guy. I got to talk to him at length after he helped me try to find my innertube that was left the day before at the pool when the pool area was cleared quickly because of a lightning strike close to the area. He went above and beyond the "call of duty" asking alot of the employees if they had seen the innertube and actually took me around personally before the pool area even opened for the day to look for it! He's a very interesting man and I could have talked to him all day every day I was there! (Roy...hope your grandson has/had a great first day of school!) And last but certainly not least is Lee in the reservation department. This guy truly knows what giving good customer service is all about. We had to change our reservations more than once after making our initial reservations months ago because of airline problems and no matter how many times I called him he was always friendly, professional and extremely helpful in all areas of customer service. We were fortunate enough to be able to meet him while we were at the Fountains and even though the meeting was brief we could tell he is just a "class act"! So to everyone at the Fountains, especially the 3 fantastic employees we just highlighted, thank you very much for a superb stay and we hope to stay at the resort again! I"d like to add that we sent 2 families to the Fountains the week before we were there and another part of my family travelled with us and all of the families who visited the resort loved it as much as we did! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place to stay that we're still talking about!”
Reviews.Author: JShaverSC
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Fountains. It was everything we hoped it would be. We booked it through the Armed Forces Vacation Club and we couldn't believe how nice of a place it was for the price that we paid. The rooms are gorgeous, clean, and spacious. We liked how our room had 2 full size bedrooms. The pools were the best part. Our children loved playing in the kids area and the water slide is awesome. I was impressed by the size of the kitchen and the washer/dryer in the our room. I don't remember now which building we stayed in but I believe it was one of the newer ones, so request to stay in one of the newer buildings if you are able to. We also enjoyed the outdoor grills and seating areas one night when we grilled dinner for ourselves. An easy, quick drive to the Orlando parks. We highly recommend The Foutains and will return!

Reviews.Title: “OK, But Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: Mickonly
Reviews.Content: I took my family there for a three night stay in July. Checking in was no problem. The desk staff were ok but could have been friendlier. I was given the timeshare sell when I picked up my parking pass at the other desk. The fella there looked disgusted when I told him I was not interested. He was a little pushy I thought. I asked for a room in building ten. They told me it was booked solid, so they sent us over to building #8. The location to the pool was good, but it was quite a hike to the clubhouse. The room itself was not exactly what I had envisioned. It was quite old and tired looking. It had three old fashioned 26" tube TV's, not the flatscreens I had read about in other reviews.The balcony was very clean and had a nice view of the grounds. Parking was easy and there were plenty of spaces.Makes me wonder if building 10 was really full. Went to the Wakoola Springs pool a couple of times. The pool itself was nice,could use a little more shade though. On the second trip to the pool my 13 year old son developed some eye irritation from the pool water (the water was cloudy).The staff at the pool seemed like they really didn't want to be there but weren't rude or anything. The pool bar was supposed to be open until 10:00PM, but the bar staff started closing things up long before and the lights and staff were out by 5 minutes to 10:00! I don't think I would stay there again. We have been to quite a few much nicer resorts the last couple of years, but like to try new places each visit.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go out of my way to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: plainjayne81
Reviews.Content: I didn't have one good nights sleep! The suites are rather pokey, the beds are so soft, the pillows are so soft and past the age of 14 it is not fun to have to climb into bed! I'm sure that is why they have the dressing bench at the end of the bed, it's so us at 5ft can climb up. It was noisy every morning with workers, the trash room smelt so bad which was right outside our room. The room was very dusty and I found a pill on the floor under the bed, it just looked like a vitamin but with having children there I was horrified it could have been anything that should have been cleaned up. I was also unimpressed that we had no housekeeping and had to wash our own towels all week, what a shame when we accidentally dyed them all blue. The pool looks lovely until it gets hot, there is no shade whatsoever and if you want shade you have to pay for a shelter at an extortionate price. The male lifeguard was more interested in flirting with the female lifeguard than doing his job. Pool activities were just embarrassing for the resort and knowing that money you paid for your holiday goes towards hiring these people makes me mad. The food on the resort is disgusting and you aren't allowed to take your own near the pool area nor are you allowed to take your own drinks or cooler boxes, you are expected to buy silly cocktails and there isn't much of a choice for children. The shop is pointless, they sell a bottle of fiji water for $5 a bottle, supermarket price $1.08. Luckily the location is great as there is a lynx stop and a trolley stop right outside the entrance, we never hire a car we always get buses. We took a rolling suitcase to publix around the corner and stocked up. Staff attitude is disgusting they couldn't give a damn about any guest whatever the issue. Not a great review I know, I'm not very good at writing reviews but basically I will only be rushing back in a hurry, I go to Florida every year and this is the first time I have been desperate to get home if only to have a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Do it yourself”
Reviews.Author: 5lightssrq
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be everything a family could want for a vacation, big rooms, great pool, convenient location. However, the rooms were dirty, door didn't lock, ice maker was broken, dirty towels, and kids were being bitten by bugs. We were not aware that we would not have housekeeping. So at 1:30 a.m. when we arrived back from Disney with tired, dirty children in need of baths and no clean towels we were not the happiest of guest. When calling the front desk to inquire about housekeeping and towels we were told that we have a washer and dryer. Thankfully security offered to bring some to our room. Maintenance was the only department willing to help with any needs and took time to listen and help. Management doesn't really care if you have concens. They pretty much just nod their heads and move on to the next guest. If you don't mind taking time out of your vacation to do your laundry everyday (can do this at home for a lot cheaper rate) not a bad place to stay. The pool was a great asset. Kids really enjoyed the slides and play area.

Reviews.Title: “This place is beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: dd1027
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large, decorated beautifully, the screened in balcony was the greatest, could look out over property. The swimming pools were awesome, lots of things going on everyday, for families and couples. This resort is so nice you dont have to leave to have a good time. In fact we took 1 full day of our vacation just to stay there and enjoy what the resort had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “No matter how you look at it, The Fountains is perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: tivvo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week holiday in Orlando Florida, and I feel compelled to write this review to rave about it! The husband, two children (7 & 12) and myself enjoyed a brilliant two week stay in The Bluegreen Fountains resort in Orlando. Located at the quiet end of International Drive, The Fountains has so much going for it. The I-Ride Trolley stops right outside (no 39), and for just $10 for 7 days you have the perfect transport system to ferry you to some of the major attractions, including SeaWorld, Aquatica, Wet N Wild, Universal (10 min walk from the I-Ride stop), not to mention loads of places to play, see and eat out along International Drive. The best thing about the I-Ride is that because The Fountain's stop is one of the first heading North up International Drive, you always get a seat! A complete journey along Int. Dr takes about one hour, depending on traffic. The Lynx Bus (8 & 42) also stops right out the front of the Resort, providing transport to the likes of Downtown Orlando and The Orlando International Airport. A taxi to Downtown Disney cost $16 including tip, and if you get the chance see Cirque Di Soleil do go as it was fantastic!! The Fountains itself is a beautiful resort, with beautifully kept lawns and lakes, and two wonderful pool areas each with their own outstanding features. The Wakoola Springs is the newest of the two and has loads of activities organised throughout the day to keep all ages amused. The pool itself is gorgeous and has 2 small waterslides for the kids. The Wakoola Grill serves food and drinks all day ( the burgers are lovely) and for $3 you can create your own ice cream sundae at certain times of the day! My two loved that! The other pool is located at the Clubhouse, and although it is not as big as the Wakoola Springs, half of it is indoors (much appreciated during the 94 degree heat!) and as it is situated next the Lake Eve, it is a lovely place to drink your cocktails, especially at sunset. Both pools were open till late, Wakoola until 10pm and the Clubhouse one until 11pm. The Clubhouse also has internet facilities (free), art and crafts room for the kids, an arcade, H20 Bar (food served aswell) and a very small gym. Our 2 bed apartment was immaculate! Everything you could want and more. We stayed in building 8 and LOVED everything about it. There was a TV with cable in each room, a DVD player, stereo, washer/dryer, dishwasher, everything you need for cooking (not that I did much). Other reviewers for this property have commented that you had to pay for room cleaning, however, as we were staying for 2 weeks our room was cleaned for us each week free of charge and linen was replaced anytime we needed it. The service was brilliant too! A hotplate on our stovetop didn't work, so on passing the reception I dropped in and mentioned it, and before we had even reached our apartment a repairmen had been called and was fixing the problem as we arrived! Now that's service!! The Fountains is a timeshare resort, and if you want to take advantage of their discounted tickets, you can sit through a sales pitch, but there was absolutely no pressure to do so. In fact, I think we may have dodged that one completely as we weren't even asked let alone hassled to attend a sales breakfast. All in all, after buying tickets for theme parks, dinner shows, day outings and various attractions, Orlando can be a REALLY expensive place to visit. So it was nice to be able to enjoy some down time in a beautiful location in the comfort of your own apartment while eating homecooked food. I know my family appreciated it! Go to The Fountains, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler Beware”
Reviews.Author: Patriot25
Reviews.Content: The Fountains is a beautiful resort but traveler beware...we had several items stolen from our room during our stay. We locked up all of our valuables in the room safe everyday - wallets, jewelry - but we were taken off guard from what the thieves were looking for. We had taken several DVD's for the family to watch while on vacation and the thief took several of these. I also had costume jewelry taken from the bedroom. Thank goodness I locked up our expensive jewelry items! Our room was at the end of a building so maybe that made it more convenient to sneak into and take items. So, when visiting the Fountains make sure you lock up any and everything in the safe, If they would take costume jewelry and DVD's they would certainly take more valuable items!

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort let down by its Management”
Reviews.Author: VPartridge
Reviews.Content: 15 of my family stayed here in July 2010 in 4 separate units. We had previously stayed several times at the Sheraton Vistana Villages across the road but felt it had become a bit tired and in need of a refurbishment. The units here are more than adequate, spacious and fully equipped. The pool area is great with 2 water slides and a zero entry area if you have little ones. However, they do not allow you to bring your own food and drink to the poolside. Now if this was a hotel I would understand, but it is a SELF CATERING resort and in the last 8 years I have never had a problem with this issue in any other resort I`ve stayed in. One evening, my son cut his ankle bone off a 4 inch piece of jagged metal protruding from the base of his bed. We patched him up as best we could and I wrapped a towel around the offending item to prevent further injury. I phoned the front desk the next morning and reported the incident to the duty manager. He promptly sent up 2 men to our unit. The 1st man to arrive took pictures of the area and I filled out an "Incident Report Form" The 2nd man was from maintenance and he fixed the metal bar by attaching a cover to it which had been left off. He explained that the bars were used to hold the baseboard of the bed in place. Neither of these men, despite seeing that the bedsheets were bloodstained, offered to send up housekeeping to change them. At this time I asked the 1st man for a copy of the "Incident Report Form" and he said he would have it for me in a day or two. On the night before we checked out I rang the duty manager and requested a copy again to be ready at the front desk the next morning. My main issues with the management of this resort are as follows: (1) Following my son`s accident, nobody from management rang the unit at any time to see how he was. (2) On the morning we checked out, the requested form was "lost" and despite my protestations I never once came eye to eye with a manager. They seemed very happy to send their staff out to try and deal with the situation. (3) I was told that the manager would forward a copy of the report to me by post and as of today`s date ( 3rd Aug ) I still have not received it. So to sum up my impressiion of this resort:- A NICE RESORT LET DOWN BY ITS MANAGEMENT

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: Mareismyluv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and the best thing about this resort was the water park. My son had a blast at the pool/water park and we played as a family for hours. The room on the other hand was not what I expected. The 2 bedbroom suite was not very clean and entirely too dusty for my taste. There was a large plastic tree in the living room which we placed on the balcony because of the amount of dust on the tree. I paid $150 a night to stay here and I expected a bit more from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for romance, too”
Reviews.Author: bexster143
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend proposed to me in one of the new suites at The Fountains... and I now canâ€™t imagine him doing it anywhere else! From what I understand, the staff was very accommodating and even helped him place rose petals in the elevators and hallways before my arrival. The day after we got engaged, we relaxed by the pool in one of the cabanas and then received a coupleâ€™s massage from the vendors on-site. We also had a black-and-white caricature drawing done that is now hanging in our home... what a great way to look back and remember how happy we were!! The Fountains is a great place for families and couples alike. Everything was remarkable.... from the room and service to the food, drinks and activities. Weâ€™re tying the knot in October and are looking forward to staying there before we cruise out of Port Canaveral... and weâ€™ll definitely go back for many anniversaries to come.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: curtismissy1
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine anyone having anything bad to say about this resort. The condos are very clean and spacious. Two bedrooms and a jacuzzi in the master. A pull out sofa bed if you need the extra room. Full kitchen, washer & dryer too. The pool is the largest one I've ever been in and it was clean and there was plenty of room. The food was great and reasonably priced also. Anyone that complains about the condos obviously stays at the Four Seasons wayyyy to much and is spoiled. We had a great time and my kids loved the pirate games outside the pool. They also have a dual slide that was great it was kind-of like a mini waterpark. I also dropped my kiddos (6,9,11) at the clubhouse for the pajama party where they keep them for $10 a piece for 3 hours from 6-9 and play games, color, eat pizza, and they even had a "dance off". For $10 for 3 hours is cheap for the entertainment and the free time to myself to breathe. They also had poolside massages in a cabana too. I loved it and it's so close to Seaworld maybe a mile and Disney is only a max of 4 miles away. We had everything extremely close. We ate at Golden Corral both mornings and it was only 2 miles away. I went for the timeshare presentation as well as some of the others that gave reviews and let me tell you I would stay here anyday just to sit through a presentation for an hour and a half. It was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Blue Collar Joint”
Reviews.Author: Conservative62
Reviews.Content: Nice place, convenient location, plenty of things to do on site. As always you might want to take your own pillow (the one's provided are adequate only) and be prepared for potential nightly interruptions by loud talking guests with little discretion about how to be a good neighbor at 2:00 a.m. Security will not address this kind of problem appropriately and continually. Someone needs to walk the grounds hourly to keep a check on loud talking and smoking on the balconies. Bluegreen provides a quality product and experience for the money only to be diminished somewhat by the mannerisms of some of the clientele or clientele's guests. Potential owners should be required to pass a social ethics exam prior to being accepted for ownership. Overall a good place that is just shy of being great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: vse323
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long vacation at the Fountains Resort. Check-in was very fast and the staff was friendly. The 2 bedroom condo was nice size with a pool view. The bed in the master bedroom was comfortable. Jacuzzi tub was nice. TV could have been updated. The second bedroom had a flat screen tv and beds not quite as comfortable. It was nice having a washer and dryer. Housekeeping was very quick in bringing towels etc when we called. There were computers in the activities center you could use for free. We really enjoyed the beautiful pool and our 7 year old granddaughter loved the slide. There were alot of activities going on around the pool. The poolbar was nice and the food was ok. The drinks were very expensive. We usually eat lunch or order drinks everyday at the pool but because of the high priced drinks we only ordered twice all wk. I think the resort is loosing money by having such high drink prices. They would sell more food and drinks if the prices were more reasonable. Other than the high drink prices we thought it was a beautiful resort and will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall stay was good. Tried the property, no intention of timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: dayman11
Reviews.Content: We booked through a travel agent at a Bass Pro Shop for three weeknights at a rate of $149. Received Bass Pro Shop gift cards equaling $100, so we paid just $50 for a two bedroom condo in Orlando. Room was in newer building 10. Room had full kitchen, two bedroom, two full bath with hot tub, walk-in shower, and screened outdoor porch. We arrived at noon, check-in is at 4pm and were able to get our room at 3pm. We used the pools, clubhouse and poolside bar until our room was ready. Hot tub did not work initially in our room and two internal door knobs were coming off. Maintenance resolved all issues with a few calls from us. We ate here for dinner an had received an "early-bird discount" of 15% for use by 6pm on the day of check-in. We ate on property three times during our visit. All Food is the same at all venues, no upscale or different menus, but the food was inexpensive and drinks at all bars were good. We tried the kids sundae making, tie-dye t-shirts, paddle boats, pools and pool slides. We stayed here under the stipulation we go to a timeshare pitch. They provided a limited continental breakfast and supervised child care. Our pitch lasted 3 hours and we let them know we were not interested in buying a timeshare. They had a 1 1/2 hr presentation, then a property tour. I have to say they were not that pushy and we stood our ground and let them know up front we did not want a timeshare. Overall stay was good. Most of the younger staff are not completely trained in property amenity times. Would only stay here for the price of a regular hotel, but would recommend. Near disney and seaworld. No free wireless. (In these times why no free wireless)?

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort”
Reviews.Author: buckeyegirl78
Reviews.Content: We purchased this vacation in February through a Bass Pro Shop which included a time share presentation. We arrived earlier than check in even though we traveled a great distance to get there. We asked if we could check in early and were told no but they would call when the room was ready. Other people were checking in early while we were there. While waiting, we went to Downtown Disney and didn't get back to the resort until 7. No one called during this time. I felt like we were not a priority since we purchased through Bass Pro for a lesser price. Our villa consisted of a kitchen, living area, two bathrooms, two bedrooms, and a screened in balcony. It was not anything special but it sufficed since we were only in the room morning and late night. Our ice machine, balcony fan, and coffee maker was broken. (Ice machine was fixed the next day and a new coffee pot sat in a box on our stove.) The tvs in three rooms were quite small and old school. Also the reception was poor on some channels. Other guests and the resort told us that they had flat screens in their villas. It was just a plain and simple villa, nothing impressive. Yes, we paid less than others so I guess you get what you pay for. We knew that going into it. Our time share presentation went alright. My husband and I knew going in that we did not want to purchase; however, we listened to the presentation, spoke only when necessary, and gave conservative answers. Manny, our time share guy, grew frustrated because our answers were not what he wanted to hear. We told him that we weren't interested and that was it. It only lasted about 90 minutes, if that. We watched the clock, and it was pretty painless. This was our first time share. The outdoor pool was nice. My three year old was able to do the waterslide. Height requirements are 42 inches. The indoor pool is quite small. We never had time to swim in it or partake in any of the activities. Floridays Resort is right next door and their suites are ten times better. If I were to purchase a time share, it would not be at the Fountains. However, it worked for a short stay. (High speed Internet throughout the resort was being installed at the time we were there.)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kriley416
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fountains resort for a week while vacationing with 3 girlfriends. The room was clean. The beds were comfortable. The service was good. The only complaint I have would be to leave both pools open at night and have one designated as an adult only pool. The location is very convieniently located. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort/ loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kovactrio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 8 nights May 31 to June 7, 2010. We have two children ages 7 and 12. We got a really good deal on Expedia for air/hotel and car for 8 days. The resort was beautiful and it is really close to all of the parks. Take your GPS and driving will be a breeze. The rooms were spacious and very well kept up. There was a full kitchen with a laundry room. The kids had their own bedroom and bath. Our room had a king bed, bathroom and jacuzzi tub. There was a dining room, living room and enclosed screened in porch with table and chairs. The view from our room was overlooking a pond with a fountain. We chose to stay at the resort every other day to recuperate from the parks. Our kids loved the pools and slides. At the indoor pool you can play volleyball in the water. There are activities around the pool for the kids, some cost a few dollars but not too bad. There was music playing and a DJ at times around the pool. We felt safe and everyone was very nice. The resort is Green so they give you bags to recycle. The only negative thing I have to say is that the bathrooms around the pool could be a little cleaner and need updated. We were never asked once to attend a timeshare meeting. It is a beautiful resort and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: CHIPPS2010
Reviews.Content: We just finished up a 7 night stay at the Fountains and I must say I was very impressed with everything. They have added the Wireless Internet to all the rooms. I booked through Orlandovacations.com and only paid $117 per night never once was approached by Time Share sales, although they were there never once was I even asked. The kids loved the pools I traveled with a 7yr old, 12 Yr old, and 14 yr old. The two bedroom apt. had plenty of space was clean and was great to have a washer and dryer. They have a dominos pizza on site and was less than a 10 min drive to the Disney parks and less than 5 min to SeaWorld. I looked for negative things to say about the resort and the only one I could come up with is that they have 2 GREAT pools however when it rains both are closed, and I felt they closed the pools to early. They had activities planned everyday for the kids and teens. Paddle boats, fishing, etc. Kids tie dyed shirts for 10.00 each and paddle boats were 6.00 per hour, and the arcade was fun too. Easily could have stayed at the resort for the week without visitin the Overly priced Disney parks. I am already planning my stay here next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Changes in the Last Year”
Reviews.Author: DSullivan1964
Reviews.Content: (Note: After I submitted this review, I received a call from the manager at the Fountains. We discussed the issues that surfaced during my visit. She said that she had been out of the office for the last month, but wanted to see what she could do to correct the situation. She promised to call me back, but I did not ever hear from her, so now I am even more disappointed than before. My original review is below.) This is the second time I have stayed at this resort, both times through an RCI exchange. The first time we stayed at this resort (in 2009), there was good reliable internet service in the room (although there is a $35 charge and it is dial-up disguised as broadband, so you have to physically hook up to the connection in the living room), and free wi-fi at the clubhouse and pool. Therefore, when I booked the resort this time, I had no reason to think anything had changed, and there was no information to indicate any change. However, when I paid through a third-party provider (lodgenet) for internet access, the service was AVERAGING 80 mbps. I had work that had to be completed Saturday evening. I called the front desk and they transferred me to the internet provider who said "yep, your service is very slow." They claimed that someone else was using an unusually large portion of the bandwidth and they said they would kick that person off. I went back to trying to work and the service was not any faster, so I realized that I would have to leave the resort and find the nearest place with free wi-fi. I was pretty frustrated at this point because I had wasted six hours of my day and it was now going on 7 pm. I stopped by the front desk to talk to a manager about the situation. The clerk at the front desk said she would get a supervisor. I waited 10 minutes (there were no other guests waiting), and asked if she was going to come out. I was told "yes" in a snotty manner by the clerk who then left the counter. I waited another 5 minutes and still no supervisor. I asked the remaining clerk who the supervisor on duty was. I was told her name was Ellen. I told the clerk to tell Ellen that I would be back to talk to the manager. I then asked where the nearest place with fee wi-fi was, and the clerk mentioned McDonald's, so I drove there and finished my work. The next day I decided to try the internet in the room again since I had already paid for 6 days. Same deal...very, very slow. I called the front desk again to ask about getting a refund. I was again transferred to the third-party provider who made me go through the whole process again of testing the network speed just to verify that it was not running at the network minimum of 256 mbps so I asked about a refund. I was told the front desk would handle it. So I had to call the front desk again and ask for a refund, which I did receive, but I paid with a credit card and the refund was added to the credit card on my room, which was a different card. This was just the first day...the second day at the resort, we went to the pool by the clubhouse and around 6 pm when we decided to leave, we asked for towels, and were told there would not be any towels for 20 minutes, so we waited and went back up in 20 minutes. This time we were told it would be another 10 minutes, so again we waited. The third time, we were told there was no estimate on when towels would be available so we had to walk back to our room on the other side of the resort soaking wet. The evening of the second day (around 11 pm), we noticed the ceiling above the shower in the master bedroom was dripping and the ceiling was soaked and bulging. I called the front desk and said we needed maintenance to come up immediately. I was told they would be right up...30 minutes later, no maintenance had shown up. I called the front desk again and spoke with someone who had just come in and they did not show that maintenance had been requested for our room, so they sent someone up, and they showed up in about five minutes. They thought they knew the problem (drain leaking from upstairs unit), but could not go into unit upstairs until in the morning because no one answered when they knocked. We asked for another room and were told it would not be a problem to switch rooms. In the morning, maintenance came and said the problem was fixed, so we decided not to go through the hassle of changing rooms. On the fourth day, the ceiling started dripping again, so we called maintenance again. They spent about four hours making repairs (during which time we felt like we needed to stay in the room), and completely tore down and rebuilt the ceiling. They again offered to move us, but we opted to stay. The maintenance men were very apologetic and came in and did the work as quickly as possible and made every effort to accommodate us. I made a call to the manager regarding all of the problems we had during the week. She told me there was a note included in our welcome information about the internet (the information said there were internet problems in building 10 and we were in building 7). She then said they have four computers in the lobby for guests to use any time. I asked why no one told me this when I made call after call about the problems I was having with the internet and why no one told me about the computers when I was asking for the closes place with wi-fi? She said it sounded like a training issue, and she would address it. She offered to give me a credit of $50 for our trouble, which I thought was a little low based on the issues we had, but I decided not to argue because I could tell English was not her first language and she had trouble communicating (yes, this was a supervisor). Based on my most recent visit, I will not book at this resort again in the future. The pools are nice, but the food available at the pools is pretty bad, even for pool food. The resort was very clean, including the pools, and there are activities planned at the large pool for kids and adults in addition to a DJ. The room was nicely decorated, very roomy and had been updated recently, so we did enjoy the room. We expected the room to be cleaned once during the week, which has happened at every other timeshare I have stayed at, but no one ever came to clean. When I asked the supervisor about it, she said if you are an RCI member you can get your room cleaned for no charge, but you HAVE TO CALL AND REQUEST IT. Where was that in the "welcome Information?" If you are not an RCI member, there is a $25 charge to clean the room. I waited a week after we left the resort to complete my review because I didn't want to be raging mad. I think all of the issues I had could have been addressed and resolved to our satisfaction if the front desk staff had shown an interest in our problems instead of just trying to pass us off to someone else or get rid of us as quickly as possible. We never felt like we were important to the front desk staff and that is not a good feeling.

Reviews.Title: “It was our first time and we would come back(:”
Reviews.Author: Vacations01
Reviews.Content: We decided to drive to Florida which was definetly a bad desicion. The worst decision was staying at a Quality Inn before we went to the Fountains. That was a horrible start. When we checked in we told the guest services lady that my moms sister came and felt preassured to upgrade(since it is a timeshare) she said she was sorry and it was supposed to be low preassure meeting and told us we can show up to it at any time. We were early for check in and are room was ready early. The room was perfect. From going to a quality inn to that was amazing! On our balcany we could see the lake which made it a relaxing place to sit. We skipped out on the meeting and never herd a word of complaint. The whole place seemed amazing and there was so much to do there too. they have 4 computers and they are always busy we waited for ten min. to use it for 5 min. Best trip and we will be comming back next year(:

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!! Wouldn't have stayed anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: klh0376
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains for a relaxing getaway and got just that!! As an avid tripadvisor fan I always read reviews before I go somewhere and was very happy with my stay here. I think some people are just hard to please because our stay was nothing short of perfect! The Location was on South International Dr, but on the less crowded section so it was easy access to everything and we didn't have to deal with I-Drive traffic. There was a grocery store very close along with many restaurants to chose from. Oh and tons of shopping! Our check in was smooth and the staff was very friendly. The desk clerk was very friendly, gave us a map of the resort, showed us where everything was. We got there around 4:15 which is right when check in starts and it seemed everyone else had the same idea. Which was to be expected since the place is so big! There were a few families in front of me but the line moved quickly. The resort even had live music at checkin and a special check in just for kids!! Next time I will go have dinner first to avoid the line and would suggest to not come at 4!! Once we got to the room, it was perfect!! I loved the fact that the kitchen was fully stocked which allowed us to cook dinner in the room rather than eat out all the time. The resort even has BBQ grills which we used and was close by our building. We ate dinner on our balcony which even had a ceiling fan. The room also had a washer and dryer which was great to dry our bathing suits. We found all these little perks to be great. The resort itself is a timeshare based resort, so dont expect them to come and clean up after you!! They WILL however bring you fresh towels and linen so that is a big help. The bed was super comfy too and so were the pillows. At fist site I thought the white duvet would be too thin since I'm spoiled by my own plush down comforter, but it was very soft and slept like a baby!! We spent time at both pools and found both to have their perks. Wakoola Springs is the newest pool and is a smaller version of a water park. It's Huge with 2 twirly water slides and 2 kid areas. There were cabanas which you could rent and very reasonable in prices and during the hot summer could be helpful. It seemed like there was always some sort of activity going on too. there was even a band at the pool! The other pool was at the clubhouse and was both indoor and outdoor that overlooked a long dock that you can even fish of off. There was an area that they do bonfires on certain nights, paddle boats, basketball courts,, you name it they had it!! We were overwhelmed with so much going on. This pool even had what they called a "Dive In movie" How cute!! It was a huge screen where you can float in the pool and watch a movie. We had drinks from both bars, both at the indoor outdoor pool and Wakoola Grill and they were yummy and refreshing (frozen mango margaritas!). The price was reasonable too. We didn't eat anything here besides some nachos which was massive by the way, to tide us over til dinner. We did meet some people there who said they tried the food on 2 nights and they enjoyed it. We were right near the clubhouse so I went there to use their computers. I didn't bring my laptop since this was suppose to be relaxing but found the free ones they offered served their purpose. They do offer it in the room at a small fee which I found is the norm for upper scale palces. I saw that some of the posts where people were upset about the resort charging for every little thing and if you are looking for everything free, go stay at a value hotel where you get all that for free but I guarantee it will be nothing in camparison of all the other free ammenities and ambiance you will experience here!!! Also noticed where people complained about the sales staff, but we were never bothered by them. Just wanted to pass that long so dont let that scare you away. Check out was a breeze! We checked our balance on the TV in our room then just dropped the keys in a box. This resort was so nice and we can't wait to go back! Although next time, we are going to sit through the sales pitch because I think it will be worthy of buying here! if anyone has any thoughts on this.please email me!!

Reviews.Title: “Kids didnt want to leave resort to go to disney world”
Reviews.Author: racin772000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and fun resort. Kids didnt want to leave resort to go anywhere. Spent just about the whole week there at resort. No complaints about anything. We will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent up and coming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Fountains back in April 2008 and whilst a lot of the resort was still under construction, our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms within this resort are huge, ours had a spacious kitchen area, two double bed rooms with en-suites, a lounge and balcony. You could quite comfortably fit a party of 5 within them and not feel squeezed for space. During our stay only 2 pools were available, there may be more now, which were of a more than decent size and never overcrowded. Its worth noting that whilst this hotel is located on International Drive, it is at the very southern end and is therefore not within easy walking distance to the main attactions and resturants of the Drive. This may be a positive thing for some and a negative for others depending on your perspective. In summary, a great resort that should be even better now that is completed. Easily recommended!

Reviews.Title: “this resort was totally amazing*****”
Reviews.Author: andreakaci
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on the first 2 weeks in may, the weather was in the 90's . there was 6 of us staying in building 6 room 4612, it had everything one needed in the apartment was very impressed with this resort, was sooo clean and was like a 5 star resort. the pool was amazing could never get my 6 year old out it, when we had days off from theme parks. some times she would be in the pool to 9pm.i couldnt believe we stayed here when we walked into the resort,it still makes me smile when i think of the fountains.if i could afford it ,i would return next year. my son who is 11 years loved the xbox nights in the H20 clubhouse and he liked the guys who worked there very friendly.well i miss the place and orlando was the best holiday we have ever been on..oh abit of advice take a very comfy pair of sandals, never walked so much in 2 weeks..still loved it thou..

Reviews.Title: “Had the Best Time”
Reviews.Author: funmommy_10
Reviews.Content: We just became Bluegreen owners last year so this was our first time staying at The Fountains. After reading the tripadvisor comments by some, I was a little skeptical about staying. I must say all those who had horrible things to say, we absolutely wrong. First, the pictures do no justice to how beautiful the resort actually is. There are so many different things to do there. Check in was 5 minutes. They originally assigned us to bldg. 3 but I told them I wanted to stay in the newer building 10. Without any hesitation, they switched the room. Everyone we came in contact with at the resort were nice. If they saw us coming they would open doors, or hold the elevator or anything to show appreciation for being a guest there. The room was so clean it looked unused. Everything you need is there. It is like staying "home away from home". The pool area and Wakoola Springs were awesome. Workers are outside everyday keeping the grounds looking good. We even went over to the other pool near the clubhouse from time to time. We played in the arcade. My husband and I dined right next door at Benihana restaurant, which was wonderful and walking distance. There is a Domino's pizza in the building. Publix, outlet stores, and other dining places are right down the street. Walmart is not that far. We were only minutes to Universal Studios and downtown Orlando. We had a wonderful time and I am already getting ready to plan for next year. People also have to remember, this is NOT a hotel. This is a resort. Housekeeping is not suppose to come make up your beds or clean the room uness you own and pay maintenance fees!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations. Very Family Friendly, immaculate, lots of on site activities”
Reviews.Author: artistsoulnme
Reviews.Content: Service was very good. Room was decorated nicely, granite countertops throughout, comfy beds, roomy, great screened in balcony, very very pleased with the room. Amenities of the resort were great. They had so much to do on site, you never need to leave. Gigantic pool area with a big 2 sided slide, a splash area for the kids, a hot tub, grill/bar, volleyball pole, cute canopy bikes you can rent to ride around the lake. Tented cabanas around the pool you could rent for the day. A long list of activities every single day something different for the kids to do. Live DJ and games at the main pool in the afternoon - nice mix of music. Hundreds of lounge chairs. One day we got to the pool in the busiest time of day and we still found chairs. Pool has nice shape, almost like a clover, so you don't feel like you are on top of everyone. Massage tent at pool, so much I can't list it all. Clubhouse was very nice also, indoor/outdoor pool. Swim up bar, coffee shop, restaurant w. large screen TV with all sorts of arcade games throughout, pool table, game room, playground, (as well as others throughout the property). Location was GREAT. 10 min ride to Disney, 5 min ride to SeaWorld. Plenty of stores close by (Publix, Walgreens, Strip mall w. Chinese Takeout, Subway, etc). This is a timeshare resort and I knew that going into it. I had even emailed a few trip advisor members asking them about it and they informed me that they don't pressure you. They ask you if you want to attend, tell you what discounts you can get for attending and you can simply say no. I chose to sit through the presentation for the Disney Discount tickets. The discount was worth it, although my ONLY complaint is that the lady at the service desk told us is was only 90 min and they serve you breakfast. Well, it was not 90 min. In total, from the Bkfst, to the presentation, to the Property Tour to the follow up sit down w. the Sales person - 4 HOURS. Arrived at 8:30am and didn't walk away until 12:30pm. So beware. I should have known better when she said 90 min. 90 min didn't include the Property Tour and high pressure sales tactics at the end. All in all, we resolved ourselves with the fact that the sacrifice was worth the money we saved on the tickets. For what we bought, we saved about $275 Overall, the Resort exceeded our expectations, it was beautifully kept and a wonderful family friendly place to stay. I would stay here again. It was very conveniently located to everything. There was enough to do at the resort to keep your kids busy all day long. Hoola Hoop contests at the pool, swimming races, etc all sorts of stuff and even trivia games for adults. They reward you with a free ice cream sundae or a free drink or appetizer from the bar. It was really really nice. We had a two bedroom villa w. the full kitchen, laundry closet w. washer/dryer, two bathrooms, dining area, living area w. pull out couch and the master bedroom had a large garden tub/jacuzzi. I loved having breakfast on the screened in balcony with my family in the mornings with the ceiling fan on over us creating a nice breeze. Each room had a ceiling fan. The lighting was a bit dim/dull in the Bathroom and Dining area but the kitchen had plenty of light. Water pressure was low in the showers, but I find that I'm never satisfied with that in any hotel. I assume they have special fixtures that reduce it. I am used to my home where I have a powerful shower head. Washer/Dryer was nice and big capacity. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you could need from wine glasses to potato peeler to cheese grater, to pots, pans, pyrex dishes, measuring cups etc. The only thing we forgot was Salt and Pepper : ) We brought some stuff from home that we already had (like coffee and filters and condiments etc) and then just went to Publix to get what food we needed for the week. There is a fee for housekeeping, which we did not pay for. No need, we simply threw our linens in the wash ourselves. But I believe it's optional. Internet is also a fee. I chose not to get it, the point of my vacation was to stay off the computer and spend time with my family. We have a 4 year old and what did come in handy was the DVD player and CD player right in the Villa for the times we were not out and about. As in all hotels, you can rent video games (they provide the controller) and you can rent movies etc. The TVs left a little to be desired (suggest they upgrade to Flat Panel). All in all a very pleasurable trip, we stayed 1 week. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: mommynicci
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous resort. The problem I have is we set a date and they took the wrong date down and when I tried to speak with someone about this I get "we will have to call you back by the end of the day" I received this same speech from SEVERAL different people and NO ONE has called me back or even pretended to care. I also found this resort to be VERY expensive. the price of the room is great, but it includes NOTHING. YOU have to make sure you take your own garbage out, load the dishwasher, and no one comes and cleans your room until you leave. You also pay out of pocket for EVERYTHING. For my husband to have lunch (chicken fingers and hamburger) it was 30.00 without tax. All kids activities are at least 10.00 each. The ONLY thing the price includes is your room.

Reviews.Title: “Postcards from sunshine heaven”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner06
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my children had ever been on a vacation, and they couldn't have been happier. We didn't go to any of the major attractions (even though they were all a couple minutes drive away). The moment we arrived, they wanted to go in the Wakoola Springs pool, and there they remained until they were waterlogged and exhausted. Not even a sunburn could keep them from going back to that waterslide/pool as soon as they had the green light from us :) There are so many things for the kids to do. May i recommend the "pyjama party"..For $10, the staff engages the child in games, movie, feeds them pizza, lets them stuff a teddy bear...in other words, for three hours, mom and dad get a relaxing break from the kids. They have activities for everyone, contests, live dj, HAPPY HOUR!!! (need i say more guys?) If you call the desk for anything, they ring you back to follow-up and assure that the need has been resolved. The staff is great, sleep quality PERFECT (those beds are HUGE and comfy) We took a pic of a sea turtle swimming under the bridge, took all week, but we got a pic of a gekko. Shopping is right around the corner, check-in was a breeze and they greeted the kids with balloon animals and popcorn. So many themes..always something to keep you busy. Internet does cost, but really when you think about it...do we really want to go to such a gorgeous place to sit in front of the laptop all day?...no way. :D Anyhoo...we will definitely be going back again...thank you Fountains for a wonderful week...and special thanks to the little residents of lake opal for singing me to sleep every night <3

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sunnysky2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks at The Fountains with my wife, daugher and friends. We all stayed in building No.7 a 2 bed condo it was clean and spacious with a large balcony. Short walk from pool areas but has a nice view of the lake. We all enjoyed the pool areas the slides were great. The pool bar snacks were good and was the h2o club house food. Fountains has a good atmosphere with music being played from a speaker system throught the resort. It's a large resort with 10 buildings location is close to Disney and Sea World and has the i ride stop just outside. Its close to the outlet malls they are walking distance but we used the i ride most of the time as its only a few stops. Would still advise hiring a car to get to restaurants malls and parks etc. they do offer a free shuttle bus to Disney. Friendly staff and a great location. We had a really good stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelinnlovinit
Reviews.Content: I, my fiance and our family stayed at the Fountains (in building 10) in March of 2010 and had a great experience. Our room was very spacious and it was nice having a full size kitchen (complete with dishes and dishwasher) and washer and dryer there. It was like we were staying home away from home. The Fountains are located on International Drive, which is one of the main streets in Orlando so it was easy for us to find all of the places we wanted to go. The hotel was conveinent to a Publix so we cooked a couple of times and it was also close to several restaurants. The hotel staff was very friendly and they hosted fun activities for us. I will say that most of the activities costed a few dollars per person so if you choose to participate in everything, you may end up spending $50-100, especially if you have children. My fiance and I didn't attend the time share presentation but our family members did and the presentaion only lasted two hours or so. Unless you want to pay for room service, it's up to you to keep your room clean on a day to day basis. It costs to get on the internet...but if you have a Blackberry or some other device that you can use to get online, you'll be fine. The indoor/outdoor pool was a lot of fun. All in all, for the price and location, we enjoyed the Fountains and we'd love to go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST choice we could have made and LOVED IT - Insight & Tips below”
Reviews.Author: Woodywoods
Reviews.Content: After tons of searching for the perfect resort for the family during our Orlando stay, we decided on the Fountains. At first we were a little weary after reading a few of the negative reviews but we could not have been happier with our choice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa on the top floor, jetted tub in master was great to jump in and relax after kids went to bed and long days at parks, own private balcony with table & chairs was great to get up in morning and have coffee & breakfast at, building was close to the pool for little walking and no noise at all from neighbors or pool goers. Before booking the room we let the reservation person know we are avid TripAdvisor.com readers and were hesitant to book after reading a few negative reviews. They put us in a newer building with all updated decor and by booking directly with them stayed for only $116/night ($130 after FL tax). I truly believe by mentioning Trip Advisor it almost guaranteed us a better bldg & room because they obviously don't want the bad "press" through negative feedback. He did let us know we would be asked to do a timeshare presentation but it was only optional and we could say no. We were only called on the first morning and respectfully declined with no pressure at all and no follow up calls the rest of our stay. Staff was friendly, resort amenities were all great. TIPS: Their big pool with really fun mini water park is only open til 9 pm so I would request to stay in Bldg. (if updated interior) closer to the clubhouse which that pool & jacuzzi is open til 11 pm and Bar, game room, sauna, gym are there (Building 2 I believe is the best geographically situated). They have fun daily family & kids activities to do which is posted daily in all elevators. Donâ€™t get too many pool towel cards than you need because in the fine print if you lose them they charge you $10 for each loss card (charge is understandably because they have to assume you didnâ€™t return a pool towel â€“ good tip to know though before getting 5 like we did and handing them out to all your little ones â€“ we caught that early tidbit early and held on to the cards ourselves). We only stayed 5 nights and then moved to a 3 bedroom vacation home in a more popular resort community. The privacy of renting our own home and ability to come home late from parks and jump in your own pool and jacuzzi was great but that's about all it had on the Fountains. And the home rate which started at $138/night but quickly rose to $200/night after $40/day pool heating fee and mandatory $65 cleaning fee and 13% tax rate vs. only $130 (Fountains rate) we wished we stayed at the Fountains the whole trip. I must say after doing a lot of due diligence and reading a lot of positive & negative reviews from all resorts in the Orlando area there are just people out there who will never be satisfied or justifiably may have just had bad experiences but this was far from our case. If we ever return to Orlando, we will definitely stay at the Fountains and not just recommend it but strongly encourage any family & friends who are heading to Orlando to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Kids cried when we left”
Reviews.Author: Jen2328
Reviews.Content: Usually when we do "Disney" vacations we come home more exhausted than when we left. We decided up front, from seeing the pictures of the pool complex, we would spend a significant amount of time at the resort this time. Theme park one day, resort day the next, and so on for a week. Honestly, the kids could have spent everyday at the resort, and skipped Mickey Mouse completely. The pool is huge, kids activities from 12-4, then again from 7-9, waterslides - kids paradise. Fun for them, relaxing for the parents! That's what vacation is all about, right? Not running your kids ragged until midnight every night in the FL day heat - Then wonder why they are crabby. I would highy recommend this resort, and highly recommend you spend some down time there. About the resort itself: The room...huge 2 bedroom, kitchen, balcony & washer and dryer were great. 1200 sq feet for the same price you would spend on the Disney Value resorts. The room was clean, although we had a few condensation marks on our drapes, probably from over running the air conditioner in the summer. Whenever we needed new towels, toilet paper, paper towels, dish detergent, etc -- call 0, and staff will bring it to you. Area...upscale area 10 minutes from Disney, 5 minutes from seaworld. Grocery store 2 blocks away. Property.....10 buildings around a lake, 2 huge pools, kids fountain areas and a clubhouse. a couple of small beaches (no swimming) but kids can make sandcastles. Gas grills for BBQing around lake every 300 feet or so. Eating -Grill/pool bar, full service restaurant & a grab and go on site, along with Dominos pizza & Benihana's. The resort is big enough not to be bored, but small enough that you can walk to everything. Very clean grounds. Was never bothered about a timeshare talk. Front desk was polite. A message was left on your phone every night about the following days activities. Negatives...Fitness center has 2 treadmills, 2 bikes & 1 eliptical. In my opinion, pathetic for the 1000 people the resort holds. Should be bigger. The bigger main pool's deck gets pretty slippery around the water slides. My younger daughter wiped out twice. On Saturdays it was hard to get lounge chairs around the pool (probably because you have the new people checking in along with the people checking out trying to get a last swim in before their flight). Check out is 10am, and they would not be flexible on that. If your flight is later, you can shower at the clubhouse. On Saturday nights they show poolside movies. Nice idea, but the movie was Avatar, and my kids (3 & 7) were scared to go in the pool while the movie was playing. I would suggest a younger movie. Overall, positives of the resort outweigh the negatives, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in late April. No complaints, check in went smoothly and room was perfect, just like the pictures on their site (we stayed in building 2). amazing price, compared to other hotels in the area, close to everything, outlet shopping, universal, walmart, disney, sea world. at check in they provided us with driving directions to all of the major attractions in the area, which was super helpful, and also recieved a phone call every night with the next days weather and activities that were planned. didnt get a chance to use any of the extras or pools so cant comment on how they were, although we did take a walk around. grounds were well manicured and all staff was friendly. security at front gate was a plus as well. also was not asked once about taking a 3hr sales tour, which i was relieved about.only complaint was that our building was very close to the pool and they would start playing music early in the morning, but it didnt bother us very much. all in all 5 stars, already planning our next stay back at the fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Would Have Been Better Off at a Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: eichhojv
Reviews.Content: If you like sitting through 3 hours timeshare presentations with pushy salesmen and staff who only care about the money in your pocket this is the place for you! We booked this resort through our local Basspro a few months ago. My family and I were excited to get to Orlando and stay in the beautiful timeshare resort. When we got to the resort we stood in line at the front desk for nearly 30 minutes to check in. The staff was slow, and did not show any care or compassion for the there guests. Upon entering the room we were very pleased. The appliances were all updated, the room was very clean, and the layout was very appealing, but there is a reason they do the timeshare presentation as soon as you get to the resort... They do not give you time to see all of the flaws. The televisions were absolutely terrible! There was a DVD player in the room that did not work. The washer and dryer were so loud we had to leave the room when we ran them. The water in the shower smelled awful. We had to beg for fresh towels and linens that we had to change and maintain ourselves. Outside the room the pool was very nice. The problem with the pool was you had to have tickets to get towels, you had to put money down on anything you wanted to do, and the price of drinks were very expensive. The club house was poorly ran. They had 3 computers in the clubhouse for use. We had to use one because they do NOT offer Free Wi-Fi in the rooms! Very inconvenient!. The computers in the club house were outdated and were horrible. It seemed as if we were using dialup internet. It took us 30 minutes to print off our tickets for Universal Studios, a process that should take 5 minutes. Checkout took just as long. We spent another 20 minutes in line to check out, and when we were bringing out luggage to the truck, a woman slipped and fell coming out of the elevator because the maintenance had mopped the floor and had located the wet floor signage in a very poor location. Who mops the floor at 10 in the morning? Overall, our stay was average at best. We enjoyed the location of the hotel and the layout of the room, but the amenities and staff made us very happy we did not purchase a timeshare from Blue Green.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place good location but too high dollar”
Reviews.Author: gman45
Reviews.Content: My family and I, wife and two sons, spent a week in the resort as part of a promotional deal between Bass Pro and the Blue Green Resorts. We were down for Spring Break (and so was everyone else) and planned to visit Disney for a day or two. The resort was close to everything so it was not a problem driving ourselves to the parks. We would have used the resort shuttle sevice but it only left at certain times(only 3 times a day)and went to certain parks. Disney was way to crowded but we made the best of it. The room at the resort was quite nice, with all of the amenities of home and plenty of space for the four of us. However, we heard every footstep from the room above and no one respected the quiet time of 11 pm. In fact it seemed that was the time when everybody decided to start partying. The clubhouse closed at 11 pm which problably explains the timing. There is an additional charge to have the maids come in and clean your room each day so we did not use their service, so the washer and drier in our room proved useful. A single premium drink (crown and seven) cost me $10 and a single 12 oz beer is $6. If you buy the cute litle plastic souveneir mug(16 oz) it will cost you $12, but hey all your refills are only $10. Thank goodness for Publix about a 1/4 mile away. Now down to the meat and potatoes.... We were told that the sales presentation would take no more than 1 1/2 hours.....YEA Right.... and oh, it was supposed to be a "no pressure" sales pitch. It started out ok and the salesman seemed friendly enough, in fact he said to us "I want to meet you as a friend and no matter what happens I want to stay your friend" He spent a great deal of time trying to get into our heads and pick our brains for things he could use on us during the presentation, and boy did he. He asked a bunch of personal questions that migth seem as though he was just being nice but he used everything we said as a bargaining point as we sat through a 3 hour 42 min babble about how we could not afford to pass up the opportunity of a lifetime. When we started telling the sales man that we were not going to buy(we started at the two hour mark) he eventually got all pissy, grabbed the packete from my wife and said "Well there is your free gift" , he quickly scribbled his signature on it and left us in a huff. The next day I saw him with another couple as we waited together for the elevator, I said hi to him and asked how he was doing and he totally ignored me, really, he would not even look at me. Some friend huh! Overall the resort was nice and clean but the timeshare package was way over priced, the salesman was pushy. and spent too much time staring at my wifes breasts, well he kept saying how much he liked her "necklace", but we knew what he ment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: zc97
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of February and absolutely loved it. The staff are friendly and they keep it very clean. The room was very nice, it had a whirlpool tub, full kitchen, screen porch, and much more. The clubhouse was centrally located, and it had everything to fit your needs- bar, coffee shop, game room, daily activities, you name it. There were two huge pools which were heated. There is also a Domino's on site. Overall, this is a great place to stay, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, the rest is so-so”
Reviews.Author: 2onatrip
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Location was very, very good for travel to Disney locations, SeaWorld, Universal Studios and the Convention area restaurants, etc. -The complex was pretty quiet most of the time. -International Drive is on the Trolley line...so good free transportation nearby. -laundry facilities are in the room. Also iron and ironing board Best thing to say about this place is the location Cons: -Considering all the amenities they advertise, the place was somewhat staid. -The on-site eating left much to be desired. Best bet would be to order Dominos Pizza. -Dominos must know you will get desparate for good food, they have a satellite station right on the property and deliver to your room with a little golf cart. -Note there is no housekeeping service. You clean up after yourself, just like being home. On the next to last night, they come in for a complimentary cleaning, but I would guess that is really to inventory their stuff to make sure you didn't take/break anything. Why else clean up the night before you leave? -The "lobby" is isolated in a separate building - hoping you won't walk through and remember you need something? -The room we were in 6107 had a Huge mold/mildew ring around the light fixture in the shower. That was pretty disgusting. Also the night it rained, the padded valance in the master bedroom became soaked. The window was not open, not sure where exactly the water came from. -Many of the pool activities were extra charge and they seemed a little high priced. The pool music was so loud you could hear it clear over in building 6 some days -You will get mighty thirsty if you wait for the bartender to notice you at the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place.”
Reviews.Author: 60ishbumpkins
Reviews.Content: Our traveling companions did a trade for their timeshare. This is the 3rd time we traveled with them to their Shell time share or a trade. This one would rate as number 3. The other two were wonderful, excellent, this one very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great time”
Reviews.Author: Cannon98
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Fountains for 5 nights with our 2 & 4 yr old. We were in the newly renovated building 10 with 2 bedrooms. It was perfectHowever, the walls are kind of thin. But it didn't bother us. We stayed there on the time share presentation deal. We had to attend the 90 minute presentation which turned into just under 3 hrs (kind of long with two kids or even without kids). After the 3 hrs we were not approached again to buy or pressured about the time share. It was worth the 3 hrs to get the good deal with Disney tickets. The indoor/outdoor pool was nice and warm. The kids loved going between it and the hot tubs. There were activites planned that all had a small fee but everyone seemed to enjoy them. It was 15 mins from Disney, 10 mins from Gatorland, 5 from Seaworld and 3 mins from Outlet shopping. And there is a Domino's pizza takeout in building 10. Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Love Bluegreen Resorts!”
Reviews.Author: photonut123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Bluegreen owners. We have never been disappointed with any Bluegreen resort. When we stayed at The Fountains, we were able to stay on Bluegreen's Bonus Time. This means we didn't pay but $69.00 @ night! One of the perks of being a Bluegreen owner. We did the tour, even though we hadn't planned on it. It was fine. The gift we got was worth the hour it took. No pressure. This was the 1st time we had ever been to Orlando and did not stay on Disney property. We only went to Sea World and The Fountains was excellent for that because it was just right down the road. We ate from the Dominos pizza on site at the resort twice. It was very good. It was really cool while we were there, and we really didn't get a chance to check out the pool. The resort is beautiful, safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Booking In”
Reviews.Author: davegkemp
Reviews.Content: The Fountains. 12400 SOUTH INTERNATIONAL DRIVE , ORLANDO, FLORIDA 32821 GOOD POINTS: Good quality accommodation and amenities. Lovely pools. BAD POINTS: Extremely anti British Attitude from the Manager and reception staff. After a 14 hour journey from the UK, we got to the fountains tired and hungry. We were told that we hadn't booked because they had no booking record. Good job we had. The room we should have had was occupied so they gave us another room. We let ourselves in to find another British family already in the room. They had had the same trouble getting the room they had booked. It took another 2 hours for them to find us a room. Strange thing was, the complex was less than half full. The only other bad point is that we used the smaller and older pool area because it was quieter. Well it was for a couple of days, then that too became intrusive and hardly conducive to having a "quiet" holiday. The holiday was spoiled by their lack of professionalism and downright indifference. I will never go back there and would not advise anyone else to either, especially i you're British.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diamondave22
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at The Fountains, last year was three days, this one for a full week. Very few things not perfect!! As a Bluegreen owner, get tired of them always hitting you up for points upgrades, but other than that no complaints!! Will definitely return!! New pool area is great for families with younger kids, and "older" pool is nice for sheltering from the wind. Awesome time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: sowen8
Reviews.Content: The entire facility was wonderful. It has a mini water park on the premises and a restaurant. It was a peaceful environment.

Reviews.Title: “Fountains”
Reviews.Author: khawkins
Reviews.Content: The best place we have ever stayed. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: vickinca
Reviews.Content: in my grddaughers words, this is a hotel it looks more like an apartment re the unit. Loved the fact that the kids had their own TV, bathroom and one bed each. Used the indoor pool as the week we where there weather was cold and rainy, did not have time to use the kids programs as we where only here for 5 nights and used this as a base for Disney, next time we will stay longer so we can enjoy all this Resort has to offer. Close to shopping, Disney and even NASA will be coming back here again

Reviews.Title: “Out to get your hard earned money”
Reviews.Author: joanmah123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased a vacation from Blue Green Resorts a.k.a. Fountains Resort in Olando, Fl 2yrs ago for a discounted price of $200 for a 5night/6day stay that was supposed to be used by 4/09. We never received any paperwork in the mail....so due to our busy life style we forgot about the vacation. THE RESORT HAPPILY GOT THEIR $200. In 1/10 we received a phone call from the resort saying that they would hono our vacation, even though it was past the experation date. My husband told the lady Christine in the sales department the I would be able to take the trip, but he would not be able to attend, She said that was not a problem and she switched everything over to my name. I spoke with Christine a number of times to set up my travel arrive and she upgraded my to stay at a villa for an extra $50 a night. So at this point, Fountains Resort has $450 of MY HARD EARNED MONEY. I called before I left before my long drive down the east coast from Cap Cod down to Florida (traveling alone).I told them that I did not received any confirmation in the mail that they were suyppose to send. They said "NO WORRIES" and someone would call me in the next 24-48 hrs...someone finally called me 5days later as I'm crossing the Florida state line. Long story short, they said they my husband would have to be present with me to take the 90minute time-share presentation for me to get that deal. I reminded her that I told Christine that my husband would not be joining me and the young lady Jennifer (who was very nice) said that they could not accomidate me without my husband. She intructed that I call her supervisor Jacklyn the next day to see if there was anything that she could do. I called Jacklyn the next day and she was absolutely useless. She is standing by the hotel policy that I was NEVER inform ed of,since paperwork was never sent out to me. So here I am in Florida with no place to stay and $450 that at this point I have a hell of a time getting back. Fountains Resort, ENJOY YOUR BAD REVIEW. I've worked for Marriott for over 6yrs and I currently work at a prvate resort on Cape Cod. We have never, nor would we ever treat one of guest the way that you've treated me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, grounds, location, service”
Reviews.Author: starketcher
Reviews.Content: I bought this thru an online auction for 1 weeks' stay. It was a big bargain! We were very pleased. Beautiful grounds, nice pool, good-sized, fully equipped 2 bedroom condo, centrally located. No hard sell on the timeshare either, which I was kind of expecting. They asked at check in if we wanted to attend a sales meeting for 90 minutes with $75 gift card. I declined and that was it! The condo was more than what the two of us needed, but the extra room was nice and having a w/d was great--no dirty clothes when I got home! In fact, the only complaint I have is that you have to pay for the internet. That sucked. It was not cheap either - $30 for the week! Other than that, no complaints and only accolades!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: cilla111
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando today. Our stay at The Fountains was great. My husband and I went with our 13 year old son and 11 year old daughter. It was a good value for a two bed two bath condo. We had a good view from building #6 and our room was recently updated. I would recommend a high floor, which is what we had. My only complaint would be that we couldn't check in before 4:00. It would have been nice after an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: We staryed here for our last 7 days in Orlando and this was the best. Huge two bedroom condo in the new 10 th block. A superb huge pool which was excellent to sun bath around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: aidansgrammy
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter-in-law and 3 children ages 6, 3 & 3 mo were going to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure for a long w/e. I was trying to book a hotel that included a kitchen & 2 bedrooms-(no way was I going to spend 2 nights on a pull out sofa bed with grandkids!). Found the Fountains on S. International Dr and looked like it met all the criteria needed. Got a great price for Fl residents and would have paid full price if I would have known how beautiful this resort was! We got to the resort around 7:00 pm, easy check in and was absolutely amazed at the size & condition of the "villa". The kitchen was fully equiped, exceptionally clean and the entire unit was immaculate. The master suite had a HUGE jetted tub, separate shower/toilet, king size bed and access to the screened patio. The second bedroom had 2 double beds with large closet. We ate dinner in the room and after a fairly good night sleep, was rested enough to take on the crowd at Universal. It was a little further drive than was stated by the representative of Hotels.com, but since it was Sunday, made it to the park within 15 min. I can't tell you how enjoyable it was to return "home" to another meal & better night sleep. My only regret was we did not plan enough time to enjoy all the ammenities of the resort. This place had one of the biggest outdoor pools I've ever seen. It also had an indoor/outdoor pool that showed "dive-in" movies on Saturday night.
