This is a wonderful place for families with children, no matter what the ages. Probably the most enjoyable stay in Orlando we ever experienced. Definitely will go back, only longer this time! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: bareboatbvi
Reviews.Content: Decided to do something FUN this year, instead of visiting family (oh!oh!) to the north. We arrived at about 8:30 on a Wednesday night after drving about 13 hours. The check-in process was very, very, slow although there were two individuals doing check-in. I happened to be 2nd in line and still waited over 20 minutes to be checked in. The check-in people were pleasant, but just slow. When we arrived at our room (2bdrm, 2bath suite) we were pleasantly surprised at the size and comfort of the room. The room was clean, and looked as though it had everything we needed for a stay of five days. Please note: there is NO housekeeping unless you ask for it, and that is a separate charge. But, there were an adequate number of towels, dishes, etc., so we opted to not have room service. Our purpose for visiting Orlando was, what else, but to spend as much time at Disney World as poosible. This facility does provide a shuttle to Disney World, but we decided to drive instead. That allowed us to come and go at our leisure. The dining facilities are adequate ... don't expect 3 or 4 star food and service, but it was okay. We did tend to have our meals away from the hotel and theme park ... that's another reason we drove. But once you pay for parking at the park, you can come and go as you like without having to pay again (for that day). Parking at any one of the theme parks is $12. Last comment: do not bring your laptop unless you're willing to pay for internet connection. It is $12.95 a day, wireless or wired.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Recommend”
Reviews.Author: KaramelKissess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ( plus two teenage boys 13,14) stayed at The Fountains a total of four days. Check-in is at 4pm however, they allowed us to complete the paper work as soon as we arrived (about 9ish). When we returned, check in was very smooth. We didn't have to wait long and customer service was great. Having read prior reviews, I asked to stay in one of the newer buildings ( bldg 10). Upon entering the two bedroom suite, we immediately did an inspection. The room was great! Very clean! Fully stocked kitchen (plates, glasses, utensils, pots and pans). The beds are very comfortable and you will get a good nites sleep. The master bathroom is very spacious: two sinks, small garden tub, and a walk in shower big enough for four people. The main bathroom is very spacious as well. This suite also has a washer and dryer, and television in every area. The screened in porch area ( table and chairs) was also very clean and overlooked the pool. There are activities for the kids but all of them at a cost. The fitness room has adequate equipment and there is a "corney" game room for the kids. There are two pools: Wakoola Springs Pool (which overlooked our balcony) and Water's Edge Pool (indoor/outdoor). This pool is suppose to be heated but it was not and very chilly. This location is right around the corner from SeaWorld and approximately five miles from Disney. Overall we enjoyed are stay here and I would highly recommend it. If you are a military family (like we are) book this room through GOV Vacation Rewards, the rate was great. Overall we enjoyed are stay here and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Kids will love it!”
Reviews.Author: beltwayorbust
Reviews.Content: We recently joined Blugreen in Charleston SC. The Fountains was our second Bluegree resort we have visited. Absolutely way over delivered from what we were expecting. Furnishings and comfort off the charts, room had 2 bedrooms, master, jacuzzi,walk in seperate shower,tile and marble, comfortable king size bad,walk out screen porch. The living room was wonderful, HUGE screened porch overlooking Lake Eve, could see WDW fireworks off balcony as crow flies directly across, guess 3 miles from Magic Kingdom, could even hear fireworks explosions Family fun all around resort, security guard that let you in gate at night, mutliple places to get drinks,dinner and snacks...snack bar only had one worker but she was giving it her all, but they needed 1 more. 12 million dollar pool complex,Wakoola Springs,water slides,splash pools,jacuzzi's etc...also had another pool area overlooking Lake eve by builing 6 we stayed in...indoor outdoor, steam room,sauna...on and on Just great place, oh an dthe kids programs all day long Big thumbs up, if I was you I would join, we did similar tour with Marriott 3 years ago, 20,000 less to join Bluegreen and much better boutique resorts...a true no brainer...this property a perfect 10! Oh yeah 1 mile to Sea World 10 minutes to Universal 5 minutes to Downtown disney/epcot area? Benenihanas next door too Lobster 32 bucks! and steak..yum

Reviews.Title: “WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: dontstayathome
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a FABULOUS stay at the Fountains and we are already checking our calendars to see when we can go back! Our villa (2 bedroom, 2 bath) was very clean and the employees could not do enough for us. For example (just 1 but I could list many!) - in the villa it asks you to please take your trash to the trash chutes and not place your garbage in the hallways. Not knowing where our trash chute was in the building we were staying in we called the "service number" and asked where ours was and their response was not to worry about it, just set it outside our door and someone would be right up to take it and gues what.....within 15 minutes it was GONE!! These people just couldn't do enough for you! Our villa was in bldg. 10, floor 3 and we had a marvelous view of the FANTASTIC Wakoola Pool which had a d.j. most of the afternoon and children and family entertainment. We ordered food from the "WatersEdge" restaurant (which is located at the indoor/outdoor pool area) and it was excellent! The ONLY reason I would not give this resort 5 stars (and I did even though I had this problem because I think it deserved it) is because I asked for a late check out (1:30) because my daughter came down with the flu and our flight home wasn't until 4:30 and they declined my request and told us that we had to vacate our unit by noon. I understand that there were other people wanting to check in (the resort was definately NOT sold out!) but I felt that they could have allowed us to stay later because of the circumstances. Also, we took the timeshare meeting that was offered and even though they state that it will only be 90 minutes (and possibly up to 120 minutes!) we were not "released" until 10:20 and our "meeting" started at 7:30 so don't sign up for one of these unless you have 3 hrs. to waste! We did receive a $75 Visa gift card for attending that we used to purchase Sea World tickets at Maple Leaf ticket center because their prices are cheaper than the ticket center in the Fountains ticket center. We cannot recommend this resort highly enough....it is FANTASTIC and we are looking forward to a trip back! You can actually go to this resort and NOT visit any of the surrounding attractions (Disney, MGM, SeaWorld) and have plenty to keep you busy! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Fountains!”
Reviews.Author: FLgal8
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?? My husband and I booked a week's stay at the Fountains so our grown children and their kids could visit us while we stayed in Orlando. We had each family stay two nights with us so everyone could enjoy the resort. We arrived on Friday at 3 PM and only had to wait a couple of minutes before it was our turn to check-in. Had no trouble at all with check-in. My husband requested a room in Building 10 (the newest building) which we were able to get. Our suite (two bedrooms, two baths) faced right out to the beautiful, large, pool area. We especially chose the Fountains because of the large pool slides, and the kiddie pool area. We had done a lot of researching online for a suite to stay at that was offered through our Armed Forces Vacation Club. When it came time to book, there really was no other resort that offered everything that the Fountains did. The suite had everything we would need for a week's stay, even a laundry basket, iron, and ironing board (although we did not use the iron or ironing board...lol). The bathrooms and kitchen all had granite countertops. The master bathroom was huge, the largest bathroom we've ever had the chance to experience. The shower was large enough for at least two people. There was a jetted bath tub but we did not use it as we both prefer showers. We also had a nice screened-in porch, which looked right out onto the pool area. What a lovely way to begin the day or end it! The resort offered lots of activities although we did not partipate in them since we were quite busy park hopping. One caution: the outdoor pool was never really warm enough for us to enjoy it. The "heated" pool was somewhat warmer but not what I would consider warm, although it was warm enough so that we could swim in it. The resort had several (I think 4) hot tubs, which we did use several times, usually after a long day at one of the theme parks. The hot tub to the left of the large pool is salt water, if you prefer that. I heard it's supposed to be good for your skin. The hot tub inside near the indoor-outdoor pool has a sign stating that children are not allowed in it, but while we were there, most of the time the only people in that hot tub were kids. Although we had read online that some people were harassed by phone calls wanting them to purchase a time share, we never received even one of those calls. The only time we got a message it was from someone informing us of daily activities at the resort. We would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: mifd18
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week with my wife & two boys ages 9 & 6. i am originally from australia & have traveled quite a bit from japan to greece to many places in America. the fountains is at the top of my list & we are planning another trip to orlando simply because of the fountains. check in was easy & quick, usual push for meeting with time share sales but absolutley no pressure or even mentioned again when we politley declined. security was very helpful & friendly. our room in building three was very clean, spacious for a family of four & beautiful furnishings. the gounds, pools, activities, service & upkeep were first class international standards, trust me i have experienced international standards. & at $95 per night for special firefighter rate it was a bargain. of the very few negative reviews i have read i feel that those people who complained about the fountains were either very unlucky or the type of people who simply arent happy unless they are complaining about something. i have worked in the tourism hospitality industry for over 25 years & know those type of people only too well. location is excellent on international drive. i could not find fault with the fountains & highly recomend this resort to everyone. a lot of reviews mentioned a fee for internet but i found a wireless connection easily & did not cost me a penny.

Reviews.Title: “Super Resort”
Reviews.Author: mimta
Reviews.Content: Fountains overall is a great great resort along with their staff. The resort is very well kept and clean. Once we walked into the lobby to register, it was like fresh air, very clean. Even the restrooms in the lobby area so clean and it always smells fresh. We ere staying in building 4 on the second floor and had a 2 bedroom deluxe. Inside of the rooms is okay, nothing over the top. We had a screened patio which was great. We mainly used the pool thatâ€™s by building 4 since it was close to our building and we didnâ€™t feel walking to the wakoola springs pool which is humongous. The pool by building 4 was always well kept throughout the day, but then again there were not many people at the pool, the most was maybe 4-5 people a day. The one problem that we ran into was with the outside Jacuzzi. The outside Jacuzzi was way too hot when I say hot I mean hot, you could not go in right away and had to go in gradually, even after you got in well you had to get out because you could not be in there for very long since it was ridiculously hot. We reported it to the staff and nothing was done about it, and we were at the resort for 7 days. Then the Jacuzzi in the inside pool was cold for a day and the next day hot just like the Jacuzzi outside. We have been on fountains property for a week and the Jacuzzi problem was not fixed. I donâ€™t think that the guests should address that issue and report it to the staff, after all they have people who are opening the pools in the morning shouldnâ€™t they check the water temperatures? Well I guess at Fountains they just donâ€™t care, they wait until a guest gets burned or something before they take it seriously. Second complain I have is the free shuttle to Disney. Beware that the free shuttle is not really free and here is why: We reserved the shuttle, got in the shuttle, and as soon as the driver started to drive, he pulled a sign that states that tip is expected and next to the sign was a $5 bill. That really made me so mad, I mean donâ€™t get me wrong of course I would tip and its up to each individual to tip but you can not put a sign up like that pretty much forcing the passengers to tip and to top it of putting a dollar amount on that tip or making us look stupid as if we do not know to tip the driver. I have read a lot of complaints about not being able to take any food to the pool, I canâ€™t comment on that, because I have seen 2 other families including us eat and drink at the pool and we were not told anything. Keep in mind also that throughout our stay there maybe 4-5 people the most at the pool, I guess its because of the slow season. And the pools stay open until 10 p.m. even through I hear that the inside pool is supposed to be open until 11 p.m. The security at the resort is absolutely great, you could walk at any time and feel absolutely safe. There is also a Walgreens and a Publix (love that store and wish we had one here where we live) so you can get your grocery done there. I also recommend getting the Trolley pass, it is worth it every penny especially when you go get groceries. Another tip I have is if you want to save on transportation from and to the resort, then you can hop on a bus from the airport and it will take you directly to the resort, I think its bus 42, not sure. When you walk out of the airport just follow the signs for buses or ask which bus takes you to to international drive, you pay 2 bucks a person and save at least 50 bucks that way, taxis and shuttles are very expensive. And if you are going to the airport there is a bust stop right in front of the hotel so you donâ€™t have to walk a lot. The bus drive is at least 2 hours but in my mind worth it. I have read that some people have complaint about the bugs but we have encountered none.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort - fabulous pool!”
Reviews.Author: greenbeavers
Reviews.Content: There were six of us - two adults and four children. We arrived after our transatlantic flight late at night and would have appreciated a courtesy bottle of water in our fridge and overall I feel it is the lack of the little touches that let this resort down. However, our apartment was clean and well appointed and had a pleasant view over a small lake. The huge Wakoola Springs pool was briliant and kept the kids (and adults) occupied for hours. The two water slides are superb and there was an abundance of sun beds. It was beautifully quiet and for a family more used to battling for sunbeds in European resorts it was a great novelty to be able to choose where we "set up camp"! A couple of gripes - no umbrellas for shade just a few palm trees and the cost of drinks in the bar was extortionate! That aside the whole area was clean and well landscaped. We found the resort well placed for all the attractions in Orlando but you do need to have a car. Another bonus was free parking. The not so good things which irritated a little were that cleaning of the apartment during your stay incurs a charge of $10 per day (something which is not mentioned on their website); there was no blanket provided for the sofa bed and the sofa bed was difficult to operate and not particularly comfortable. There is also a ban on guests taking their own food and drink to the pool areas - if the bar prices were more reasonable people would not want to take their own!! Overall a good resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Orlando vacations at Fountain resort”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoVacations
Reviews.Content: was extremely impressed by the services of (--) . It truly was a home "away from home". The site gave us booking in fountain resort which provided us all the comforts of home coupled with beautiful window views of theme arks and sea world. Check-In was easy and any questions or concerns were readily addressed. I would definitely recommend this Fountain resort to any family and couples traveling to the area Orlando and will absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains”
Reviews.Author: tigercheryl
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here. All the employees were friendly and helpful. The two bedroom was very nice, washer/dryer and full kitchen. The bedrooms are spaced apart so it's nice for privacy. We stayed in building 2 which is the best for being close to everything. Another nice thing was we slept in a brand new bed, they were still in the process of replacing others in the building while we were there. Room was clean, no problems at all. The lights in the bathroom are very dim like others have said in their reviews, here's the trick though the longer you leave the light on the brighter it gets. I loved the pool, plenty of chairs and great atmosphere. Negative is if you like the late night stuff it's not here. Everything is shut down by 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent resort ~ high standard of accomadation & very secure.....”
Reviews.Author: Wokkoone
Reviews.Content: We just got back from two weeks at the Fountains and we are ready to book again for next year... This was our 14th trip to Florida over the past 10 years and the Fountains was of a high standard and excellent value for money.... We had 3 seperate rooms as we went with frends and family and we booked only for the 1st week initially via Expedia and decided to stay for the second within the 1st day.... 4 star standards for sure ~ the quality easily equals the Hilton Grand Vacation Club & Sheraton Vistana Resort that we have stayed in previously. Good quality accomadations, loads of things going on around the complex for the children and good pools complete with kids area and slides. There is no hassle to look at joining the time-share facility and the whole complex is clean & very secure ~ they call you to confirm your Domino pizza delivery before they allow the guy on site..... One disapointment is that they should include the daily maid service ~ this costs $20 per visit... However they will bring you a full load of fresh towels on request and generally within 30 minutes... The later built blocks are the most modern ~ buildings 8& 10 although building 6 is also very good. I would recomend this resort to anyone....

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ilovemyboys3535
Reviews.Content: when checking into this hotel we were told we would be staying in the "new building" when we arrived at our room it was apparant that it was not new, there was mold in the master bath and it also appeared to be a previous leak that they attempted to paint over. The dishes were also dirty in the suite there was food that was dripped all over the cabinets in the master and main bathrooms.When we arrived at the pool my son went to take a drink out of the water fountain and instead of cold water there was very hot water that could have easily burned a young childs mouth. They also closed the pool on are second day as well as the surronding area so my kids could not use the activites table. \When we did complain to the management they only tried to talk their way out of why the room was the way it was (after i had shown them pictures of the problems) we will never stay at the fountains or any bluegreen property again. We were very disappointed .

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Resort Value”
Reviews.Author: Annette09
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Fountains twice now and our experience was outstanding. Once was a family trip and the other was a business trip with family included. It was perfectly located near Disney, Sea World, and the convention center. The second trip we had lots of rain, but the resort had so many kids activities going on our kids never even complained about the weather. You honestly don't need the parks to have a great vacation at this hotel. And the service is outstanding! As my 5 year old, home-body put it, "I love this place, because it's just like home!" I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Orlando with small children. The spacious 2 bedroom condo was great, and saved us a ton of money having a kitchen right in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: maryDennis2905
Reviews.Content: We stayed ina 2BR unit in building 4 and it was larger than the newer 2BR units and the decorating was a little older, but nice. The staff could issue extra pillows two at a time and we had 7 people so we had to ask two consecutive days to get the extras we needed, but they were very timely about anything else we asked for. We used it as home base for our Disney excursions and used a rental car not the shuttle. The last night we were there, my wife noticed ONE cockroach which we told the desk about at checkout. The pools were great. For a Disney vacation, we'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: fiaphotography
Reviews.Content: We did a ton of research for a timeshare exchange for orlando, near disney. This hotel did not let us down...the accommodations were amazing!! Of course, we think a lot has to do with the new construction building we stayed in, building #10. The room itself was fantastic - brand new, HUGE (2 bedroom)- and very separate quarters, clean, convenient...we were thrilled and very picky when it comes to hotels. The new pool was huge...and the proximity to Disney was perfect - very quick car ride. The staff was attentive and responsive....great experience. The only slight criticism is we think they oversold their restaurants a bit...we were not impressed... Otherwise, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel6
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times - have NEVER had a bad experience. The kids absolutely LOVE IT! We visit Orlando (Disney) several times a year and always rely on the Fountains for a wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fountains!”
Reviews.Author: luv2go78
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend spent at The Fountains. We cannot think of one thing to say negative. The pool is so big that it was never crowded. Though it did rain during our stay, the pool was open soon after. I like that you go through security at entrance. I also liked security at the pool making sure that only guests of the resort are using the pool area. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. We loved eating out on the balcony. It was private, screened in and also had a fan. The grounds were beautiful. Workers were quite pleasant. There were lots of activities for the whole family. It is close to all the major theme parks. While it is not cheap here, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort! Other Reviews Don't Do it Justice!!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife11
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about this resort and I was very skeptical until we got there. The resort was beautiful. We didn't have to stand in line for check in. They let us check in at 2pm even though check in wasn't until 4. The room was very clean and beautiful. We stayed in building 10 which I think is a remodeled building. We requested a unit with a jacuzzi and they made sure we got it. I felt like royalty. The pool was closed for a little while on the first day because of lightning. That was the only time they closed it though. The whole rest of the week the pool was open from 7am to 10pm. I never had any problems getting a towel from the stand with our towel cards. I have to say that all of the other people who gave this resort bad reviews must be hard to please. We stayed for a week and had minimal problems. They gave us a complimentary midweek room refreshment which we have never received at other week long stays. The last night we stayed there was a lot of noise coming from a room above us. It was around midnight so I called security. They were at our room asking where the noise was coming from within 10 minutes and they put a stop to it within 15-20 minutes. That is service if you ask me. Also, our safe in our room locked us out and we called the front desk. They had it fixed within 20 minutes. I couldn't have asked for better results. This resort is definitely worth it. Its only 10 minutes from Disney and is very easy to find. We were impressed and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best resorts in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: glenberry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a great week in this fabulous resort. We had had a week on Fort Myers Beach the previous week in a small quiet beach hotel and then drove north to have a week at the Fountains via a timeshare exchange. Its located on the quiet part of International Drive south of Sea World and just before Vineland Avenue (Premium Outlets). The location is superb - 10 mins north on I Drive to Sea World, 20 mins north on I Drive to Wet'n'wild, 5 mins to Premium Outlet, and 10 mins to Disney - south on I Drive turn right at bottom and along SR 536. This large Blue Green development has 8 blocks (we were in building 8) 2 swimming pools and 2 large lakes. Our 2 bed unit was very large and clean. It consisted of a well planned and well equipped kitchen with a utility room with washer and dryer opening off it, dining area, bathroom, bedroom, living area, screened balcony, master bedroom with en suite. The living room had a free safe. Good points - really well equipped, clean, free safe AND- very environmentally friendly by hotel standards - they use low energy bulbs, green cleaning materials, recycled water etc (pity they had no solar panels - why do so few hotels in the sunshine state have solar panels?) Bad points - ridiculously high charge for internet - this should be free in a hotel of this standard - they wanted more per day than I pay per month at home. Some pestering by activity staff via daily phone messages In summary - it's as good as the Sheraton Vistana, Hilton Grand Vacation Sea World and Holiday Inn Orange lake - and it's in a great location

Reviews.Title: “On 12th visit to Orlando and discovered this gem of a resort.”
Reviews.Author: adafitz
Reviews.Content: Wow! Can not tell you how much we enjoyed this fabulous property.It was so close to all the action yet had the real feel of a place to fully relax.Have been coming to Orlando for 20 years now and obviously enjoy it but this place was paradise for my family .Agree with others about WiFi and this should be free too but actually by refusing to pay for it meant that I left behind all those emails etc and the kids engaged with us too. Benihana was next door and we ate there but we also ate in room and visited the wonderful Texas de Brazil (outstanding) Near a Publix and fully equipped for proper cooking rather than simply heating up meals. Pool is fantastic and because it was so good we spent more time here and less time in parks . Got a great deal with Expedia and would not hesitate to return .

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, kids activites, grounds and layout of room”
Reviews.Author: Reg010
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Fountains. My girls(7,5 and 14months) loved the pool. The little one loved the beach entry portion of the pool. The 2 older ones loved the slides. The pool never seems crowded because it was so big. My entire family really enjoyed the activites(ice cream making, pirate games, bingo, etc) they had at the pool area. The girls also really like the daily activities(arts and crafts, nature tour, High school Musical activities) in the kid center. The layout of the room was great. Two bedrooms and two baths. Master had a jacuzzi tub which the girls loved. The ONLY downfall was the internet access. ONLY building 10(newest building) has wireless internet access. We stayed in building 8 which was close to the pool area and the kids liked looking at the fish and turtles going over the bridge. You can purchase hard wired internet access for 29.95 for 6 days which was fine for us but I thought they would have wireless on the entire property. It is about 10 minutes from Disney, close to Outlets and grocery store. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: fontaine1919
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the fountains, rooms, pools, staff, location. I WILL stay here every time I go to orlando. Chris Fontaine West Greenwich, R.I.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, fine room”
Reviews.Author: Travlin_famly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains for a 5 nights which we purchased on Ebay. As part of our package, we had to attend a high pressure and very long (3 hours) sales pitch for the timeshare. (Research before you go, many disappointed owners both online and at the resort). Overall the resort is a fine place to stay (although most surrounding resorts are nicer) with a nice pool area and pleasant rooms. Unfortunately, our room had not yet been refurbished; the newer rooms are significantly nicer. There are other nicer condos in the area at the same or lower price, but the Fountains was fine and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: arnie_the_armadillo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week visit to Orlando staying at The Fountains Resort. The place is fantastic, the apartments are large, clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and the service is wonderful. We never came across any of the negatives or problems that some people have reported on here. This was our 4th time in Orlando and this is the best place we have stayed in (it just beats the Bahama Bay we stayed in last time due to its location) We stayed in building 6 on the 5th floor overlooking the Wakoola pool area and centre lake. Our 2 bedroomed villa was huge with everything you could ever need (yes including a Jacuzzi!). The beds were extremely comfortable and the furnishings were of a high standard, it was a great place to relax in after days out at theme parks or shopping, The room was quiet and we never suffered with noise from other guests. The aircon worked very well and wasn't noisy like others have said. During our stay we received a room clean after the first week that was unexpected. Security on site is excellent - vehicles have to pass a manned gatehouse to get in and out. The grounds are spotlessly clean. The pools were great and never seemed busy - the Wakoola area is the newest one and is massive with 2 slides and a kids water play area and there is plenty of room to swim. It is true that you are required to wear a wristband - this is so that non residents don't come in - but you are only required to wear it while in the pool area and you can get a new one each time you visit. Pool towels are also provided. They don't allow you to take your own food and drinks to the pool area, which I think is fair enough - they are a business after all - and the food and drink (and service) at the grill is good, if you're that bothered you can always pop back to your apartment! There is a daily activities programme within the resort each day, although we never used it. We were never pressurised into taking a timeshare tour like others have said, although the standards within the resort made it pretty tempting to take a look! The location of The Fountains Resort is excellent - nothing is too far away, Disney is about 20 mins, Universal about 20 mins, Seaworld 10 mins. There is a Publix and Walgreens 5 mins away and a Benihana 2 minuites walkaway (which is fantastic). All in all The Fountains is fantastic and I would recommend it to anyone - it is a place I would be more than happy to stay at on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: mominparis
Reviews.Content: We visit Orlando every summer with our three children (12, 9, 6) and this year the Fountains was the nicest place to date. The rooms were clean, with all the comforts of home, and the grounds were immaculate. I watched two people, scrub the grill every morning outside on the patio. We were really impressed. My kids raced, hollered, and laughed with joy all the way down the water slides. The pools were our favourite! Only negative comment is the slow service at the grill near the pool. One day, we waited for over an hour for our food. When it arrived, our server disappeared, never to be seen again. We had to get up to get refills, napkins, and finally served ourselves from the ice cream freezer. All drinks and food come with a 15% gratuity automatically added to your bill, so beware. One day, we had an insect check of our room. They said it was rountine. Keep all your valuables in the safe. we had a great time and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place for you if you are traveling with children/teens!!”
Reviews.Author: ICULOOKIN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fountains for 5/4 nights with our children ages 10, 8 and 6. This resort was great and had lots of activites for the kids. The pools were wonderful and catered to all ages. There were 2 waterslides and a kids Water Lagoon. The best part however was the HUGE indoor pool that was in the clubhouse. This resort is the ONLY resort in Orlando with an indoor pool. There were many lounge chairs and severel tables with umbrellas that were available everyday all day. The staff was very friendly and the property was very well maintained and secured. The rooms were nice and spacious. The beds were just OK, but everything else about the resort made up for it. There were activities going on around the clock for all age groups which was great because we never had to leave the resort! We've stayed at the Sheraton Vistan Villages, The Grand Hilton, Westgate Villas, Westgate Town Center, Mystic Dunes and many others and this one by far offered the best resort activities and THE BEST POOLS! One small tip....Building 10 is their newest building so request a room in that building if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: rickdawn
Reviews.Content: The fountains are outstanding period. From the grounds to the pools, customer service, and atmosphere this placed had it all. Not one problem with our room which overlooked Lake Eve. We stayed in a 2 bedroom deluxe it was huge and although the faux marble surrounding the entertainment center lacked the updated looked, but who goes on vacation to critique what decor a room has. We didn't mind at all the mid 90's dated look because the condo itself was awesome. 2 screened balconies, nice sized kitchen, 6 person table, gigantic master bedroom and bath. The other bedroom had a queen bed a sleeper sofa and its own private bath. LR was very adequate size to house 4 adults and 2 kids comfortably. We were quite nervous about staying her afte several reviews but don't let a couple of bad experiences ruin your vacation. WE WILL book again and again and I most definetly recommend this resort with no hesitations. Lets put it this way after staying here a week my brother and his wife bought into Bluegreen themselves. Great Place one of Bluegreens best. If you are an owner be proud of this Resort

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: kwhite139
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week's vacation at the fountains which was the 20th -26th of July 09. Our visit at the fountains was very nice. Check in went very smooth. We stayed in building 8 which was one of the newer buildings. Our room was very clean and very spacious. We were not bothered by people trying to interest us in a timeshare. Everyday we had a message on our phone telling us about the events of the day. The pools were great, the staff was very nice. Being that I am not a swimmer my favorite part of the fountains was the screened in balcony which had a great view and was very relaxing. There are ceiling fans throughout the unit including on the balcony which made it extra nice. No problems with our televisions or cd players. We had plenty of Towels. We had no security arm bands, there were plenty of towels at the pool. There is a sign on the pool gate that says no outside food or drinks and there is no lifeguard on duty. It rained a little bit when we there but not enough for them to close the pool. The other guest at the fountain were really nice. We just really had a great time and will definitely be visiting again. Maybe things are different where the older units are located but where we were staying everything was nice in and around our building. We didn't get a chance to ride the trolley being that we drove down. The fountains is located around everything. We found a super walmart not to far away, downtown disney is almost around the corner, sea world and aquatica is right up the street, walgreens is right down the street, publix is around the corner, plenty of restaurants on I-drive. I would recommend this hotel. My party consisted of my my daughter (20 yrs old), my grandson (3 yrs old), my son (22 yrs old) and my husband and I. There was something for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Couples or Families”
Reviews.Author: FLgalJodi
Reviews.Content: We stayed using owner Bonus Time. We booked just 2 weeks in advance. Easy booking, quick check-in and express checkout. It was my husband, myself, and 3 sons (17, 5 & 10 months). There was enough for everyone. My 5 year old LOVED the 2 slides. Our 17 year old loved playing tether ball, basketball in pool, ping pong and playing with giant poolside chess set. Our 2 bedroom villa was very nice and made vacationing with our kids less stressful. ;-D The staff was extremely nice. I enjoyed having the choice of the two pools depending on what type of entertainment I was wanting. One day I wanted lively entertainment to "bop in water to" while later I wanted tranquility in the indoor/ outdoor pool. This is a great place, close to all Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “pool Gestapo ruined vacation-no food or drinks at pool.”
Reviews.Author: Bellestravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fountain for 2 nights in July with family. We had requested an early check-in weeks in advance. Not granted. We sat by the pool and waited for them to call for 2 hours and was able to check in a 3:30. I am quite sure the condo was emptyâ€¦There is also a fee for a late check out which would be after 10:00 am which is quite early. In the condo, there was a picture missing from the wall with large holes. We had to call the front desk to report this so we wouldnâ€™t be charged. This was the only problem with the unit other than the front bedroom being loud with hallway noise. There was also no shampoo/bathroom toiletries so bring your own. There is no A/C in the elevators which is uncomfortable in the summer. The worst part of the trip and the reason we would never stay here again is the pool situation. It rained for a few minutes-typical FL weather and when the rain stopped we went down to the pool. Upon entering and sitting down, a security guard rushed over and proceeded to yell at us about the pool being closed. There we no signs posted and the gate was not locked, so how were we supposed to know the pool was closed?? He was SO rude. This is out vacation for God sakes and we paid to stay there. I was so insulted by his attitude. So, we sat near the bar area until it opened back up which was never announced. We just noticed other people in the pool. On a following day, we had a small lunch cooler with us for drinks and snacks and were told we were not allowed any outside food or beverages due to â€œhealth code violationsâ€�. I asked which codes they were referring to, as I have never been asked to leave a pool before because of chips and sodas. Of course the waiter was super rude and argued with me about this. So, we had to pack everything up and go back upstairs. This pool situation was completely unacceptable. When on vacation, you want to enjoy the pool area and not be hassled when trying to relax and enjoy yourself. I can understand a no glass policy but no coolers at all??? The location of the resort is relatively close to Sea World- about 10 min drive. It was also close to other shopping and restaurants which was convenient. So, I would not recommend the Fountains if you are looking to spend time at the pool and have fun. Also donâ€™t expect any accommodations for early check in or late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru9999
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in July 2009. I am a writer for a travel magazine so I will keep this short as I will be writing a full review next month. First The Positives: Easy check-in and an excellent location to Sea World. The Negatives: Beds uncomfortable. Unit was missing pictures on the walls. There were holes in the drywall. The mattress on the sleeper couch was about 2 inches thick and the springs went right through to your back. The master tub was dirty. The pool bathroom smelled of urine and its floors were sticky from who knows what. I was traveling with two children and my wife and after a day at the theme parks we stopped and got Subway and took it back to the hotel. The kids wanted to eat by the pool and we were actually KICKED out of the pool by the rudest security guard I have ever encountered! He said the kids were not allowed with Subway at the pool. I have traveled over 15 years as a travel critic and have stayed at hotels ranging from $500 night to $50, and have never been told a sandwich is not allowed at the pool. This is not a family friendly resort. If you have children stay someplace else. I write for a major travel magazine and will be publishing my full review in next monthâ€™s issue. Stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: “A Place To Relax”
Reviews.Author: Vangie3000
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay a week by myself just to try the place out..and basically every single day I would go out, eat at their Food & Beverage locations, by the way you should try out the Ocean Taco, enjoy the pools. And the just implemented a wristband policy just for Safety Purposes, which I thoght was great. Anyways, I would really recommend this to everyone for a relaxing and enjoyable stay in orlando. Plus is very close to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Barrie_Bunny
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautifully maintained and furnished. Thanks to a tip on here, I asked for a new unit upon check in and we ended up in Building 8, right by the huge outdoor pool. The units are clean and well stocked. I stayed there for almost 2 weeks with 2 teenagers. The food at the restaurant by the pool was very tasty. The pool itself is never that busy. You can always get a deck chair. The resort is only about a 10 minute drive to Disney and about a 3 minute drive to an excellent Prime Outlet Mall. One complaint was that the water in the unit had a bad odour and taste to it, but we soon found out that most of Orlando's drinking water is that way. The other complaint is that the lightbulbs at the vanity area and in the bathrooms are too low wattage. You cannot see your face to do your hair and makeup or shave. They seem about a 3 watt bulb, similar to a Noma Moonray in your garden. It is like you are in a dark bar. But overall, I would strongly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: myk_1217
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommendable but the problem I encountered was "BED BUGS" are on the masterbedroom and they made a feast out of me, I made a write-up and the hotel staff assists me and they give me a spray away for bed bugs. If you encounter this problem just report it right away and they move you to another room. Also, no Flat screen TV yet and the AC is noisy!

Reviews.Title: “wow! ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: sunnjass
Reviews.Content: it was a family trip and more for disney parks and this place is amazing to stay with young, teen's or older's. it was spotless. they have 10 buildings and all of them built after 2003. we stayed in building#8 (condo with 2bdr & 2 bathrooms, jacuzzi & kingsize bed m. bdr and 2 double beds in 2nd room and sofa bed. plenty of room) that is 2yrs old and . everything is modern. but internet is too expensive. $10 for 24hrs. or weekly is $30 or $40 not sure. they have free shuttle service to Disney Epcot and then disney provide a shuttle service to all parks( magic kingdom, animal kingdom, disney hollywood). seaworld & Aquatica is 2-3 miles from hotel, about $10 by taxi but i found seaworld is waste of money if its too hot then Aquatica is worth it. grocery store is about half a mile. i definatly stay there again and i recommend to everyone else too. no time sharing or anything like that. if you don't want room service you save that too and there is no extra hotel fee etc.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and kid friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: glholliday
Reviews.Content: this was absolutely the best hotel/resort i have ever stayed in. we had a 2 bedroom suite, and their were me, my husband, 5 kids. ages 13-5mo old. this was plenty big for all of us. very clean and everything we needed was well stocked (detergent, cooking supplies). those kinds of things. my kids also loved the pools. their favorite was the indoor/outdoor pool. i didnt know when we stayed their that we were so close to so many neet places to visit. practically walking distance to seaworld. at first, they had a room on the 5th floor reserved for us. i explained about all the kids and twin 5 mo olds and they quickly got us a first floor room and it was close to the pools too. would deffinately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is an excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTraveler69
Reviews.Content: The Fountains resort is hyped up a lot, and it did fall a bit short of all the hype. But it is a great place to stay. First the bad; elevators have no fans and are way to hot; energy effient light bulbs or something make it take 3 minutes before you can see if entering in dark - I suggest leave a light on when you are out, so you can see when you come back; the beds were kind of hard, but not too terrible. Now the good; great pool; great staff, very helpful and friendly; great food at the on site bar/restaurant, H2O; you must go to Mug-o-Joes gift shop, we thought this was just snacks, drinks, sunscreen and other stuff you may have forgotten, but it is much more, there is a woman who makes homemade food that you can pick up to go (which we did b/c it was late and good in a pinch), we had here homemada lasagna - awesome! awesome food! for $10 we got a big piece of lasagna, a ceasar salad and a carrot cake for dessert and it fed 2 people, a must go; again the staff was friendly, accomodating and remembered their guests and likes and needs; the 2 bedroom is very roomy, the master bed had a jacuzzi in it, the whole place was spacious enough for the four of us; they do have quiet hours, so it is pretty quiet at night, every so often you will some rukus, but it quieted pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Resort”
Reviews.Author: mrsmom08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Fountains Resort for 4 days and 3 nights. I purchased the package off eBay, and it was a steal. The resort was wonderful! It was very clean and there are many activities to participate in. The front desk was friendly upon check-in. Since it rained while we were there, we did not get a chance to thoroughly enjoy the pool, but the kids really enjoyed the jacuzzi tub. I can't comment on the kitchen utensils because I don't cook on vacation, but it was well-stocked with lots of glasses, plates, cookware, etc. The washer and dryer came in handy as I used them for our swimming suits after returning from Cocoa Beach. **One thing to note is that there is a charge for high speed internet, and they do not have a wireless connection. The charge is $9.95 for 24 hours. I would recommend this resort to EVERYONE, especially families with young children and teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed, after all of the good reviews.”
Reviews.Author: peace_all
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in I was looking forward to getting to our unit, especially after a long day of travel, and delay's. I am requested for security sake to wear a wristband the whole time I am there, as well as the rest of my family. Knowing this is not an all-inclusive resort, I was taken aback. We were told that we had to put them on, and go to the front desk to have them cut off if we were going out and wanted them off to obtain a replacement. Nedless to say, we only wore them when we were out of the unit, on the property, loose enough to slip them off. We found our unit, and eventually parking (which is supposed to be limited to a space a unit). Expecting it to be a lot nicer then what we came to, according to past reviews. The decor was modern, and it was adequate, but the master bed was horrid, hard and sagging. The other beds were better, but still quite hard, and that room had a window that led onto the outdoor hallway. There is just enough cabinet space for kitchen equipment, but none for sundries that you might bring. Bewarned the fry-pan is not non-stick, I was taken a-back by this, as why would I buy non-stick spray when I am only visiting somewhere for a week? We are people who prepare a lot of our own meals due to food preferences. The main pool is very nice, but you have to rent the cabana's, and it is a bit of a walk depending on where your unit is. The pools by the clubhouse are ok, but it is either a splashpool for the kids, or a pool that is just a bit too deep for children who are not too confident in their swimming skills. It is too bad there wasn't a happy medium. They seemed to have adequate activities for the kids according to the resort activitiy messages left daily on our voicemail, as well as the rest of the family, but we didn't go and check them out as we enjoyed time out of the unit (as we found it small and dark). An easy improvement they could make, is making sure that each unit has an amenities binder, etc. Ours didn't, therefore we missed the towel exchange day and didn't have necessary information that would of been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: ARoseBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Fountains Resort the first week in June for the first time with my husband and 6 yr old. The Resort is very well maintained, clean, very friendly and accomodating staff, 2 beautiful pool areas with slides and sprinklers and activities for the children. We stayed in Building 6 which was perfect. I liked the outdoor pool that was half covered so that when we got too much sun, we just moved our things indoors. The pool towels were big and we always got one. It wasn't a big deal to hand your pool card in for a towel each day, in fact, some days we forgot our card and got towels anyway. We had a 2 bed/2 bath which had a ton of room, very comfortable and clean and attractive looking. Really liked the screened in deck so no bug issues there. The food and drinks on the resort was very good. Very close to theme parks which we went to for 4 of the 7 days we were there. The other 3 days we relaxed by the pools. There was music by both pools playing most of the time, so while we were in Building 6 and didn't hear any of the music, I'm not sure if it would be a nuisance if your room was close to the pools. But, while at the pools, the music was nice, mostly pop music. The only negative remarks I have is the bathroom by the indoor/outdoor pool area could be kept cleaner. Quite often it smelled of urine and the floor seemed dirty. I did tell one of the staff members and he quickly went to clean/mop the floors, but the next day again it smelled. There was another bathroom closeby inside, so I just used that one. The other disappointing factor was at the coffee/breakfast bar - their iced coffee machine which makes various iced coffee/cappuccino drinks was broken the entire time we were there. Was told it broke the week prior and the person working there, while very nice, said he wasn't sure if it was going to be fixed or if they were waiting on a new one. So, the only iced option was to pour ice over hot coffee. So, that was too bad considering we had 90 degree weather all week and a refreshing iced coffee would have been nice. They do have 2 computers for internet use - and the web was so very slow - a bit annoying to try and use -but we only used it for personal reasons, so it wasn't a big deal. Would I stay there again - absolutely! No doubt in my mind about choosing that resort, it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to relax for families”
Reviews.Author: Bluegreencw
Reviews.Content: This resort was outstanding!!! I loved the balcony that is screened in, everyday it was cool not hot on this balcony. Great pools, basketball court, grills, drinks, and location. Easy access to Universal Studios, Sea World. Grocery stores just down the street along with the mall, movies, and great food. The lake had peedle boats that were great but I had teenagers that didn't like the color of the water. The Fountains customer service is very good. They had an event for the kids daily and the adults. The Fountains also provided a free picture for the family and options to purchase more. Workout room could be bigger but not to many people use it so there is no need. Game room for the kids is also great. The whirlpools around the pools are very relaxing. This resort was so great I had to pull my teenagers away from the pools everyday at 9:30 pm. Went to CoCo beach and it was also great. Only about 30 minutes away. I am a bluegreen owner and this resort makes me feel good when I pay for monthly fees. I will always go to the Fountains. If you go to Orlando, choose The Fountains they are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT"S BUGGING ME.”
Reviews.Author: rogerchicago
Reviews.Content: My family and I ,stayed at the Fountains (4 a week in April). The problem came a couple of days after arrival. Bugs started showing up in kitchen area. The front office was notified and sent some-one to spray the area. 2-days later the BUGS where back,again the office was let none of problem.Could also have fitted sheets on beds. Other than those 2 problems,every-thing else was great. BRING YOUR BUG SPRAY.PS....NO FREE INTERNET SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, but your charging me for what???”
Reviews.Author: n3omoto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Presidential suite and the room was amazing. 3BR 3BA, 6 flat screen TV's, awesome walk-in shower, whirlpool tub, and pool table. A man's room right? Well everything was perfect until I opened my laptop. They will charge you $9.95 a day for internet, or $30.00 for 6 days. They charge you for every little thing you think should be free. I told them that I get free internet from Motel 6, so why not them? They were speechless! Great place, but be prepared to pay for little things.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel! If you are visiting Orlando you must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LDCannon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. I am a Bluegreen Owner and I was very nervous about staying here after I read all the negative reviews. It was a family vacation so it was about 20 of us in all and the hotel was GREAT! We stayed in the new building and there is nothing negative I can say about it. There were so many activities there that we didn't want to leave to visit the Disney Parks. Check in was good considering it was a holiday weekend but the staff was very pleasant the entire time. The pool was great as well and the water silde was a hit for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: dgirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains from Mar. 24-31. Loved our room. Stayed on the top floor, end unit which was great. (less noise). They first had us in a diff. room but after I requested a top floor, they granted it w/o any problems. We loved the pool and the kids (ages 7 & 4) loved the diff. activites. (painting, bingo, etc..). Only have 2 "complaints/problems": First, we got in around supper time and really just wanted to grab a bite to eat but one area was closed at 5:00 and the other area we went to, the food took over a half hour to get(burgers and hot dogs) and when we finally got it, the order was all wrong. The other "con" was we got locked out of our room. After I drove to the front desk, they gave us another key and then had no problems after that. Over all the resort was wonderful. Like I said we loved the pools, the room, location was great to disney, shopping, grocery store, outlet mall. (also we loved that the reosrt was located on the quiter end of International drive.) We would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “the fountains resort”
Reviews.Author: karen45Ct
Reviews.Content: date 04/20/09 we just returned today from a week stay at the fountains. I had planned the trip for about a year. After searching the internet I finally decided on the fountains from reviews and pics. We were not disappointed. Where else can you get a whole condo for the price of a hotel room. I was a little concerned since its a timeshare property but after we checked in they sent us to another desk for our parking ticket where the lady asked if we would be interested I said no and never was bothered the whole time. Take advantage of the grocery store down the road less than 5min by car. You can save a bundle on meals if you eat most of them in your condo. They also have some grills around the property which we did not take advantage of. We did take advantage of the free shuttle to disney there are different times. We chose the 8am and 8:30pm to come back. It worked out great since my husband chose not to do disney again and was able to take the car to play golf. I would love to go back again and maybe even plan a family vacation where we get a group of us and rent a few condo's for the week. Just in closing I would say since we went on a busy spring break time you are not going to get checked in early. They guarantee the room to be ready at 4pm. We had drove 20hrs from ct and arrived at 1:30 was told room was not ready and we could hang by the pool at 3:15 checked back still not ready this time the girl checked and moved us into a different room that was ready so we did not have to keep waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but activities and pools close too early and there's no indoor pool open during bad weather.”
Reviews.Author: maxndusty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2bdrm unit for Spring Break. Great location, room was very clean, nice and comfortable. Only complaint would be that the indoor/outdoor pool was closed due to bad weather one day. We were told it was "closed for the rest of the day" however at some point it did re-open and we were not told. When we asked about it we were only told "I'm just doing my job".tThe pools also close early. the big outside pool closed at 9pm and the indoor/outdoor pool closed at 10. Thats early for kids (9 & 13) on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: live2go
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at The Fountains in March 2009. The resort is just awesome. Big enough to offer lots to do, yet it is all within walking distance. We had two couples and three children and the accomodations were large enough that we weren't on top of each other. The children loved the pool area with the slides and we quite enjoyed the quieter pool over by the clubhouse. There was a campfire/sing along/smores evening that the whole family enjoyed. The space shuttle lifted off while we were at the campfire and it was amazing. The kids enjoyed feeding the ducks and the fish. Outlet shopping nearby. Very close to Disney. Easy area to get around by car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotels, expensive "extras"”
Reviews.Author: ctbtucker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely gorgeous. The room was great, and had just about everything we needed (some items were missing from the kitchen but when we called the things we needed were brought to our room). We were in Orlando for Disney/Universal/Sea World. There were a few things we were surprised to find out. Such as Internet is $10.00 a day -NOT free at the pool (I asked the bartender) and only free in the lobby (not convenient with kids). There is no daily maid service so you have to take out your own trash, but they did bring extra towels very shortly after calling. They provide free transportation to Epcot and then you can shuttle to the other parks but they only drop you off 2 or 3 times in the morning and then pick up in the evening (we had a child that napped mid-day so it didn't work for us) They also provide transportation to Universal for $24 (not worth it for us) Also with ten buildings you would think they would have more than 2 bikes/treadmills in the fitness room. Next time we will choose a less expensive hotel with more free amenities as we didn't spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Do Disney (Universal, Sea World)”
Reviews.Author: VacationLAW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and are never disappointed. Internet is free in the lobby and at the pool (which comes in handy when checking in for flights and checking attraction times). The staff is OK - not overly friendly but not rude either. It's fine for the 5 minutes you spend with them. Timeshare presentations are always offered but never pushed (although we have been doing this a while so we unplug the phones as soon as we get in our rooms - everywhere we go). The villas are large - two bedrooms, a King size bed in the master, two doubles in the second bedroom, and a sleeper sofa (we have never used). Two bathrooms and a hot tub (in the master bedroom). The kitchen is large and well stocked. Apartment sized washer/dryer are great. Each bedroom has a TV as well as the Living Room. Units are bigger than a lot of Apartments. The villas are cleaned well and well stocked. All of our sheets/towels were brand new. My husband loved the bed - I hated it - which means it was a good bed (not nearly soft enough for me). It was unexpectedly cold when we were there so we only used the indoor pool - it is nice. There is a newly opened outdoor pool and slide area. We walked around it - it looked really nice (maybe next time). There is a cafe and a bar, as well as a pool bar. We have never used them but they always have people at them. There is a nice pool table as well as some other games tables. There are scattered outdoor play areas for the smaller kids. Conveniently located to the villas. The location is great. Quiet and relaxed yet close to all the major parks, restaurants, and major highways. There is a grocery store 1/2 mile away as well as Walgreens/Fast Food. There is also a really nice looking outlet mall down the street (I have never gone but it's always packed). Mostly all chain restaurants are within a few miles as well as local restaurants. We have never had problems with this resort and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing yet filled with things to do”
Reviews.Author: WgqMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a couple of different properties during our visit to Orlando and this one was the best. The rooms were very spacious, and clean. The best amenities were the pools. Eventhough it looked like there were a lot of people staying on property, it was never crowded anywhere you went. Since the pools are huge, everyone is pretty much spread out. The activities for the kids at the pool were fun and they enjoyed being awarded prizes etc. Our kids received personal attention when they participated in activities etc. Most of the activities staff is from all over the world and come as interns. Our kids liked hearing their personal stories and what their countries were like. We enjoyed the "High School Musical dance party". The arcade on propery isn't that big and the fitness center isn't either. The location is good with Seaworld just a few minutes away (driving), the premium outlet malls, grocery store, benihana's (coming soon) right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Lissydiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort/hotel from March 8th to March 13th. Don't really have any big complaints. I would say that the check in process was quite long, but being that it is a "Time Share" place they are always looking to sell you more things. The room was very clean and had everything you could need. The DVD player was sort of pain but, took forever to figure out what channel the tv needed to be on in order for it to work. Called the front desk several times and was put on hold for long periods of time. This is something that could have been put in a book in the room for easy look up. If it was we didn't find it. The pool areas were fantastic. No complaints there at all. I will have to say that there should be free wi-fi in the rooms. There is a charge of around $9 a day and it's not wireless. There was wi-fi down by the pool at the clubhouse, which was no charge. Other than those few things this place was great. Would definitely stay again. The grounds were lovely. Our 3 year old daughter and 3 year old neice had an awesome time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!! Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Catlanta
Reviews.Content: The Fountains Resort was one of the most beautiful places I have stayed. From the time I checked in til the time I checked out the service was fantastic. The room are very relaxing and decorated beautifuly. And the pool area is like being on a Tropical Island. I will be a regular guess when I am in Orlando... Hi Five to all the staff !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss The Fountains On Your Next Trip To Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl60
Reviews.Content: I met 7 dear friends for a birthday celebration at The Fountains Resort this March and we had a once-in-a-lifetime experience! We stayed in the new building right by the pool and LOVED it. The accommodations were top-notch, beautifully decorated and close to all the attractions. The pool was huge and had all kinds of fun activities and island music going on throughout the day. And the resort staff were always with a smile and eager to help us with anything we needed! We are already planning next year's reunion. We might even let our husbands join in the fun!

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: seeya407
Reviews.Content: My family and I had short but sweet stay at The Fountains Resort and we were in there newest building, # 10, and it's beautiful, inside and out. There pool was great, water was heated and very clean. They also have an additional pool at the clubhouse with activities. The landscaping was very nice, and there's bars, grills and a small pier with paddle boats. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I was in one of the regular rooms, they also have Presidential Suites, if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort for a Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lance21
Reviews.Content: The room was Tastefully Decorated and spacious with many upgraded appliances and features such as quality radios with the Ipod connection in each room. The shower is very spacious and the jacuzzi tub work perfectly. The gorgeous pool area provided everything to enjoy a much relaxed afternoon. Activities were provided for our children as well as a DJ at the pool area until 9pm. Service was great from the Front Desk staff to the Staff at Wakoola Springs. (Pool Bar and Grill). The resort is centrally located to many restaurants and a Mall. Disney was only 5 mintues away.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains is Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: Terrijordan24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fountains March 11-14 on my sisters bonus time (she owns timeshare points with Bluegreen). Our family had 4 rooms at this resort. 2 families were in bldg. 7 and 2 in bldg. 8 which are new bldgs and right next to each other. First I would like to say checking in was easy but getting there with the way their road system is can be confusing - they need to better mark their roads. The Fountains has added a few new building in the last 2-3 years and in doing that the whole layout is different then it was before. check in is now before the guard gate in a building on the left - I didn't really look to see what else was there but it looked nice. I checked in about 5:00pm and there were 2 people working and one was assisting a customer the other assisted me. All was good and I asked him about the internet right off because my son is 18 and he likes to be connected as I do (we both brought our laptops) I was informed that internet was 9.00+ for a day and the longer you have it the cheaper the daily rate gets - I wanted 3 days which would have been about $21.00. we checked into our room and it was very nice - 2BR 2Bath - plenty of room for us - I think all the rooms are basically the same everything was clean the grounds were nice - I had a fountain view the pool was a short walk away and was nice and not crowded. It was the pool with the double slide which my nephews loved. they also had a smaller water area for toddlers. They sell food at the pool area but I didn't buy any so I can't tell you anything about that. We stopped at the market (lots of stores near the Fountains!) and got provisions before checking in. I have no complaints about anything in this resort EXCEPT the internet - it did not work the entire time I was there - which is only part of the issue - front desk people outright lied about it and that really bothers me. Having others in the hotel that were there at the beginning of the week who could not get on at that time either didn't help with the lying. I was told it must be an issue in my room (it was not) I spoke on the phone with Logicnet (something like that) and they told me that they could not connect with the hotel and it was a hotel issue and that they were having other complaints about it and thought it was being taken care of. I called the front desk and they said that wasn't true that it was the providers issue. well I don't care can someone address it and have it taken care of??? next day I call again - provider says it hasn't heard from resort - resort says it will be fixed in the next hour or so - 8 hours later still not fixed - now I am trying to speak with someone from management regarding the whole thing - front desk said it is just my building which again was not true because bldg 8 could not connect either. Management never called me regarding the issue and I basically gave up. I own 2 timeshares I have never had issues where they wouldn't call back. These are NEW buildings they should have wireless access which they do not - and I don't know how long it has been down but a week is a 6 days to long. Some may wonder why this is a big deal - this trip was not just a vacation and I needed to be connected and was informed by the resort that I would be connected and listed myself as reachable through e-mail and I was not. Also if your in Orlando there are bargains galore if you look them up you can also find places to eat and discounts online. It was very disappointing to myself and my son we both brought laptops from NY on the plane and carried them to this resort for nothing. If internet was not available they should say so.

Reviews.Title: “The little things (or lack of) make a difference”
Reviews.Author: maccgizzle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned yesterday, March 14th - 2009, from a week long stay at the Fountains in Orlando, and I wanted to compose my personal review while still fresh in my mind. We stayed in building 6 for what it's worth. Why did we choose the Fountains? A marketing package, originally targeted for my father in law, was transferred to us as a gift. Although, we did have to meet some qualifications and cover some initial costs of approximately $500, but the package came with a free rental car (except for the taxes) and tickets to Universal Studios or Islands of Adventure - contingent upon attending a timeshare presentation that was described as only requiring 90 minutes of our time. It actually lasted about 4 hours. What were our motives for a vacation? We have been married for 4+ years and do not yet have children. However, I am 36 and my wife nearly 30, so we are beyond wanting to go clubbing and bar hopping, but without having our own children yet, we are not ready to hole up in a theme park for a week either. We prefer a balance of "some" nightlife activities and/or fine dining and "some" family oriented things as well, with a sprinkle of sandy beaches and cool ocean waves thrown in there too. It was our first vacation together since our honeymoon in the Mayan Peninsula where we had an unforgettable all-inclusive (all alcohol and food included) vacation. What were our expectations for Florida? Having not been there since I was a child, I didn't know what to expect. It was spring break for most of the country, so I was afraid to run into 21-yr olds at every corner getting plastered, so we avoided places like Daytona Beach and Fort Lauderdale, instead visiting Cocoa Beach and Satellite Beach (slightly south of Cocoa Beach), which was a nice blend of young and older people and not too crowded, although no boardwalk or beach front restaurants/bars - come prepared with your own. What were your expectations for the Fountains? Described as a world class resort, I expected to be treated like kings and queens, especially considering they were trying to sell us on buying a timeshare with Bluegreen, the company that owns the Fountains as I understand it. What were your first impressions with the Fountains? We had a late flight and didn't arrive to the front desk until 1:30 AM at which point we were informed that our mandatory timeshare presentation was at 10:30 AM the same morning, which if you missed it, you would void the promotional deal and be responsible for the full cost of your stay. Throw in the fact that it was also the night we were going to push the clocks ahead an hour. So we weren't thrilled with having to be at a presentation 8 hours after pulling up to the front desk. We had just enough time to unpack and sleep for 6 hours after spending all day traveling, not a great way to begin a "vacation." Neither the man at the front desk nor the security guard seemed overly friendly either, which I can now say was a foreshadow of the rest of our stay. What were your impressions of the sales pitch by Bluegreen? It was the 2nd timeshare presentation we've attended in our lifetimes, so we knew to expect the worst. It started off with an entertaining host, but digressed from that point on during the near 4-hour ordeal which had been advertised as a 90 minute presentation. To sum it up, it was way out of our budget, and I am not the type of person who does impulse shopping. They wanted an answer that day before we walked out of the presentation or the offer was no longer valid. Eventually when our saleswoman couldn't get us to sign on the dotted line, she brought over her boss who completely turned us off from the idea of purchasing a timeshare with them. So after 3 hours and 50 minutes, we were finally free to go and they accepted our answer as a "no." What were your impressions with your room? I was very impressed at first. I mean I never stayed in a condo on vacation. It had everything you thought you might need - full kitchen w/dishwasher, washer & dryer, dining room, living room, screened in patio, 3 televisions with a DVD player and mini stereo in living room, pull out sofa, love seat, master bedroom with jet tub and private bath, second bedroom with two queen beds and separate bath. It was easily the biggest dwelling I've rented on vacation. It seemed clean to me unlike other reports I've read on here. Our balcony overlooked a man made pond or lake that had two lit up fountains for eye candy. How was the Internet access? For starters, I quickly learned that bringing my windows vista laptop was a moot point unless I wanted to spend a large majority of my free time hanging out at the clubhouse to pick up their wireless signal. My first evening there I called the front desk to inquire about how to connect to their wireless service (as my laptop detected three different wireless signals coming from the fountains or bluegreen from my patio). I was then informed that I could only use the wired modem in the living room area (which was only seven feet long - not a lot of flexibility to move around) if I wanted the Internet in our condo. Then she explained that the fees were either 1) $9.95 per day, 2) $20.85 for 3 days or 3) $29.70 for 6 days. I was willing to pay for a week's worth, but after spending an hour on the phone with tech support, I was unable to connect to the Internet using their modem. After contacting the front desk to report this, they wanted to transfer me back to tech support, which I declined. Eventually, I got them to agree to send me a new modem and ethernet cable to see if that was the problem. The guy who came to our door brought a new modem but not a new cable. Unfortunately the new modem didn't fix the problem, and then after telling him I have Windows Vista, he quipped that the Lodgenet modems don't usually work with Vista. What?? How can they not work with the most commonly sold Windows platform that has been on PC's for over two years?? This was a huge turning point in my opinion, because not only do I work in the IT business, I am taking classes in IT, and I use the Internet for so much of my life right now. I did not expect to have to go a week without convenient access to the Internet. I know a vacation is about relaxing, but you'd be surprised at how much I can cover over a bowl of cereal and a coffee while on the Internet, or while having a late evening beer on the patio. Not here though. Only twice did I access their free wireless service because it was so inconvenient to pack it up and walk down to the clubhouse just get online for 30 minutes. Strike 1. How was the fitness room? OK maybe nobody else goes on vacation expecting to maintain their workout schedule. But for me, I've been making good progress for the past 8 weeks working out 3 times a week and didn't want to lose that ritual I've created, so I was happy to see the Fountains offered a fitness room. I've seen other fitness rooms at the Days Inn, which weren't all that bad, so I figured at a "world class resort" such as the Fountains, it would be more than adequate. Surprise! The one they had at the Fountains made the ones at Days Inn seem like they were made for professional athletes. This "fitness room" had two treadmills and one universal machine where you could do a lat pull down, a leg press, and I'm not sure but maybe a bench press using cabled weights.
