There were no free weights at all for anything else, and certainly no elliptical machines if that's what you prefer. It was the size of a big walk in closet and barely ventilated if at all. It was a complete joke and disappointment. Strike 2. How were the pools? You'd think with having pools here, that it would be a great thing where a wife and husband could retreat to after a long day on the go. Unfortunately they were quite shallow for the most part, where most of it was 3 feet deep getting to at most less than 6 feet in the middle. There were 2 slides, but after my wife and I went down them once, we realized how slow and unexciting they were and opted to avoid them, but for five year olds they would be fine. The water though was very warm, I'll give them that. The larger of the two pools closed at 9pm, the other at 10pm. Many times we returned back to the resort between 9-10 pm thinking how nice it would be to unwind with a late dip, only to be reminded that they had already closed or were about to be closed. All in all, these pools seemed to serve the needs of those with small children rather than say those of a romantic couple looking to unwind. Strike 3. How was the service at this world class resort? If you're used to getting daily maid service for free like you do at a cheap motel, don't expect it here. It costs about $25/day if you decide you need or want it. Needless to say, we chose not to purchase any maid services. It was kind of a bummer, because isn't half the fun of vacationing away from home the fact that somebody comes in and makes your bed for you? Seriously though, between there being no complimentary continental breakfasts and having to clean up after yourself everyday, and the fact that the linens on the king size bed weren't fitted, it felt like anything but world class service. Oh and twice we asked the front desk for a wake up call, and both times they were 15 minutes late in giving us the wake up call. When we went to the pool, we took this credit card thing they gave us, which you have to turn in to get a pool towel, and then when you return the towel you get your card back. If you lose this card, you have to pay $10 when you checkout. So when we went to the towel hut inside the pool area, we stood there for at least 5 minutes without anyone around to help, before just taking our own towels. When we went to the clubhouse and checked out the other pool and pool side bar, there was a woman who had been waiting at the bar for help prior to us getting there, and even by the time we walked around and looked at everything, the same woman was still standing there looking around waiting for someone to come by and assist her. And she was the only customer, so it's not like they were busy. World class service....ya OK. How were the two hot tubs, two bridges and two fire circles for campfires in the Wakoola Springs? Didn't test out the hot tubs, only being two with several buildings of vacationers, it didn't seem like enough. Only recall one bridge we crossed to get to the one pool,and below it was a dried up pond/lake so when you looked down you saw nothing but mud and dirt - quite the eye sore. Didn't see anyone using the fire circles, as it's sunny Florida and the last thing on my mind was wanting to sit around a camp fire next to my condo. Maybe if there was on ocean front view with a cool breeze then yes, but that was 50 miles away. All in all, considering we got the place at a discounted rate, it was just OK. Had we paid full price this never would have been acceptable. Upon driving to Cocoa beach a few times, my wife and I would see cheap beach side motels that advertised free wireless internet, and then we'd laugh and I'd say why didn't we just stay at one of these ratty little motels instead, at which my wife would respond "because you don't love me enough." The sad thing is, we probably would have enjoyed our stay more at one of those one room places with the beach outside our back door and working internet service in our room than we did at the Fountains. So glad we didn't opt to purchase a timeshare from Bluegreen, at least based on our experience at the Fountains.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: richa321
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 7 days at the fountains. Got a great price of $129 per night for a 2 bedroom and 2 bath unit. We were in building 6 which was just fine. Good service throughout our stay. 2 pools. They were in the middle of moving the registration to a new building so some of the services were a bit disorganized for a day or 2. The fountains are close to shopping with premium outlets less than 5 minutes away. The large pool is fantastic! Very big with nice bar and plenty of washroom facilities. This is a timeshare facility so don't be surprised if you get a call to attend a presentation. I have a 10 and 12 year old who enjoyed the daily activities provided. Although there is a cost to each activity, is was reasonable and the program staff were very polite. This property is owned by bluegreen. This is a company that has numerous facilities throughout the United States. Overall a great time and I would go back again if the price was right. It said on the door of our room that the daily rate was $399 per night. Yikes, don't pay that much.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Time at the Fountains”
Reviews.Author: GAGirl25
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the fountains, we had another great experience.Great rooms, great pool, tons to do & close to all of the theme parks, we visited disney while we were there with our 2 & 4 year old daughters! The fountains is a great resort with plenty of activites, close to restaurants, the outlet mall, publix, & parks!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: gloria2886
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Fountains. With a special room rate for the 2BR 2BA unit of $99 I was a little fearful. I needn't be. Stepping into the room I was surprised to see a new unit, upgraded kitchen, spacious floorplan, comfy beds with well stocked kitchen. I often book condo units in Florida but this kitchen had everything including liquid soap for dishes which is rarely found in a condo. The grounds were lovely and yes, a quiet, convenient location to everything. I did not eat there but there are plenty restaurants nearby from Denny's to my favorite, Thai Thani. I'll come again!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry but since when has there been an OFF SEASON if FLORIDA???”
Reviews.Author: Catrianna
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week's stay at The Fountains. Let me start with the good. Great location, right by Sea World, Premium Outlets, good restaurants, great upkeep with the rooms and the grounds. Pools are nice, and when the water slides were actually on- they were lots of fun. They provide everything ya need to feel like home and that's nice. Now the bad- over rated and over priced. What really made me mad was that everything was not up and running and available. The bar, restaurant, water slides and activities were sometimes open, sometimes not and that's stupid. Their reasoning was that it's their off season or winter season and excuse me, but I paid darn good money to stay there and my children should be able to enjoy ALL amenities while on vacation. The activities for kids are really unorganized compared to other resorts we have stayed at. But what can you do? One activity that was pretty cool was the Bonfire/Sing a long by the lake, they had a woman guitarist there who was really great, played whatever the kids wanted and they all got to eat as many smores as they wanted. That was fun and FREE! The Fountains is pretty, great scenery, nice rooms, nice staff. I just felt like everything should have been opened, not told kitchen closed at 5pm when we were hungry :(

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any of the little things right”
Reviews.Author: Plentyodough
Reviews.Content: Here's the quick story: The Fountains rooms are huge. If you need sheer size for a few days, this will be what you need. Aside from that, I was honestly disappointed with the experience. Check-in took 25 minutes b/c the untrained staff was unable to do the simplist tasks like check if a room was available or charge my credit card. I was ready to overlook this until I discovered the free internet in my room was dead. No, not b/c my computer had trouble, but a call to Tech Support revealed the Internet was completely down for my entire stay. A real problem when your on business. Did I mention, that I had to make the call from my cellphone since the phone in my room was DEAD? No breakfast was a real bummer too. The only plus was I booked this room through Orbitz and used promo code PRIORITY and it took $50 off the visit. I'm on business every week in Orlando and I'll be trying out other places for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: tillmalo
Reviews.Content: My husband won an RCI timeshare stay through an auction and this was our best choice of availablity. I was a bit worried because of the mixed reviews. We were thrilled with our stay. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo in building 7. Check in was quick and after reading the reviews, I requested to be moved into one of the newer buildings. At first they said there was no availablity but then the nice man at the desk talked to a manager and they moved us. The condo was clean and a short walk to the pool, grills, and playground. The kids loved the new pool area. We had a 9 year old and 4 year old with us and there were plenty of activites for both of them. Large water slide for the older boy and interactive water features for the littlest one. The were plenty of activites going on throughout our stay...Pool DJ, Guitar Hero competiitions, pool games, karokee, animal encounters, storytime, tattoos, poolside massages. There were days that we never even ventured out to disneyworld, as there was plenty to do at the resort. The location was convenient to the parks, area restaurants, walmart, & the local grocery store. I would recommend the resort!

Reviews.Title: “best accomodation in orlando”
Reviews.Author: cmooreIreland
Reviews.Content: just back from a fortnight in the fountains resort i have to say it was brilliant. From the first day they catered for our every need, the cleanliness and upkeep of the resort are beyond compare and the staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. I have no hesitation in recommending this resort and i will definitely be back. Keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Great,Great,Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pokerolls
Reviews.Content: Well,let me start off by saying we got a great price for 2 weeks under $800. When we arrived we were greated by Hind a lovely lady and since we were staying for 2 weeks it was kind of hard for her to keep us in the same room ,so that's when Lee came over to help and he did a great job we requested to be on the buttom floorin a newer room and he took care of it so I took care of him. The room was nice and clean and the kitchen was fully stocked they had everything in most resorts don't have that I was really surprised. The only thing I can say bad about the room is that the TV's should be bigger maybe they should getflat screens,the hot tub was nice the hubby got in it but I didn't the rmaster room had a walk in shower and the other bathroom had a full tub. The pools are out of this world the 1 main one indoor/outdoor pool was very nice all I could say was I can't believe I'm in the pool/hot tub in December. The other pool with the 2 slides needs to be heated the water was so cold because that pool isn't heated I don't understand that at all that pool should be heated so the kids can get in and have fun 2 of my kids wanted to get on the slides so I told them they can get on when the weather was alittle bit more warmer and 1 day it did get to 81 degrees and they were sliding away that is a draw back no heated pool with slides ,but the kids didn't really care because they had the other heated pool. The hotel offers plenty of activites for the kids everyday they had fishing tournaments and my on and my daughter went and won but the fish are very small but, who cares as long as the kids had fun. I can't wait to return to Orlando in August I will probably stay at my favorite place Sheraton Vistana Resort which I have already booked if The Foutains had there rates up I would have booked for them I love to travel for 2 weeks well I can't wait to get back I have pictures I have to upload and then I'll put them on here.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: derines
Reviews.Content: I went to the Fountains for the first time last week. Went for a short,3 day, stay by myself just to get away. THe resort was great the indoor-outdoor pool clean and uncrowded. The water park alot of fun for young and old. I had a pool side massage that was very relaxing and not to expensive. The paddle boats were alot of fun. The big theme parks are only 4-5 miles away and there are alot of very reasonable resteraunts close by. I will be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Reece613
Reviews.Content: I was excited to book into the Oasis at The Fountains for a November stay back in June/July. We travel to Orlando every year and normally stay at Summer Bay Resort. We booked this through our RCI Timeshare. I was hesitant before heading on vacation as the reviews on here were very mixed. I was pleasantly surprised. The 2 bedroom unit at the Oasis Lakes Building # 3, is an older building, but very roomy and clean. I did not find any problems while staying here, although I am not sure I would stay there next time. It was comfortable, clean, great location, loved the kiddie pool and new wakoola pool. However the resort seems to be lacking the attention to detail, these units may need a slight upgrade in furnishings - some pillows on the couch would have been nice. Overall a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday”
Reviews.Author: pammrsj
Reviews.Content: we stayed here twice and loved it both time , clean and well equiped and very friendly staff . i would give this 100% all round . and i would go again tomorrow .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort and Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrummieSmithy
Reviews.Content: 4 of us arrived on the 25th of October for a 7 night stay at the fountains. We chose this resort due to it's location and reviews ie close to all the parks, shopping outlets, international drive etc. The premium outlets are in walking distance and 5 mins in the car. Also in walking distance is wallgreens, publix and the outback restaurant. We stopped in block 7, top floor. The rooms were fine, all clean and tidy. We had a great view from the balcony over the lake. We didnt get chance to use many of the hotel facilities but we did venture around and see whats what. The larger outside pool looked great, with small slides, lots of sunbeds, jacuzzi and nice clean flooring around the pool. We used the free internet access in the lobby which we found very useful but was often busy. The lobby and bar area were all clean and smart. The gardens were very well looked after and looked great. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we have stayed in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Gary32Montreal
Reviews.Content: I have to say this place was fantastic. We stayed in the newer building #8 and found it very clean and sound proof. We went with another couple and their room was next to ours so we did a sound check, we could only hear a faint knock on the wall, but no voices like other reviewers have commented on. The location is perfect to Disney and Seaworld. My favorite part of this resort was the large pool area. Landscaping is beautiful with palm trees and tropical bushes. There is also a fun water slide good for both kids and adults. The water temp. is set at about 85Â°F. They are working on the finishing touches on bldg #10 right in front of the large pool. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone going with their family to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Reese02
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this resort is the location. Perfect location. Close to all the Disney locations, dining, and outlet shopping. Another thing I will say is that the pools are nice. Otherwise, it was an awful experience. It took an hour for us to be checked in. The building they put us in was old. The mattress hard. The bathrooms had low lighting and the shower head was dirty. I was not happy at all with my experience staying at this resort. I will not stay there again. I will try another resort in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Redleg71
Reviews.Content: The Fountains in Orlando The Good: The Hotel/Timeshare is in a fantastic location. It is just a few minutes from Walt Disney and Universal and a very short and easy commute from the Airport. There is also a Walgreens and Publix right around the corner making it easy to pick up provisions for your holiday. The pool area is fantastic. We stayed in Building Two which is located between the check-in/breakfest building and the main pool area. The Pool area is Immaculate and has a very large water slide that is fun for both children and adults. There is also a neat kiddie area in the pool that has some neat fountains and things for the little ones to play on. Best of All there is a full service pool side bar with what seemed very reasonable prices given that it is a resort area. The rooms are clean and their is a big whirlpool/jacuzzi bathtub in the master suite that really is relaxing after a long day of hauling little ones around the theme parks. Each unit has two rooms which makes it nice when traveling with family and children. The Bad: Our unit was somewhat dark and the lighting is terrible. The rooms are very clean but not necessarily inviting. The best example that I can give is that you feel like you are in a clean nice holiday inn. A great place to sleep and eat but your not going to want to hang out in there. In other words nothing bad but nothing special No free internet. This really ticked me off because they charge $10 a day to log on and wifi is not available in the unit so you have to use the network cable which limits where you can sit. There is a Panera bread close by so you can go there for free service if need be. The 10 dollars a day is ridiculous and they should offer this service for free. They also have a few computers in the main building that you can use if you need to. The walls are very thin and we could hear everyone flushing their toilets in the morning. We were on the first floor which may have been part of the problem. Conclusion: We stayed at the Fountains because our family member is a part of Bluegreen and only charged us $450 for the week. For the cost, and location, I was happy overall. We had debated whether to stay on a Disney property and ultimately went with the fountains since the price was right. In hindsight I feel that we made the right decision. The disney resorts are neat but unless you are at one on the monorail system you will need a rental car anyways. Considering that we spent very little time in the room anyways I think the savings was worth it and we were able to spend money on nicer meals and gifts for our children. Bottom Line is that the Fountains is a clean nice resort with adequate amenties at a reasonable cost. Grade: B

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, but....”
Reviews.Author: BobJL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with another couple stayed at The Fountains from October 21st - October 27th. It was a nice place, but a little rough around some of the edges. First the positives: The location is perfect. Located on International Drive South and only 10 minutes from the theme parks. Plenty of dining options and a Publix and Walgreens nearby. Both of the pool areas were beautifully landscaped and maintained. Though we only spent one night at the pool, it was very nice and relaxing. It is a gated resort with 24 hour security. You must display your parking pass on your windshield to gain access. The room was clean and comfortable (the pillows were a bit flat however) with a full kitchen and a fully screened patio. The room came with a safe, free of charge large enough for all our valuables and would easily accomodate a lap top computer. This is a time share resort, so when you go to pick up your parking pass they invite you to attend a 90 minute sales pitch for $150. We simply stated we were not interested, and were never bothered again. Now some of the negatives. We were placed in one of the older buildings, #6. Though the room was clean, the exterior coridors needed a good power washing. The concrete ground was filthy and garbage seemed to accumulate at the trash bins. We saw the same over flowing garbage can bins near the elevators for 2 days. I know it was the same garbage because there were empty beer cases along the side filled with trash. The first room we checked into had some problems. The burners on the electric stove were detached from the stove. This is a real fire hazard. The room also had a damp and musty smell. We asked for a different room and were given one with no questions asked. I read on some previous reviews that the walls were thin. I didn't believe this but it's true. We had no real problems, but our last night I could hear our neighbors loud conversation and laughing throughout the night. It was so loud that I heard their plans for the next day. We requested some extra pillows and pillow cases when we checked in. They said they would send them right up. After an hour, no pillows. I called again, they said they would send them right up. I gave them permission to enter the room to drop them off as we were anixous to get to Downtown Disney. When we returned later that evening, still no pillows. It took 3 phone calls to fill this request. One last small detail, there is not many handicap parking places at each building. I have an issue with my left side, but I am not confined to a wheel chair so it is not an issue for me to walk a little farther. However, if someone needs to unload a wheelchair from a van, this could be a major issue. All in all, this is a nice resort. However I doubt we will ever stay here again. For just a bit more money we could have stayed at Vistana which I feel is far superior to The Fountains. This was still a pretty nice place.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: clemsonjenw
Reviews.Content: We LOVED The Fountains! Everything about it. Our room was very clean, nicely decorated and the kitchen had everything you would need. We ate dinner in the room one night and every breakfast. Publix is just down the street so you can stock up when you get there. My favorite part was the pool area. This resort has 2 pool areas. One at the clubhouse that has an indoor/outdoor pool combo with a kiddie pool and a hot tub. It's right on the lake with plenty of chairs. It also has a pool table and a pool bar. An arcade and playground are there also. (the resort has 3 fenced in playgrounds around the property that were clean and safe and fun for the kids). The other pool area is the "big pool" - this is where I could spend every day. The pool was very clean, BIG and it had 2 water slides that adults can go on, too. Attached is the kids area with fountains, splash buckets and lots of squirting water. Another kids area the water squirts up from the gound and was fun to watch all of the fun they were having. There is a pool bar and grill with decent food and very good pina coladas. There is towel service so no need to bring beach towels. They play fun music to make the atmosphere very nice. There are cabanas you can rent and even get a massage poolside if you want. There are 2 very big hot tubs at the pool area that I commented how clean they were. Our family really had a good time. We will definitley go back again. Everything we encountered was clean and looked new. There is also a nice walkway around the lake for nice strolls or morning walks.

Reviews.Title: “not so great--maybe beacause we were in an older building”
Reviews.Author: bregmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct. 11-18. Check in was a pain and it took about 45 minutes before we were placed correctly. We stayed in building 2 but were previously placed in building 4 (much worse than 2 BTW). They let us switch after we complained about the beds not being right. The room was outdated. The bathrooms were so dark because of the energy saving light bulbs. The pillows were hard and very thick. The freezer took 3 days to freeze the juice boxes that we were taking to the parks in our little cooler. The milk was never cold and I was afraid we were going to get food poisoning all week. We were so busy that I didn't want to call maintenance because I didn't want them in the room while we were gone. Ants were in the kitchen and bathrooms. It was really gross. The positives now: firm mattresses, nice pool area and small water park, close to Disney and Seaworld parks, and Publix just down the street. We only paid about $300 for the week because a friend let us use their timeshare week. For $300 it was bearable, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fountains!”
Reviews.Author: HelloBlue
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with The Fountains. The staff was extremely friendly, the rooms immaculate, and the grounds gorgeous. It's very close to all the parks and we encountered no traffic. My children loved the pools. My only complaint is that we didn't have more time to spend enjoying everything there is to enjoy. A++++ for The Fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains Again”
Reviews.Author: Tankbuster
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit and as last year our stay was fantastic. The Staff were at all times polite, the rooms spotless and the the pools great. Superb location and again a relaxing stay, I didn't hear one complaint, only praise for the Front of House Staff, Cleaners and Pool Staff. Will recommend this Hotel to my friends and would definately come back myself. 10 out 10 - even got an extra day when XL went belly up.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fountains for our honeymoon in September. My parents gave us a week free at any timeshare as our wedding present and we decided to stay here as it was close to the theme parks and only 25 minutes to Orlando International Airport. IT WAS A GREAT CHOICE! We had been traveling since 4:00am by the time we got to the resort after 1:00pm and we were exhausted. Check-in is normally 4:00pm, but we were hoping that our room would be available early. Sure enough, it was! SCORE! Check in was simple. We had a gift certificate so we did not have to pay for the room. The lobby (or "Clubhouse" as they call it) could not have been more adorable. They don't call it "The Fountains" for nothing! There were several fountains all around the clubhouse and the resort so it was really something beautiful to look at. After check-in, we had to pick up our parking pass (complementary) at the concierge desk. She informed us of the weather for the week, asked us if we needed to buy park tickets, than tried to get us to come to a timeshare presentation for $150. We said no, and we were never asked about it again for the rest of our trip. Our room was located in building three (to the immediate right of the clubhouse) on the 6th floor. It was IMMACULATE! We had a 2 bedroom, which we did not need, but for the sake of argument, it was large enough for a family of 6. It was spacious and had a lot of unique amenities I had never seen in a timeshare like a washer and dryer and jacuzzi tub! Excellent! I should also mention that laundry detergent, dish soap, shampoo, conditioner, soap etc were all included in the room. We also had a wonderful view of Lake Eve from our double balcony that has beautiful sunrises in the morning. The Publix grocery store was about a 2 minute drive from the resort as well as the Walgreens and Denny's. The resort is approx. 5 minutes from Sea World, 15 minutes from Walt Disney World and 20 minutes to Universal Studios so it was very convenient for driving to the parks. The Florida Mall was about 20 minutes away and there were outlet malls right across the street from the Publix. Overall, it was in a great location on International Drive close to everything, but not busy. More resort area than downtown. There were 2 pools at the resort. One large wraparound pool with a waterslide for the children. It was really nice because on the weekends, they hire a DJ to spin music so the atmosphere is really fun for everyone! The other pool is a lot quieter right near the lake. It is right beside the 10 person hottub and a spash pool with fountain for children. I should also mention that the lake, Lake Eve, is not a place to swim, but it does have a dock with several pattleboats for rental if you should find time to use them. We never had the time since we were always at the parks, but the pools were great for taking a dip after a long day at the parks. Check-out was simple and there were no surprises at the end. Just a word of caution. The resort charges you $0.50 (fifty cents) for a LOCAL call, so if you have a cell phone, I suggest using it instead. But as a bonus, your room has free internet access. It has a modem built-in to the phone so you can bring a computer, even if it isn't wireless. Overall, The Fountains was a great place for us on our honeymoon. It was (and still is) hurricane season so we really took a chance on going to Florida in September, but we had a fantastic time and pleasantly enjoyed our stay at the resort. I would definitely recommend this resort for not only families, but honeymooners or spring breakers. The staff at The Fountains really make the resort enjoyable for anyone who just wants to have fun on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: lilsparo
Reviews.Content: September 2008 was my stay at The Fountains and I have to say it was fabulous. We had a 2 bedroom unit with a balcony, which was immaculate and very nicely decorated. There was a jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom. The pool areas were huge and beautiful, especially enjoyed the oldies music they played. The Clubhouse was gorgeous with an indoor/outdoor pool area and they had some nice amenities there too. September was a great time to be there, because it was not crowded at all. Sea World was conveniently close by. The staff was especially nice and accommodating. I would have to rate my stay there a #10 and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing timeshare resort”
Reviews.Author: minimini
Reviews.Content: Really, there is nothing bad we can say about this resort. The apartment was spacious, confortable and super clean. The resort ammenities are great and well kept. The swimming pool , Wakoola Springs, is just amazing and huuuuuuge! Never too crownded, with lots of empty bays to chill and relax. The other pool is also great, big and well kept. It was always empty as everybody prefers the new one. Check in went smooth and the timeshare sellers were absolutely not push at all. I said I was not interested in the presentation and they just said okay ( I got a RCI guest certificate and was not obligate to attend any presentation). I would definetly come back to this place again. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews...americans tend to be a lit bit too picky as they are used to very high quality standarts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mlcrn
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort last minute under 'bonus time' as we are BlueGreen owners. We had been in Orlando for one week at a different resort, and had reservations in Key West for a second week. A hurricane caused us to change our plans, and we were left in Orlando for another week waiting for it to pass. We were very pleased to get last minute reservations at this resort, and we found it to be much nicer than the resort we stayed at the first week. The unit was very clean and well maintained. The jacuzzi tub in the mbr was clean and easily large enough for two. The walk in shower was perfect. The full size washer/dryer and well equipped kitchen definitely met our needs. We all thought the beds were very comfortable; the kids especially loved having full sized beds in their bedroom rather than the typical twin sized beds. Even the sofa bed was decent. The kids loved the pool area with the slides, and there were plenty of pool games and activities to keep them occupied. The pools were closed one day due to the storm, but the resort provided free dvds, puzzles and games to keep everyone occupied. The indoor/outdoor pool was very nice and clean. There is also a sauna, steam room and fitness room. There is a piano bar that offers drink specials and surprisingly good food. Our only complaint was that the pools do not stay open long enough, generally closing at 10 p.m. They are very focused on customer satisfaction and try very hard to exceed expectations. When I asked for a larger pot to cook in, housekeeping had it to us in minutes. I also called for extra blankets and towels when the storm was passing through and housekeeping had them to us in just a few minutes, They didn't just bring a couple of towels though, they brought a huge bag of folded towels, bath cloths and hand towels to be sure we had what we needed. I was very impressed. They never acted as if it was an inconvenience to bring anything to us. We started out booking for only 2 nights to see how the storm would affect our trip, but we ended up staying 5 nights because we liked the resort so well. This caused confusion on the part of the resort staff as we lenthened our stay 3 separate times. Each time they would call us just afterward as if we were new guests and offered us the timeshare pitch. Each time we had to tell them that we had extended our stay and were not new guests. I was concerned that after a week of Disney World the kids would be bored doing nothing, but they raved about this resort and all the activities that were offered. Even though the weather was bad they had a great time. It is a truly beautiful resort! I hope to return in the future and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains!”
Reviews.Author: Lgateshead
Reviews.Content: The Fountains is a lovely well situated hotel/combo at the bottom of ID spacious , very clean excellent faciliteies very much home from home. 2 Large bedrooms with en suite and the master also has a whirl pool bath. Loads of storage and lovely towels changed whenever you ask. There is no cleaning but this was a bonus to us as we were not disturbed. the staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Although we had to go to the Travel Centre nearby to check in, which was a nightmare as they had no record of our booking!!! Thankfully i had loads of paperwork with me and after a very tense hour we were allowed to stay for one night unitl it was sorted. After a lot of intervention from family members who live in orlando and they rang uk for us it was finally sorted. I would urge anyone else going from the uk to take all documentation with them to back up your booking. we were treat like imposters!! It was awful but next day they miraculously found the booking and we were moved to a bigger room, with even better facilities. The reviews I read mentioned trivial problems ie -ill fitting sheets, well they were not fitted sheets, but they did the job and were not a problem to us. the kitchen has a dishwasher and also a washing machine and tumble- if you needed any powder or dishwash liquid it was all free and plentiful, you just had to ask reception and they brought it right to your room. The pool is fabulous and is not shown on many sites realting to this complex. Its great for kids with a little playarea and water slide etc. Its huge loads of beds free towels and just great.The pool bar was pricy and a very limited choice of snacks which were very poor- however with so many eating places on the doorstep within 5 mins in car you would NEVER go hungry. Its right next to the Premium Outlet shopping Mall great shops and huge bargains. About 10 mins from Disney and about the same to Universal. Sea World s only about 5 mins. Once you suss the roads out its a doddle. It was a great location for us- last time we stayed in a villa in Kissimmee but we prefered this by far.Plenty of British visitors stayed in the hotel and Americans all were very friendly. It was just great- and I would certainly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: jsatl
Reviews.Content: This Resort is perfect for a family...We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit (building 3) that was plenty big enough for 4 adults and 2 children. We booked this through our time share-RCI and would definately go back. The pools were warm, staff was very helpful, units and balconies were so nice. We had no issues with sheets fitting, or any other of the silly complaints. Our unit over-looked the lake and at 10pm every night we would watch the fire works from Sea World. It was minutes away from all Disney parks. Publix is 1 mile away. Walmart 5 min. Huge outlet mall...15 min. away (best Victoria Secret outlet! everything 14.99 and under) I would highly recommend The Fountains to any family.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort”
Reviews.Author: jenntyl99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains July 16-21st and from the moment we stepped onto this property we were awed. This resort is incredible. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. From the security to the activities staff we were impressed. Upon our check in we were amazed at the size of our room. Wow! The rooms were complete with everything you would need and more. The resort grounds Clean, impeccable and a nice display of landscaping. This resort does an incredible job of keeping the grounds in tip top shape. The lakes are of impressive size and if you have time take advantage of the paddle boats (they are shaped like swans). They also have a tennis court and several grills on site for you to grill. The pools Again, wow! Two large sized pools. Wakoola Springs is immense. It boasts a zero entry kiddie area for younger kids and a water slide for older kids. There are at the least 5 sections, which are large enough. Since the pool is so large you do not feel crowded and can easily swim without bumping into people. Wakoola Springs also has a rather large hot tub on site that can accommodate quite a few people. The indoor/outdoor pool is also very large. It boasts a separate kiddie pool with a fountain. My daughter absolutely loved it. The indoor/outdoor pool has a volleyball net inside if you have an interest in playing water volleyball. Also, there is a steam room, bot tub, and pool table at this location. The rooms We stayed in a two bedroom villa that was equipped with a full kitchen (they had everything you would need to cook and eat off of and more). At check in you are also provided with dish detergent, paper towels, clean dish linens, and laundry detergent. Our room had two separate bathrooms, with one of the rooms having a jacuzzi in the bedroom. We had a private balcony overlooking one of the lakes and near Wakoola Springs. Overall Impression This resort has impeccable grounds and full array of activities for adults (happy hour, music by the pool,etc) and children alike (dancing contests, raft races, movies and pizza, karaoke, etc). If you have the time you really need to take advantage of their facilities and activities. Everyday they had scheduled activities at the pool and despite what others say, the pool did not close for the day and there were several days of severe storms. Overall, this resort will not disappoint you unless you are a someone who finds reason to complain about everything.

Reviews.Title: “loved the fountains fantastic”
Reviews.Author: blow69
Reviews.Content: When we booked this holiday i was dreading it as all my holidays have been ok,but the rooms,any when we arrived i fell in love with it straight away clean,modern,loads of space perfect i went with my husband and my 3 children they all loved it ,the pools were great the people were great and the food and drink were great the only disapointment was we had to come home defo going back next year

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains and the paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: basscatcher62
Reviews.Content: The Fountains looked amazing. The resort looked new, a water park was being built and there were lakes on the property. The rooms were decorated nicely and were very clean. The front desk was extremely busy, but the staff was courteous and we were quickly checked-in. We were really impressed with everything we had seen so far. Like others, we're Bluegreen owners, but unlike others, we didn't receive a sales call and we weren't badgered to attend any meetings. That was great, really great. Now for the not-so-good stuff. We were usually at an area attraction from lunch to late at night each day. Every evening after returning and putting the kids to bed, my wife and I would stay up for a while before going to bed. We'd hear the usual sounds from rooms next door, but we noticed we could understand what was being said. We made note of that and didn't think much about it until my wife went to bed. I'm a night person so I'm usually up alone until 1:00 each morning reading, watching tv, or scanning the internet (I didn't here because of the cost). On the first night as I was reading, I could hear someone in the room above us use the bathroom - not just the flushing sound, but the sound of urine hitting water followed by the flush. Just about the time the person was finished, I heard the same thing from the room next door. This was soon followed by the same sounds from a third room above me, but to one side. The next morning, I went to the front desk and reported this. The clerk said that they have never had that complaint before. She checked room availability, but she was not able to move us since there weren't any rooms similar in size for my family. I said that was okay and that I was just passing infomration to her. Well, the next night, I stayed up and watched tv and the same thing happened, not from all the rooms, but only from the one next door. As I indicated earlier, this wasn't bad or an annoyance, but was kind of humorous. When we checked out, I talked with another clerk about it and he stated that others have complained about thin walls. I told him that I wasn't complaining, but just giving information. Overall, our stay was good and we'll stay again because of the location to Disney and Seaworld, and the swimming pools, but I think I'll turn-in earlier in the evening to avoid the above scenario. I'd also recommend the Sunshine Resort, we stayed there for three nights before moving to The Fountains for three more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains!!! Don't know why there is so many bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: denasia_alyssa
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived at The Fountains I fell in love!! When I checked in I told the lady I wanted the newest building and top floor!! She gave me both and the room was great. It was spacious and had a great view. I loved the fact that housekeeping didn't come in our room while we stayed there!! I just don't like the idea of people cleaning up after my family and I while we aren't there!! Once we got settled in the room we called and ask for directions to different places (restaurants, malls, parks). The lady printed them off and we picked them up on the way out. Yeah it is true that they close the pool when it starts lighting but they are looking out for the guestsâ€™ safety. When it's just raining or thundering outside the inside pool is still open. They have gas grill outside that is very nice and my husband loved fishing in the stocked pone. The location was very good it took about 10 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom parking lot. There are about 30 restaurants or more right down the road from the resort. Another review I have seen a lot was about the bed sheets not fitting correctly. I didn't have any problem with any of the beds. The room was very clean when I arrived and any time that I asked for something they were knocking on my door within 5 minutes. Yeah I did go to the timeshare meeting or whatever they call it and all I did was say I know my family wouldn't use it. The manager came over asked me did enjoy the Fountains so far and told the lady to sign us out so we can continue our vacation!! If I was ever to go back to Florida I would definitely stay at the Fountains!! I have stayed at many resorts and hotels but this one is definitely in my top 5!!! I would suggest this resort to anyone that is going on a vacation! Hope everyone enjoys it as much as my family and I did :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fountains Resort”
Reviews.Author: fletchie148
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains from the 2nd to the 16th June, it was just for the 2 of us and we had a 2 bedroom apartment in Block 2. We looked out over the new pool complex and although other reviews say this, we were never bothered by music or noise at all coming from the pool or the resort itself, it was very quiet. The Fountains has a great location further down International Drive by Seaworld. We never really used the clubhouse, although it does look very nice, the pool area was fantastic and we did use it, although there was construction going on it is now more painting and finishing touches I think so no real noise, it never bothered us. We did not attend the time share presentation, nor were we asked to at any time, so this was never an issue for us. We will certainly return to The Fountains as this is a great resort with fantastic facilities both inside the apartments and around the resort. Would highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “luvfla.”
Reviews.Author: luvfla
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare for 'The Fountains' and was very happy with the site.It is on the quiet end of International Drive , very near a food store,Publix, i think.Also a Outback,and McD.The outlet stores are across the street from McDonalds, which are all about a quarter mile away.The suite had 2 bedrooms and tv area and full kitchen.We were on the 6th floor and had a nice view of fireworks at nite from Disney and Seaworld.The pool was huge and it also had a bar area near it. The grounds were kept up daily. The staff was helpful for info and they usually had a printout of what you asked for, directions, ect.You can also buy tickets for all the attractions in the lobby. I was told of a timeshare meeting in morning with breakfast, but we didnt go and was not bothered about it during the week. It wasnt busy the week we were there because I think most kids were still in school, so we had a very quiet time there.loved it... FYI, as you drive north , the traffic gets really bad but thats where most of the action is. We did Cape Kennedy one day and it is a must see...Its only about 36 miles away.And take the bus ride to various sites there, its very interesting.38 dollars for adults, kids ,I dont remember.. mine are on their own now...... We also went to Universal Studios, we had a good time.food was good too. Overall, we would go back, but theres dozens of places to go, and we are not getting younger.Have a great vacation.......

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for Two Couple Traveling”
Reviews.Author: vincm98
Reviews.Content: Great two bedroom condo with common area for Orlando stay. If traveling with two couples, you can not beat the value for a high class facility. Great amenities, Nice living room/kitchen with granite counter tops. Also has laundry and tub in master bathroom. All new facility. Even while under construction in April 08, still comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved 'The Fountains'”
Reviews.Author: Emeraldisles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains 9th May to 23rd May, we hired a car which we found the easiest way to get to all the theme parks, which were about a 15/20min drive either side of The Fountains, although Sea world, Wet n Wild & Discovery Cove are very close by. We have 2 children 9 yrs & 11yrs old. We found the apartments to be very spacious, clean & comfortable and they were lovely to come home to after a long day spent at the parks. The kids loved having their own room, they had a good sized bedroom with 2 lovely comfy beds & their own tv & a bathroom off their room. We had a lovely sized bedroom with ensuite & a jacuzzi bath in the bedroom. The kitchen was a good size, fully equipped & it was an added bonus having a washing machine & dryer. The new pool is great, the kids loved it on the days we took off from going to the parks & the bar & grill just opened the day we left (bummer!). The Fountains is on the quiet side of International Drive, which we found great after a busy & noisy day at the theme parks. We found the staff to be very helpful, you do have to pay for your room to be cleaned but we didn't find this a problem. We had no sales pitch either, just lots of messages left on the phone about what was happening around the resort. We also made use of the barbeque grills which are all around the resort. There is music played in the new pool, we didn't find this a problem & we couldn't hear it from our apartment, which was in building 8, one of the closest buildings to the pool. My only problem was not having had enough time to spend around this lovely resort! If we ever get to come to Orlando again we would love to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Fountains”
Reviews.Author: conradtraveler711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains the week of June 7-14th. I was a little apprehensive about the stay after reading some of the other reviews regarding stolen items and major sales pitches but we had no problems at all. There are safes in the rooms and the guards that you see when you drive on to the property are very friendly and helpful. There were four in our party, two adults and two kids ages 3 and 6. The rooms were perfect for a party of that size but for us would be cramped with more. We booked our stay through Bluegreen corporation and had only one mention of doing a time share presentation. After we told them we were not interested there was nothing mentioned about it again. We stayed there for the location of going to the parks which was perfect for us. Very short drive to Sea world and Disney. We only had one good day to spend at the pool which has a great spot for kids to play and our kids loved the water slide. The only other times we were able to go to the pool was at night after going to the parks. The main pool stayed open until 9 and the pool at the check in spot stayed open until 10. The resort leaves you messages on your phone daily to let you know of the activities they have that you can sign up for. There seemed to be plenty of activities you could sign up for but we were there to visit the parks so we had no time for any of those things. I would say this is a great place for families and a great location if you want to visit Disney. We had no problems what so ever and were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...No timeshare purchase for me!”
Reviews.Author: everfallenstar
Reviews.Content: The Fountains appeared promising from the reviews and the glamorous website, however my high expections were not met. Both pools were closed for an entire evening of our first night even though the rainstorms were quickly over and the sky was now sunny. Since we had no other plans that evening besides our failed attempt at swimming, we stayed in our room to enjoy the amenities, but kept coming across our very dirty feet. In order to solve the mystery, my boyfriend ended up mopping all of the floors in the room, which included two bathrooms, a kitchen, and hallway. Amazingly, our feet remained clean the rest of the week:). I also had the joy of cleaning all the dishes in the room...it was beginning to feel like home! I was also annoyed at the advertisements for hotel wi-fi which would have ended up being quite costly if I hadn't inquired prior to logging on since I was just seeing signs everywhere but no mention of cost. Also, beaware of the frequent attempts to sell you a timeshare. Upon arriving, in order to get your required parking pass, you have to listen to a sales talk about signing up for another sales talk. There are also daily (often frequent) messages left on your answering machine regarding timeshares (but at least the phone does not ring). In the end, my best advice is to stay at the resort to the left of The Fountains. We have stayed there numerous times without complaint...the rooms are cleanner, bigger, and no saleSTALKS!

Reviews.Title: “Superb for families”
Reviews.Author: thefountainsresort
Reviews.Content: Rated as excellent, not because it is luxurious but because it is good value for money and was exactly what we expected and needed, and trust me I'm fussy! My brother in law stayed here last year and recommended it as a base from which to do the theme parks. He was so right. This is perfect for a family. We where a party of 5 with the children ranging from 17 to 3. This place ticked all the boxes in terms of entertainment and accomodation. Everyone had there own space and no one was board. ROOMS Excellent size for a family, not cramped or on top of each other at all. Master bedroom has queen size bed (no the sheets don't fit but there is a trick to it) with a jacuzzi in the main room (excellent after a day round the parks with a beer) and seperate shower room. 2nd bedroom had two double beds and ensuite bathroom (bath with shower over). The living area has plenty of space, with a good balcony, and brilliantly a laundry room (cupboard) with washer & dryer (no none of us want to do washing on holday but I have to admit it was useful). They are not luxurious but better than most european standards and very clean. There is no daily maid service but a complete clean (we had one half way through our 2 week stay) is Â£12.50- and actually they forgot to add it to the bill at the end of the stay. Clothes storage was just OK for 5 people (bearing in mind 4 of us are female!) TV in every room, good range of chanels (DVD player does not play european DVDs). Stereo in main living area. Games console chargeable. FACILITIES Both pools are good, the larger one (with slides) good in the daytime & the smaller (indoor/outdoor) in the evening (cos the water is so warm). Only ate at the pool bar once (Wakola Grill) and it was fine. Prices for drinks & food reasonable. A few little play areas for the younger kids. Constant entertainment for the children which we hardly used (because we where out and about, but when did use was good). Good clean gas BBQs next to each block - we used it once & was really good. Sandy sitting areas around the lake. Small on site shop where you can get a British paper. LOCATION Although on I-Drive, as with most places in the states, you had to drive everywhere! Good location for Disney (10-15 minutes) & Seaworld (2 mins) & Universal (10-15 mins). 20 minutes from airport. Publix supermarket round the corner (on Vineland) was good. We ate on I-Drive most nights - good selection of resteraunts 5 mins away (in the car!). SERVICE/STAFF Was very good, check in straight forward (as was check out), staff friendly but not over the top. No one tried to sell us anything! CRITISCISMS Check out is 10am we did manage to get it extended to 11am. Music starts pumping round the resort (not mega loud) at 9am, just when my 3 year old discovered lie ins! Would definately go back ,and spend more time at the resort itself. One of our only regrets was that we did not feel we had made the most of the complex.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains is Great!”
Reviews.Author: lucybrewergray
Reviews.Content: We are Bluegreen owners but used the weeks we had converted from points to weeks with RCI to book 2 units May 23 for a week. That was the better deal than spending 16,000 for a week for one unit. One bedroom is a King and the other is 2 doubles. We found it ideal to split up (although there were just 5 of us- 2 couples and 1 child). The units are big enough for a couple and up to 4 kids though. However, if you have more than one couple, 2 units would be best so you both can have the King bedroom and not have to sleep in doubles. The resort is great- the location is fantastic right off International Drive by Seaworld- much more desirable than the Kissimmee/Clermont area which shows its age and is somewhat rundown looking. The outlets (quite upscale, Tods, Burberry, Armani, Tag, etc.) are about a mile away. The Fountains isn't too big and everything is within easy walking distance (all buildings but maybe 2 surround the new fantastic pool area and are only a few minutes walk from it). The clubhouse is nice and the pool there (indoor and outdoor) great, but nothing compared to the enormity of the new pool area that opened in March 08. I can't imagine the resort before this pool opened which is the center of the resort now - it has increased the resort's desirability exponentially. What I really enjoyed was the DJ at the pool several days which added a festive, fun atmosphere similar to cruise ships. The massage cabanas (for a fee of course) were a nice surprise. The staff was great and very helpful. We got burgers one day at the pool with greek salads that were very good. We did attend the "owner's update" for a $100 Disneybucks giftcard and it lasted about 90 minutes and as always, was a little frustrating. However, we thought it was worth the trouble to get the $100 and we did learn about some new ownership perks Bluegreen is offering and about their new properties. We will return to The Fountains for sure and I'm banking some Bluegreen points (only takes about 5000 for a week!) for RCI weeks now to do the same thing next year I hope- get 2 units for a week via an RCI exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Everything else is OK”
Reviews.Author: happilyyours247
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Foutains for my honeymoon with a "free" 5 day stay. Well nothing is free through Bluegreen but it was discounted. My new husband and I had to go to a high pressured timeshare presentation. The longest 90 minutes of my life! About the hotel: We didn't have a car so we did alot of walking from our building to the entrance. The rooms are beautiful and roomie. They bed was comfortable and soft but needed fitted sheets. It's definately a family resort. The pools are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort and enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: colangelos
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit skeptical when I read all the reviews in tripadvisor for this resort. First the location is excellent, it is located on International drive, approx. one block away from Publix and about a mile down from Seaworld. Check in was about 20 minutes and the receptionist was very polite. We stayed in the building 6 and its a very short distance (2 mins walk) to the club house. The unit itself was very clean (no ant, no bugs) and housekeeping was good in mid week. The kitchen is big enough and plenty of room for 4 of us. When I called the front desk to get a pack - n- play and high chair for my 20 months old, it showned up in 15 mins. So far we are happy with our stay and would def. go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time at The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: CamandKay
Reviews.Content: Vist from May 23-30 2008 We did a timeshare exchange at The Fountains and I was a bit skeptical by a few reviews in which some items were taken from peoples rooms. We were greated by a really firendly security officer and I am sorry to say that we did not get his name. He is Britsh and you cannot miss that. What a pleasure he was. The check in took a bit but we arrived with everyone else around 4pm. We have two year old twins so we were looking for an easy room to get to and one that was close to the action per se. The reception lady got us a great villa in building 2 which backs up to the new pool. It is hard for me to imagine what this place was like with the one pool. This pool made all of the difference. It has plenty of room and a kids section at the far end. There are plenty of bathrooms and the activity staff is always putting something together. They have a water slide for the bigger kids and adults and most people seemed to like it. The Grill is new and it looked like they may have been struggling a bit. We never ate there but we did go there for a drink and at $8 for a margarita, I was not returning. They would do great if they advertised specials and if they had pizza on the menu. I saw Dominos driving in on many occasions with pizza and thought that they would have done better if they could have kept business inside the resort. We went on the paddleboats and that was cute and we participated at the bonfire. That was neat because you could see the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom as you roasted a marshmallow on the fire. The villa was well stocked and we had no problems. There was plenty of space and everything looked pretty new and up to date. We used the safe and never left valuables lying around. All in all, we had a great time and would recommend this to others. We did the timehare presentation for two free tickets to Seaworld and that was ok. Our rep was nice but the manager that came behind her was a total jerk and that is putting it nicely. We own three timeshares and don't need another. He started to tell us that we were missing out not owning points and said that we were blocked out of 39% of resorts owning weeks. I don't think he noticed that we were staying there and we were not blocked from them.. We may have issues in the future exchanging, but not now and own at pretty nice places. Great place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: slady2008
Reviews.Content: I visited the Fountains Resort in Orlando, Florida May 9-13th 2008. The Desk clerk that serviced me was wonderful. I got in around 8pm and he directed me to the H20 lounge to try and get a little something to eat. So I went to at least try, well to my surprise the bartender never looked my way he took care of ever one around me though. So, when another guest spoke to me she asked a few questions I answered. She asked what did i need in there since i still had my bags with me I told her just a little something to eat. So she told the bartender and he in turn said to her that the kitchen was closed still never looking at me directly. I turn and left I got to my room and about 15 minutes later or so I got a call from customer service that welcomes you and sets up the appointments for your welcome visit tour to possibly add more points to your program as well as promising you 100 dollar gift card to spend any way you chose. The lady was nice enough to give me the name of a place that delivered at a reasonable rate. On the next day I went to the welcome visit they served refreshments as usual. Then they start with the sales pitch to get you further involved it is a good thing if it is affordable for you at that time. For me, it was not and I had already told my salesperson when they greeted me that I was not interested in adding on to what I had which was a Sampler package. But, of course that is there job and I do understand that make money any way you can. But I did feel pressured when my salesperson started putting numbers together when I had already informed them that I was not interested in adding anything else on to my package. They left me for a minute only to return with a manager to show me what I was passing up. It did not work the Manager approach me in the wrong way. He started talking about one of my home teams in a negative way which completely turned me totally off to anything else he had to say. I did inform them that I did not appreciate being pressured by anyone. I went downstairs to retrieve the gift card the person that was taking care of that gave me a lot of different place to use the card. But, never did they say or we can just give it to you to use at your leisure. So, I reminded this person of the conversation that I had with them the night before of where and whenever I like to use the gift card. They did not look happy when I said this to them. What really turned me off was the fact that no one at this resort could even speak to me when passing by except for the worker and that includes all races. Shame on you all it has never hurt any one to say hello when passing by. I still wish you all a good life. And this was an eye-opening experience for me that I shared with some of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “WOW-some!”
Reviews.Author: Darkholme
Reviews.Content: I walked in and boy was I blown away! The place was much nicer than home, I DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE! My fiance especially did not want to! We used everything, from the ironng board to the jacuzzi (boy that was wonderful!) The room had everything we needed. The housekeeping even brought us some extra tide and somemore dish soap. This place is wonderful, I would recommend it over and over again. The pools are especially spectacular, they are so big and the temperature is perfect. My fiance and I went almost every other day. They also have free cookies sometimes in the lobby. We were also invited for a free picture shooting wich was wonderful! The balcony is also wonderful because it has a fan and chairs and even a screen to ward away bugs, and since the weather was so perfect, we left the door open with no worrys. Everyone was so nice and I had an awesome time staying there.

Reviews.Title: “The worst timeshare hotel we ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Panda29California
Reviews.Content: A maid was still cleaning when we arrived at our room. We had to stay in the balcony for an hour. Two other maids came to help to clean the room, but the maids' attitude toward us was bad. Even though house keeping supervisor came to check on the room, she didn't notice the coffee maker's pot was broken, kitchen sponge was missing, used water picher was left in the fridge. Second day morning we requested to get new coffee maker and sponge, but they were not there when we came back at night. Instead my husband's laptop computer was stolen from our room - we locked our room of course! Security was no help, the resort manager was not aware of this incidents until my husband talked to him after a couple of days. We've been using timeshare hotels over 10 years, but this resort was the worst timeshare resort we've ever stayed. I say our vacation was ruined by this resort and never stay again and never recommend this resort to enyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LJL1976
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at the Fountains. I would start by saying that the Fountains provides an excellent base for the parks, activities and beaches which are in the area (easy drive to both Cocoa and Daytona Beach). Previous reviews have said that the resort is too far down International Drive, however this is not true, yes it is at the quieter end, but only 10 mins from all the theme parks (Universal, Disney) and literally two minutes from Vineland Avenue where there are the Premium Outlets (discount designer and sports labels, a bit like Bicester in England) and only 10 mins from Major Malls. Sea World is less then 5 mins away. Reception gave us excellent directions (a sheet) to everything we could need and driving in Florida is a lot easier than in the UK as the roads are massive and well sign posted. Just in case anyone is thinking of not hiring a car - donâ€™t! Wherever you stay on I-Drive, you will need one! For us Europeans reading the review, the best way to describe this resort is not like a hotel, but imagine apartment blocks (about 7 I believe) surrounding a man-made lake (not in brilliant condition, water level dropped, algae, poor fountains) but with 2 swimming pools, one with two large kids slides and play area. The resort is part of Blue Green, which are a big timeshare company, luckily we escaped any sales presentations! The hotel has a small bar and shop and the smaller indoor / outdoor swimming pool (the one you will see in photos), a good small gym (lifefitness equipment), games room (pool table, table tennis), arcade room etc. Disappointingly the Pool bar at this pool was not open, and the facilities in general seem a bit understaffed, this may have been the time of year. This meant that if you wanted a drink you had to get an elevator to the main bar. Note to Managers â€“ if this was open we would have spent more! Although we did not make full use of them there seemed to be good activites for kids and adults. The hotel is quite expensive in comparison to the area (drinks, food, tickets etc). The room was very well equipped with everything that you would have in a Villa (washing machine, dishwasher, dryer etc). The dÃ©cor was not brilliant, but typically American and very new. The kitchen is a good size. TVâ€™s in all 3 rooms, Jacuzzi hot tub and power showers, the air conditioning and ceiling fans are excellent. If I were American visiting, I would take my own DVDâ€™s to watch (especially for kids) as the channels are limited on the TVâ€™s unless you pay for them or indeed pay for films (approx $16). Unfortunately the room was very dirty when we arrived including having the previous occupants food in the fridge which was not pleasant, however the next day it was cleaned better, after that it is up to you as there is no maid service until the day you leave which is not really a problem (you can pay for extra cleans I believe). You are given Pool Towel tokens on arrival which allows you to have fresh beach towels whenever you want them which is great. The staff were not too interested if I am honest and service lacked a smile, except for Security who were very friendly and professional and ran a very tight ship, as with previous reviews, I want to give a special mention to Howard Myers â€“ an ex-pat Brit, first class service and a good source of local information! I was hoping for first class Customer Service in Florida, but unless the staff are tip earning then they are no better then in the UK! I should say that around the lakes are big gas BBQâ€™s which you can use â€“ a great idea. Also there is another lake which has wild life such as big turtles and fish and you can hire rods and paddle boats â€“ this was lovely (located behind the main reception building). Speaking to Orlando regulars (including one girl who worked in timeshare) the fountains is of a better standard than most and if I didnâ€™t rent a Villa, then I would defiantly stay here again, although not perfect, it did provide good value for money. Feel free to contact me if you want more!

Reviews.Title: “love everything about the fountians”
Reviews.Author: lownpaula
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the the fountians on april 13-18 2008 with my wife and three kids. the fountians was a wonderful choice i have no complaints as evvery thing was great . we stayed in building 7 near the back which had a great view of the lake and new pool area. The room was very clean and had a lot of space for a family of 5. the new pool area was very nice, and the kids loved it. The staff was freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: ABBY2008
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at The Fountains, 12400 International Drive, Orlando, FL and totally fell in love with the resort. We booked the reservation through Bluegreen Rentals (Michelle) and received a 2 bedroom deluxe villa (6303) that included a living/dining room combination, fully equipped kitchen, 2 bathrooms, laundry area with washer/dryer, ironing board & iron, and even a laundry basket and detergent. One bedroom had 2 full beds and the master had a king sized bed and jacuzzi tub. Both bedrooms and the living area had televisions. The highlight of the villa was that it had a screened balcony with a ceiling fan. We spent a lot of time out there enjoying the view of the lake, fountains, and ducks that have taken up residence there too! The fountains turn on at 8:00 a.m. and music is played throughout the day. Although most of our time in Orlando was spent "exploring" the area, we did take advantage of the pool area that is located behind the main lobby. It is truly a beautiful spot to relax, not to mention that the water temperature was like bath water! There were also 2 hot tubs (one inside, one outside), and plenty of lounge chairs. They recently opened another pool with water slides, but we didn't check that one out since we figured the kids would be enjoying that one. We would definitely recommend The Fountains as it's on the quieter end of International Drive and only a few blocks away from Sea World. It also has 24 hour security and you have to have a parking pass to get by the gate. We actually found out how secure it was the first night of our stay. We had arrived about 4 hours later than we had anticipated due to a flight delay, and a 1 hour wait in line for our rental car. So, by the time we got to our room, we were pretty hungry and decided to have pizza delivered. About 30 minutes after ordering, we received a call from security asking whether or not we had ordered pizza. After confirming that we had, they allowed the delivery person through the gates. Last, but not least, Howard who works for security at the main gate is a true asset to the company. Anyone who meets him will instantly know why! HINT: He has a wonderful accent and great sense of humor!!! NOTE: In response to previous reviews - Our villa was very clean, no ants, and we found the beds to be quite comfortable, although I would agree that they need to invest in fitted bottom sheets.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovingfreedom
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to find the entrance, but as another traveler said, look for the 2 story blue roofed building. Also, if you have a low bumper like I do, be careful or you'll bottom out every time. Easy check-in. Really like a home away from home, so think of it like that. It'll cost you extra for them to clean your room or change your towels/sheets, but there's a washer and dryer in the room, so if you need clean stuff, there you go. Check out is too early - 10am - yuck. Beds were okay, nothing fancy. Very spacious - we were in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath. The master suite is really nice with a jacuzzi and separate shower. Fans in all the rooms really help with the Florida heat. There's even one on the balcony. There was a TV, DVD player and stereo in the living area. Full kitchen was terrific. I could do all the cooking, etc., without having to worry about pots, pans, dishes, glasses, etc. I didn't appreciate the phone call at 8:30am the morning after we arrived. Not sure what they wanted but they didn't bother me again. Not much "soundproofing". Can hear toilets flushing, people talking, etc., but it wasn't horrible. Great location - so much to do on International Drive, not even taking the parks into account. Very close to SeaWorld and Aquatica. Also, Publix and Walgreens only a couple blocks away. Gorgeous pool area. Indoor and out and actually heated for those of us who live in Florida (85 is just perfect). 2 hot tubs which were really nice. Splash area for little kids. Nice chairs, too, not those crappy plastic things. Air conditioning in the room worked beautifully and unlike most places I've stayed, it was very quiet. I wouldn't do the tour. I have older teenagers so it's not the type of place I'd want to buy into, plus they don't allow pets, but I think you'll like staying there. It's great for littler kids - activities galore. Arcade is small for the number of families that are there. Only one pool table and one ping pong table which were in use constantly. It rained the entire weekend, which made it even more crowded. View from our room was nice - overlooking the lake. I really loved staying there. I was comfortable, felt like I was home and could relax. Not too much for my teenagers to do, but they managed. I would definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, could be Great”
Reviews.Author: JackRubysDog
Reviews.Content: If you just want somewhere fairly decent to base yourself and to be left alone to enjoy all that Florida and Orlando have to offer, then I certainly would recommend The Fountains. We had two good weeks there - I say good, but it could have been better. There is nothing much to complain about, except perhaps the construction all around you (but this should not be a problem much longer) and their insistence of having loud music pumped all around the new pool. Our apartment was very spacious and exceedingly well equipped, and looked out over the newly-opened pool. It was clean when we arrived and we were never once disturbed by the staff - it really was a home from home. The kitchenette was great although our microwave didn't work properly. We never ate at the eateries on-site as there is a Publix a quarter of the mile down the road, so we just stocked up on groceries on cooked in the room (or ate out). We were slightly pressured into a presentation on collecting our key but the guy understood we were not interested and didn't press it. We used both pools, preferring the one near the lake as it was quieter. The music at the new pool was too loud - probably to mask the sound of the construction, but then why did they play it on Sundays as well? We would return to The Fountains - no question...

Reviews.Title: “Problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: mysteward
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in paradise. We had an early check in. Arrived Saturday morning about 9am. Didnt receive the keys, until after 2pm. The condo looked clean. Later, we found ants. Rather, they found us in the kitchen. The a/c didnt work. Room temp on the wall was over 81 degrees. Needed linen for one of the beds! I called front desk 3 times over 3 to 4 hours before I saw somebody. The first guy went to set the themostat. Told me to let it work over night. Ask for the linen. He had to recall another guy. He took an hour to bring up a bag. That only had a top sheet. The next morning at 7am, my wife and I went to sales presentation. Before we left the room we looked at the temp. over 75. At 7AM, we told a staff member the problem. They said it will be taken care of right away. During this presentation all they kept saying even the Carlton Ritz , has problems. All I know is, if they take care of problems like here I wouldn't stay. We went to a park came back later that night. The a/c still was not working. I went to the front desk. Thats when they sent the correct person to fix it. Two days later! We never recieved the linen. We stayed one week in room 2301.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: dee81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fountains for a week. We went to Orlando mainly to rest and relax. We spent most of our time in the room and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very spacious and nice. They were clean (which I'm really picky about) and seem fairly new. Our room overlooked the new pool area which was really nice although it wasn't open yet. The only negative aspect was all of the construction. It wasn't a problem noise wise, but it was just a bit unsightly, and it was hard to find the entrance to the resort at the beginning. I would difinetely stay at the Fountains again though.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains: Liked it but didn't love it”
Reviews.Author: dwtraveldude
