Reviews.Content: I returned today from a 3-night stay at the Fountains. I thought it was nice but not spectacular. I was in a 2-bedroom unit in building 5. There is alot of construction going on around the entrance to the property and on property as well but it was never a problem. Building 5 had a nice view of the lake and could see towards the pool area and I also got to see the shuttle launch from the balcony. The room- Master bedroom is nice with a jacuzzi tub in the room as well as a seperate shower. There is also a door onto the patio from the master bedroom. The bed seemed comfortable but this wasn't the room I stayed in so I don't know how it was to sleep on it. The living room was ok but seemed small. With the pull out couch being used as a bed there was very little room to walk around. The tv's were alright and there was a nice stereo underneath the tv. The sleeper sofa was not very comfortable and I think I might have been better off sleeping on the couch itself instead of pulling it out into a bed. Dining area was a good size and able to seat the whole family ( 4 adults 3 kids). Kitchen was kinda small with the laundry room was off the kitchen and there was no pantry to store food. We were only there for 3 nights and didn't need too much food storage space but I can see how someone there for a week might have trouble storing their food with such a small kitchen. The 2nd bedroom looked nice but I didn't spend anytime in there. The patio area is average sized but the part is that it's screened in so we were protected from bugs and didn't have to worry much about the kids slipping through railings. Had a few issues, there were a few dirty spots in the tub that we cleaned up, there weren't any sheets for the sleeper sofa and we needed some extra pans for cooking and couldn't find any salt/pepper. We called the desk and they sent up sheets and more pans right away and also called the room to follow up that they were delivered. The facilities- The grounds were well taken care of. The only restaurant I used was the poolside bar and my drink was alright and I didn't try any of the food. The pool area is very nice with plenty of chairs and tables for everyone. There is a seperate children's pool and the water is heated and felt great. Prior to arrival we were told that the new pool area would be open during our stay but when we checked in we were told there were delays and that it wouldn't be opening til later. The new area has waterslides and a children's waterplay area and it looks like fun when it opens. That area will also have a poolside bar. There were planned activities every day but I didn't participate in any of them. The staff was friendly and the only time we were pressured to attend a presentation was at check-in. The property is in a great location and only about 5 minutes from Disney and very close to the outlet mall. It is close to the end of International Drive so the traffic in the area isn't as bad as it would be if it were in the heart of Int. Drive. If anyone has any other questions they can send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot.”
Reviews.Author: thompstone
Reviews.Content: Drove in from Tampa. Extensive construction made it tricky finding the entrance, but skillful (crazy) driving worked in my favor. Look for the smaller blue roofed building on International Drive across from the Sheraton resort. Check-in was easy. I expected the sales pitch and got none (lucky me). Many reviewers complain about the hard sell at these resort presentations. If you want goodies for nothing, expect them to get their money's worth. Just say no to the initial offer or expect the onslaught. The clubhouse is nice, but I think the bar/restaurant is better for last minute meals than planned dinner. Outback and a billion other restaurants and shops are a 5 minute drive away. The indoor/outdoor pool is warm like bathwater. There's water volleyball, a pretty decent fitness room, billiards, snookers,ping-pong, arcade, There's a small beach area for campfire/smores night, paddle boats, wading pool. Lots to keep kids of all ages occupied. There were daily activities for those who want to hang around the resort. Karaoke and stuff like that, too.Otherwise, Sea World is a 5 minute drive, Universal is 20 minutes or so. I think Disney's about the same. There's a local trolley that'll get you where you want to go for a small fee, but the hike to the front gate might be long. We had a room in Bldg 8, which is new. The room was great- clean, spacious, lots of towels and wash-clothes. It was perfect for us (2 adults, 1 child)- 2 bedrooms with bathrooms, kitchen with breakfast bar, dining area, and lanai overlooking the new pool. The new pool is scheduled to open in early March and will be awesome. I'm hoping to book again later this year just to check it out. There were BBQ grills behind the building, but they were new and will probably be available when the new pool opens. Wired internet in the rooms runs about $30/week. You can pay by the day if you'd rather. Construction noise wasn't a problem. And that's about it. All in all, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Grandmoth9
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay through Vaction Store and were told that late checkin would be no problem, that upon arrival we would set up our tour, that we would receive two tickets to Arabrain Night and some other lies that I can not recall. We were about two hours later than we expected and after following the directions to the site where we were to pick up keys and room assignment found only directions to the Fountains and a slip indicating that the required tour was at 10:30 the next day. That canceled all hopes of finding a near by Church to attend since this is Lent. We did find the Fountains and were able to check in after another hour. However, our confirmed reservation was for 2 adults and 4 children and our information packet contained two separate slips one for 2 adults for 2 nights and the other for 2 adults and 2 children for 5 nights. The desk clerk kept this so she could check it out and get back to me. I am still waiting seven days later. I did ask if the tour time could be changed and was told that it was too late to do that. I skipped church and went. It started about ten minutes late because a number of staff were on vacation and several more had not showed up for work. The information was well presented and we were reminded to pick up our gifts after the tour. I was assigned to a very determined salesperson and finally bought a small sampler package which I will use with the grandchildren and/or sisters in the mountains. I could not pick up my gift because my package code did not show what the gift was supposed to be and they would not take my word that it was the Arabian Nights tickets. Since the Welcome Center is not opened on Suinday it could no be resovled. After another hour of my time was wasted, I was told to go to the Vacation Store on Monday and we were able to join the rest of the family over at Orange Lake. What a difference!!! We were met at the gate and giving clear directions to the Condo we were visiting. Much larger and a full size washer and dryer instead of the apartment size. Plus thier kitchen has a pantry so you have space to put food instead of just dishes to eat it from. Monday we attempted to get the gift issue resolved and ended up almost two hours at the Welcome Center/Vacation Store and left with a promise that it would get resovled and I would receive a call on my Cell phone. We then went over to spend the afternoon with my grandchildren's other grandmother at Orange Lake. We were very impressed with the staff again and grandchildren spent the afternoon in Orange Lake's water park. Lunch was good and not too pricey for a resort. The Grandparent's condo in one of the high rises was very roomy and their whirpool tub is in the master bath instead of the bedroom so they have more privacy when using it. When we returned to the Fountains I attempted to clear up the gift issue and was told that it was too late to come back the next day which was the day of the wedding that was the main purpose of our trip to Florida. Had to wait while the clerk was attempting to resolve an issue of a couple who had been quoted one price and was being charged nearly double. Friends from Ocala visited me Wednesday and we were disappointed in lunch except for the maintainance person who took care of our leftover and empty containers for us. Thursday we made a brief attempt to resolve the gift issue again but decided that we had wasted enough of our vacation and that since we had been promised calls be both the Fountains staff and the Vacation Store that we were going to one of the parks. Friday we took off early and spent the day at the beach. When we returned we did use the indoor-outdoor pool and it is as nice as what you find in the average Holiday Inn. I wanted to use the regular check out Saturday Am since I still had not received the call about the mix up at check inn but the line was long and not moving. Did overhear another conversation about the rate being charged was not what was quoted so I am expecting mine to be 75% or 80% more than quoted as that was what the couple complaining Monday pm, at the Vacation Store and Sat am had experienced. I will have more in writing when we use the sampler points at Boyne in Michigan and Pigeon Forge in Tennessee. If we do return to Florida it probably will not be the Fountains. Janet Sowmick, West Branch, MI 48661

Reviews.Title: “Toss Up: Not sure if I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ScrabbleNut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently staying at the Oasis section of the Fountains Resort. The Oasis sections can only be in Building 3 or 4, and is near the pool and clubhouse. But, don't let the pool area scare you away. The noise from the pool is not heard. In addition, the Resort is under major renovation, and they are constructing a beautiful new pool as well, which is going to be behind Building 5. I don't know when it will be completed. If you can stay in either Building 3 or 4, jump at the chance! The rooms are spacious and airy. While I don't think the rooms have a very modern decor, it is very comfortable. If you like peace and quiet, then this Resort can be a problem if you are not staying in Building 3 or 4. You will hear construction noise behind or to the side of certain buildings. Since it didn't affect my stay, I am not sure how much of a nuisuance it can be. Pros: great location Cons: under renovation

Reviews.Title: “Decent Vacation Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: natyong
Reviews.Content: The Fountains was a nice place, but was not exceptional. It was much better than any hotel, but I can imagine other timeshares being able to do a better job. Our trip was recent, Jan. 16-20, 2008. The Fountains is a growing resort. This has its pros & cons. They provide a letter in your room explaining this fact. Their construction doesn't start before 7, but adjacent property construction (was to far from or rooms in building 6) sometimes does. The resort entry is under construction. It can be hard to find sometimes just for the fact it can change daily and does not have a very visible permanent sign. Most buildings are 7 stories high. Suites consist of 2 plus rooms and I believe have a really good layout for noise, comfort, etc. This doesn't mean noise isn't a factor. Our family had two suites next to each other and could not hear loud noises from the other suite, but we could hear loud kids from above and below quite well. In the building we were in the Master bedrooms had another source of noise from suites on other wing of our building and another building (7) across the pond. A couple per room can go to morning presentation for $150 towards park tickets. Only supposed to be -2 hours, but ours took +3. Pros: Location - located between Sea World and Disney parks. Stores and restaurants are plentiful within 1-2 mile drive. Clean - Rooms aren't cleaned daily, but they came quite clean. Room Amenities - TV/cable in all rooms, washer/dryer, iron/board, safe, kitchen had rags/soap, dish washer, blender, coffee maker, pots and pan, dishes, etc. Large Pool & hot tubs - Pool is partial indoor (rectangle w/volleyball area including net) and winding outdoor. Depth between 3.5 to 5.5 ft and Heated. Kiddie pool about a foot deep and plenty big enough for many children. 2 Jacuzzis pool side. Outdoor Jacuzzi is surrounded by vegetation giving it a private feel. Cons: Noise - It can be a factor, you also might get lucky. Construction - Noise, area closures. Sheets - bottom not fitted, if you expect lots of "messy" sleeping bring your own. Otherwise you probably won't notice them. Pool side bar often closed (never open during our stay). Other notables: Internet connections - In room DSL (cat5): $10 a day, $21 for 3 days, $35 a week. I hooked up my personal wireless router to it with little difficulty. Free wireless in clubhouse and poolside. 2 public computers in clubhouse. Activities - Plenty of them, but nothing really special. 2 people at bingo, no participants at pool scuba ($15/$25). Parking - by permit only and sometimes can be a ways away. In conclusion, it's a nice place for a family vacation, but go somewhere else for your honeymoon. If what your looking for is a quality family vacation resort it's a good to excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: WalesRussfamily
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the fountains 5th jan 2008. Had a fab time would definetely stay there again close to all amenities and not far from the parks. the appartment was very clean, well equiped with everything you could need. One thing is the sheets don't fit the beds tidy. but the staff are very friendly and are prepared to help you with any quieries you may have. There are lots of places to eat and are very cheap and good choices. Very easy to drive over there not as bad as in the uk. no roundabouts that one good thing. The pool was a godsent my family went in it everyday heated well clean towels and a great sauna and jazzui must try if you go. We are looking to book for 2009. well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tgoode
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Fountains during the week of Christmas. The full kitchen had all of the cooking utensils we needed to cook our Christmas dinner including plates, glasses, etc. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. There was also a closed in balcony w/ceiling fan which we ate our breakfast and used to just relax. We spent time at the indoor/outdoor swimming pool and my husband and son also went catch and release fishing on the pier. There are amenities available for all ages. We would definitely come back to the Fountains for future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “You cancelled your reservation”
Reviews.Author: WaryConsumer
Reviews.Content: Booked a two week family holiday at the Fountains resort. After a transatlantic plane flight with the usual airport hassles the last thing we wanted to hear was that ,"You cancelled your reservation". However upon our arrival at the Fountains, that is what we were informed by reception staff. This of course was totally unfounded and staff apportioned the blame to someone who happened to be unavailable and then on some middle booking company. After we verified that our debit card had been debited we were provided with one nights accomodation. Our request to be facilitated for the previously booked period was not met and we had to move to other accomodation,the following day. What we did note in the little time we did spend at the fountains was that the apartment was spacious ,however the patio area had a mosquito net and the security man threatened to have our hire car towed as we were not displaying the correct pass.

Reviews.Title: “Will be a lovely resort when construction is done”
Reviews.Author: btysklind
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Fountains in Orlando as part of a promotion for Bluegreen resorts. I seriously just wanted a couple days of rest and relaxation. Unfortunately they put us in a lovely room, but next to the construction that is going on and they start early in the a.m. Also, the beds were not comfortable (to us at least) and did not sleep well either night. (They really need to invest in sheets that fit the bed). And the carpet was wet (recently cleaned - poor first impression). The pool that was there is very nice (partly outdoors and partly indoors) - and adequately heated. No complaints there. They advertised a bar by the pool that also served food - but it was closed - my guess was because there were not many people there the week after Thanksgiving. It does seem to be very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “the fountains were great”
Reviews.Author: castiog
Reviews.Content: i booked the fountains in January before reading any of the reviews here,and after reading some of the reviews later i almost cancelled but i'm glad we did,nt. The Fountains was perfect accommodation for a two week stay,my son had his own room with two beds to choose from and his own bathroom which was great,we had a huge kingsize bed and yes the sheets do not fit properly but they did'nt bother us,it was clean, everything you need is there,i even did all of my washing to bring home.The fountains is in an ideal location away from the busy international drive so you do need a car or you could get the itrolley,there is a stop right outside,the parks are all only about a ten minute drive away great.The down side well ,we were in building three and there was building work going on ,did'nt bother us at all never heard them,checking in was a pain after a ten hour journey we expected to just check in but they told us we had to go out to the tourist information to fill ina form before checking in,this is just for the time share, they get you to pay a$20 deposit which you get back when you go on the tour so tired at this stage we would have paid whatever,however when we went to the meeting i demanded our money back and told them we would not do the tour you need to be firm.The staff there as could be a little friendlier they do there job but thats it,and don't expect room cleaning as they charge for this,as a self catering holiday you don't really expect someone to come in and clean anyway. Overall had a great time there and would defo go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sunflower78
Reviews.Content: We went to the fountains on the 4th Oct till the 24th, It took us ages to find the place, but once arriving there check in went well they told us we were in building 2, went to the appartment we were all amazed, it was beautiful, we opened the curtains and was dissapointed to see the all the building work going on, We was aware of this before we went so we just thought we'll see what happens, Building started everyday apart from sunday at 7am, We were all ok with this really as it got us up and ready for the parks, My trouble started when we started seeing insets (sugar ants) everywhere.... I rang reception and told them and within 10mins someone came round to spray, the next day more appeared so rang again and someone was suppose to come round and sort it while we were out (but found out at a later date no one did that day) The next day i had to ring again as they were everywhere, in the kitchen,bathroom in our draws, I'd had enough by this time, i told them i wanted to move, It was 9am and my hubby's birthday, i'd arranged for him to do the shark dive at 10am, The lady rang me back to say she'd got another room but i had to leave my room before 10am, I explained that we had plans but would cut the day short and be back for 3pm to move, She said we couldn't do that as they were busy and needed the room i wasin for other people to check into, I tried to explian to her that she couldn't let other people in as the room clearly has a ant problem, Anyway the manager phoned me back and said to stay where we are today and they would get professional people in and do a full house clean at no charge, I did agree to this for the sake of my hubby!!! The next day came and yes you guessed it more little visiters.... Rang them again but this time it took them nearly 2hrs to sort another room out, oh and it was about 6pm not before 10am as they'd said before, We moved to block 5 over the way which was lovely, the only problem i had there was the bloody spinkler on the grass came on about 7.30 and the water kept hitting the window (we was on the ground floor) and waking us, And we did have two other visitors on the balcony which was a frog and a lizard they got through the rip in the net. The only other incident that happened was after a couple of days of the move i realised i hadn't seen my jewellery, i panicked and looked everywhere, i went to reception and asked if i'd left it behind in the other room, but in the back of my mind i was thinking of all the people that had been in there, i know thats bad but i did panic, I was told that they'd look into it and get back in touch, i never heard nothing, i kept ringing them, i went back to reception and not once did anyone get back in touch with me!!! I did how ever find my jewellery i had hidden it in my hubby's shoes i think i did it when the cleaners and them came and had just forgotten about it with the move, I did try and ring them a few times but i think they just stopped picking the phone up to me. I'm not sure if you know about this or not but there is no free cleaning there, I didn't know, but if you want the place cleaning it is $25, and the other thing is dont use the rooms phone to ring home, for a 17min phone call to England it cost me $47 which is about Â£25 thats more then Â£1 a minute,scandalous amount. After all that moaning i would stay there again (if they'd have me) as it was just the right location for us, very central, and very quite around you, apart from the new build. Oh and by the way the first room we stayed in was 2412 from what i was told it is an on going problem.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay agian”
Reviews.Author: tommo71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains Oct 7 to 21. When we arrived it took only a few minutes to check in, we were asked to attend a timeshare meeting the next day which we declined and were not hassled into attending. When we got to our room everything was fine until we opened the curtains and found our balcony within 10 feet of a building site. The next morning we asked to be moved to another block the staff were very helpful and they told us that they had nothing available until the following day which was ok by me. The next day we moved from building 2 to building 5 which had a view of the lake and was well away from the building work. The rooms were very large and contained everything needed, the pool area was great and never crowded. The location was excellent close to all theme parks with Seaworld only 2 miles away and Disney a10 minute drive, there was a Publix supermarket about 1 mile from the hotel. The premium outlet mall was also within 1 mile. I would recomend this hotel to anyone perfect location but at the quiet end of international drive away from all the noise

Reviews.Title: “fountain hotel”
Reviews.Author: keey05
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a nine night stay at the fountains, it was a very clean and confortable place to stay. Very convenient for Disney and Univercal Studios. There was a lot of buiding work going on but it was not much of a problem as we were out most of the time. The time share we went to was a waste of time and they tell you it will last for ninties minutes well we left after two hours and it was still going on. We found that the staff were not particularly friendly or approachable but did there jobs very well. We waited over twenty minutes for a very expensive drink one evening as the member of staff on duty was serving in the bar and serving the food.

Reviews.Title: “The Fountains - Mostly good few bad”
Reviews.Author: critterbits
Reviews.Content: The Fountains, in many ways, is a great place to vacation. It is very clean when you check in, the condos are spacious and efficient, there is plenty of good parking, the pool is outstanding, and it is close to everything. My family and I would definitely return sometime. However, there are some negatives. There are no fitted sheets on the beds, so we awoke most mornings to find ourselves twisted in the bottom sheet and lying on the mattress pad - YUCK! The activities cost money for everything rather than being free as we have experienced at other resorts, also the activities people called the unit everyday to list what was happening. Perhaps the most negative aspect was the hidden costs in the final bill. Finally, the construction noisess, though temporary, woke us before 8:00 a.m. and went on throughout the day, defintely eliminating any naptime for young ones. The check out time of 10:00 a.m. is very unreasonable as well. Overall, we were pleased, just a bit surprised at times. We found that the family did not want to linger at the resort as we have at other places. Instead, we were eager to leave and really only slept and swam there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: MomMN
Reviews.Content: My 7 y.o. daughter and I stayed 10/6-10/13. It was wonderful! The 2 bedroom was spacious and clean - 3 TVs and a great hot tub in the master suite. We stayed in building 7 which is a ways from the clubhouse but was undoubtedly quieter than the closer buildings. (The music can be a bit loud). We did have construction noise (they are adding another building), but we are early risers and it didn't bother us. The pool is awesome. It rained off and on one day - all you have to do is swim from the outdoor pool to the indoor one. I only wish there was a slide for the kids. They could have had more bar help - the outdoor bar seemed closed much of the time. The inside bar had only 1 bartender who was very busy most of the time. The food selection is limited but adequate - with a full kitchen in the unit, we ordered only one meal from the bar. It was good and appropriately priced. The washer and dryer are small but adequate. There is a Publix grocery store just down the street. The resort is very close to all of Disney. We left at 8:00am each day and drove to the parks. We were always were in line at least 15 minutes before they opened. I did get lost coming back from the Magic Kingdom - I'm still not sure what exit to take. It is easiest to find your way from MGM. We will definitely go back to the Fountains!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: barbiehen
Reviews.Content: Just how the brochure described it. Not sure what I was expecting so many reviews saying dirty room etc,. In reality, first class accomodation, lovely surroundings. Rooms cleaned once a week. Overall everything you needed for a home from home experience in the sun. Only down fall was having to pay for every activity for the kids, no interaction with them either. On the up the new resort water park will be opened next year, and all charges for activities will be scrapped, so without that slight niggle it will be an all round excellent resort. Staff are helpfull, pools and jacuzzis are spotless. Hot tub in bedrooms and apartments are very large. The lake is tranquill, and the barbeque area is ideal. Would recommend this resort to anyone. In fact our family is returning in May we enjoyed it that much.

Reviews.Title: “totally in love!”
Reviews.Author: kirkwood1
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised after reading the reviews we are a little scared. But the moment we opened the door we knew we had made the right choice. The location is perfect and easily accessible to all theme parks, grocery stores, shopping etc... I guess the houspkeeping was better than what I had read our place was clean and we didn't hear any construction noises, even though we saw the work in process. I think these reviews are good but sometimes I think people go overboard and give a good place a bad review and it affects travelers decisions. So people writing reviews lets be honest, afterall we don't live in a perfect world....The only complaint I would have is that there is no houskeeping...But I am finding that is not uncommon these days!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but stayed at better due to the cleaning....”
Reviews.Author: zico2906
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two week stay at the Fountains and all in all had a good time. Excellent position for all the Theme Parks, Shops, Restaurants etc, and on the whole extremely friendly and helpful service from the staff. Not a great deal on site compared to other locations I have stayed at but there is a supermarket and other shops close by so the Resorts "box" of a store isn't a problem. The upside to this however is that unlike some of the bigger resorts all is in comfortable walking distance. Two gripes however. Maybe it's because I run a cleaning business at home and maybe I am picky but I was very disappointed with the standard of cleaning in the Apartments. We stayed in a standard room in the first week and it seems that Housekeeping bypasses the edges of the hard floors when it comes to cleaning. There was dirt and hair etc especially around the edges and some of the cupboards were not the cleanest with a fair amount of water stain at the bottom. It seems that a mere brush of the floors rather than a good old fashioned dust and mop is used. The standard of dusting also left a lot to be desired. In fairness after I mentioned it to the Management Housekeeping was round within 15 minutes and sorted the problem out. The second week however we moved into a deluxe room and I found the same problem there, this time however I decided to not bother mentioning it. As I say though maybe I am just picky because of the job I do... Also as others have mentioned the sheets to the beds are awful and totally undersized. Surely in the US if they have Queen and King Sized beds they must have sheets to match??!! On the whole though not bad, although I would choose somewhere else in future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tremak
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 2 weeks holiday staying at The Fountains. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit dubious but am pleased to say this was totally unfounded! We were in block 3 overlooking the lake. The apartment was beautiful, clean, with everything anyone could need. The only down-side was the bedding for the king-size bed, it was on the small size and we had problems keeping it on the bed. Having stayed in several locations in the Orlando area, The Fountains was well placed to access all the main theme parks and shopping malls. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at The Fountains”
Reviews.Author: ExeTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fountains during August/September and had a great time. Our 2 bedroom apartment in block 5 was very nice with a master bedroom with TV and ensuite toilet and shower as well as a jacuzzi bath in the main bedroom. The second bedroom had 2 double beds and TV. The kichen area was fine, with oven, dishwasher and microwave. There is also a washing machine, drier and iron if you need it. All in all it was a nice apartment, with a nice view overlooking the lake. The complex has a bar, a small shop and an area to buy coffee and pastries etc . The pool is quite large and there is a pool side bar too. I found the staff very polite and helpful, but beware of the timeshare presentation. You will be told it lasts about 90 minutes, but in reality we actually spent about 3 hours. Still we did get 150 Disney dollars which we spent in the shops and for food in the Disney parks. There was building work going on, but you did not hear anything and were not really aware of it. There is a Publix supermarket about a 2 minute drive away and also a big Premier Shopping outlet close by too. Getting to Disney is easy (about 15 minute drive) on the 556 and Universal takes about 20 minutes up International Drive (take the alternative route to Universal Studios - coming off to the right before the main part of International Drive, after the Convention Centre). Seaworld is about 5 minutes away up International Drive. Very centrally located. All in all it was very nice and I'd definately go there again..

Reviews.Title: “Fountains exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: KieranBangor
Reviews.Content: Before travelling, I was apprehensive about some of the reviews of the Fountains especially in regards to the building work. However, we have just spent a wonderful 16 night sin Orlando and the Fountains was a major contributor to the holiday's success. From the friendly greeting at security on arrival until the final day, I could find very little to fault. We were given an apartment in Building 5 which is one of the older buildings which had an unrestricted view of the Lake. This or Building 4 I would recommend. The apartment was HUGE; it had everything we needed and more; even a jacuzzi in the main bedroom. Each of our two kids (14 and 12) had their own double bed and bathroom in their own room. The washer/drier was a great bonus as we could do a wash which only took about 20 mins and a dry and the clothes would be wearable the next day. The location of the Fountains was excellent for all the locations, within 5 miles of Disney World and not too far from the Universal area and free car parking too with no problem getting spaces. Premium Outlets was only a mile away. Pool was great although the pool entertainment was a bit too loud ( I like loud music but not when relaxing by a pool) and you need to appreciate Bob Marley's music as their reportoire consisted mostly of his music. Food was nice at the pool but the drinks and ice cream was costly. The kids enjoyed the pool games even involving us adults on many occasions. There was building work going on but we were never aware of it and never heard or saw any evidence of it. Staff were very pleasant although the reception staff never got back to me with a few enquiries I asked of them. The lack of any 'free' light housekeeping, even just to change towels, was not really acceptable. It was nice also to be able to go to a bar at the end of a long day; even the karaoke sessions were fun and well run. We went to the timeshare presentation on the penultimate day and thought it dragged out too much - they could have told us everything in about half an hour but there was not too much pressure from them. At least we got over $100 off tickets for the Pirates Dinner Adventure for our trouble. However, my overall experience was very positive and would have no hesitation in recommending the Fountains and we will definitely be back again,

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the Fountains”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDaz
Reviews.Content: Loved the Fountains, it is a clean and tidy Timeshare property in a good location on International drive, away from the tacky stuff of the North end, close enough for a 5 min trip in the car to Walgreens or Publix supermarket for shopping. See my pics to see how nice the gounds look especially the lake front. We were in Building 5 and saw none of the new building work at all. No hassle over timeshare sales apart from an invite to a meeting at check in, heard no more from them. The pool area is nice with the outside/inside pool and the poolside bar. Liked the poolside entertainment especially the Singer/Guitarist. The room had everything you would need including Washer/dryer so you don't need to take too many clothes. I would defo go there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Around -Great for our Child with Special Needs”
Reviews.Author: LuvFlorida17
Reviews.Content: This is our second time around at the fountains. We loved our trip the first time and loved it the second time. I read some of the reviews good and bad and the only thing I actually agree with on in the bad reviews are the sheets. They are horrible. I now bring my own king sheets and fitted mattress pad. That's how bad they are, but if that's the only real complaint I have on the comfort of the suite. I'm happy. After our last stay, we wrote a comment to Bluegreen that we didn't like that they didn't have a bolt lock on the door. With small children (one with autism) fascinated with opening and closing a door with no bolt. We had to put a chair at the door. But that has been rectified and they now have a bolt lock high up the door. I love that the porches are all screened in. This is also a plus with a child with autism. He cannot climb over the railing. I guess there is one more thing that I don't like about the design of the room; however, it has noting to do with the quality or cleanliness of the villa. When you have small children and the master suite is in the back of the suite, it's a little scary to put them to sleep in the very front (right near the front door). I also don't like that the windows are at knee level. When my children were 3 and 1, my husband and I switched off sleeping up in front. Getting back to the perks, it is very nice to have a nice grocery store with in a mile. You can save money by purchasing your groceries and eating in. Kitchen is fully stock with all the pots and pans you need. The Fountains is also far enough from the craziness of Disney, but close enough that you don't feel like you are driving hours to the parks. The distance was perfect enough for us to come back for a hour or two and go back into the Magic Kingdom ,after our baby took and nap and our special needs child was able to run around a fairly large villa.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah22_2000
Reviews.Content: As a bluegreen vacation owner for two years and never staying in a resort, this was a great way to start out. My husband and I are extremely busy and are just now settling in our jobs and finding time to travel, so we got away for a weekend get away to Orlando. We arrived here around midnight, we got checked right in with ease. The rooms were fabulous!! It was a huge two bedroom unit with all the fixings! I wish we had more time to spend in the room. If you travel here, i would suggest a rental car. The bus and trolley have stops right outside of the hotel, but it would be easier to just rent a car. We had an Awesome time, it was an excellent way to spend our first anniversary. The pool is beautiful and the resort is amazing. There was some construction going on while we were there, but it didnt bother us at all. I def. recommend visiting this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dlmyvette
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Fountains Resort. The resort property is extremely comfortable. The pool area and surrounding property areas are clean and kept up nice. The rooms are also very clean and extremely spacious. I've stayed with family and the kitchens are very convenient if you want to save on buying 3 meals a day! The property is located closer to Universal than it is to Disney, but either way the trip isn't far! There is a Walgreens and Publix supermarket very close by and we usually stop there for food and misc snack items. Aside from that The Fountains is located just a few miles from the outlet mall, which makes it even better. We have enjoyed staying at the Fountains and plan on staying in 2007 if we can get a good rate again!

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull member of staff”
Reviews.Author: mmckmwb
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at this resort from 15th June for two weeks but because of a problem with our booking agent, the stay had been cancelled and the fountains resort did not have any room for us. As the problem had nothing to do with the Fountains resort i did not expect them to help out much but one of there reception staff called Phillip helped us with our every need and got us moved to another resort just across the road. All the other reception staff were not willing to offer us any assistance but philip took the time to communicate with our booking agent and get us sorted with alternative accommodation even though he was dealing with a long line of folk waiting to check in. We were also offered the use of the fountains pool/parking etc if we wished while we were staying accross the road at another resort. Well done philip and thanks for helping us out

Reviews.Title: “Music Far too Noisy !!!!”
Reviews.Author: AntDorset
Reviews.Content: This looked a great place to stay and appeared to cater for the 'higher end' market. The resort is very nice and the pool and accommodation is are also nice. BUT the music by the pool is very noisy its all reggae from 9am till 9pm. IF YOU WANT PEACE AND QUIET AFTER A DAY AT A THEME PARK, DO NOT STAY HERE. We had to complain every day about the load music. We could not sit on our balcony without hearing load music. This is more of a club 18-30 resort. If you want to listen to music by the pool, guests will bring an MP3 player. This is such a let down and nearly spoilt our holiday. BEWARE !!!

Reviews.Title: “what a brill time!!”
Reviews.Author: ddavey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fountains for two weeks and had an amazing time. We booked a two bedroomed apartment and it was perfect. On arrival the whole family were amazed at how clean the building was(even though there is work still ongoing near by). The pool area is clean and the activities on daily for children were great. Staff at the Fountains were helpful and any problems we did have were sorted immediately. 1st problem lights went out in the room, once reported it was fixed within half and hour. The only thing I would say if you are going to stay is to make sure your appartment gets cleaned. We had to ring for clean bed linen and for room to be cleaned. This was not a problem but the receptionist said rooms are only cleaned on request!!! You will enjoy this resort and we as a family will be back next year!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive RCI exchange”
Reviews.Author: florida-no1fan
Reviews.Content: Exchanged RCI week and was impressed with the accomodation we received. Security at the enterance impressive. Directions - tip Aim for I-ride stop 38 if you do get lost . Regrettably the I-Ride just outside is convenient, but not reliable after 7:30 ish. Be aware that a metered tax/ cab from Universal should only set you back $22 at most. Aim for Premier outlets ( 1 junction down ) where you will find a convenient Publix with ATM & Wallgreens next door. Lobby impressive, and balcony view over the pool. Request block 2 if possible, next to club house, & overlooking the lake. Major works in progress on site to double if not treble size of complex. View of the building site therefore expected, but you dont come to orlando for the view ! Everything you need in appartment, including mid week towel change. 2 bed & 2 bath & sofa bed easily accomodates 6. When checking in you are given temporaty parking pass, which you redeme with the RCI rep, who also mentions the incentives for the presentantion. Having overslept for ours (7:30am) no pressure just 1 voice mail message to follow up. Voice mail each evening also tells of next day activities & the weather. 2 Pc's in lobby with free internet access for 1/2 hour. Room Charge easy for bar & food tab. Happy hours regulary tween 6-8, But h20 ( the lobby bar) does close at 10, and service rather unenthusiastic at times. Pool facilites fantastic & entertainment 110% At present abundance of Love bugs are a pest in the area ! Word of warning, do take your pool towles back , or you will be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint property, very close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: sinirgee
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent Memorial Day weekend at the Fountains to celebrate a bridal shower. I contacted the Hotel early and they were able to arrange for someone to check-in for us so that they could decorate and arrange our room. The Hotel was beautiful, has free parking and we were greated by security everytime we drove onto the property. The hotel totally worked around us for our convienience. If i had to say a negative was that there is no daily room service on site unless you're a time share owner. However, the rooms have a washer and dryer to wash your clothes and hotel towels. So pack lightly. Do not buy the unlimited Trolly passes because this hotel is located 2 miles from the busy part of I-Drive. If you're able to rent a car, your stay will be great! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “yes - I would go again”
Reviews.Author: Phlbod
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Fountains - we last visited about a year an a half ago to find it was expanding at some pace. They have & continue to increase the apartment blocks (building round a new designated pool area is still going on and isn't expected to be done until 2009) but the clubhouse, pool area and so on hasn't yet expanded to really cope with the extra guests so it can get hectic and you may have to wait for service, food etc and it gets crowded daytime if its fine. Despite this it still has a great atmosphire of being friendly and the staff are very good. The appartment was one of the very new ones - it looked well cared for, was really clean and very tidy. At night it becomes quite sophiticated. All in all good value, very handy for all attractions and you wouldhave to go a long way to get better.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: 4Pipers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fountains from April 1st - 6th. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor, I called to request a room away from the construction since we have 2 toddlers and a quiet nap time is necessary. I was assured that we were in building 4 away from the construction. Upon arrival we were given a room in building 2 - right next to the construction. Check in was easy and the employees were very polite. The room was a delux two bedroom suite. The carpet was completely covered with stains (the carpets were being replaced, but they had not gotten to our room yet) There was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom and the outside door did not close properly. We have stayed in this type of resort before in Orlando and this was not one of the best. The grounds and pools were nice. They offer lots of activities daily, but each comes at a price. The sales presentation was way over 90 minutes long - closer to 3 hours and we made it very clear from the beginning that we were not interested in purchasing a time share. The sales rep. was very nice and respectful. His sales manager was rude and condesending. I would not stay here again. Try Orange Lake or Mystic Dunes.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Mexirican1020
Reviews.Content: We are BlueGreen owners and this was our first time using the resorts anywhere! We decided to stay at The Fountains for my hubby's b-day wk-end. We checked in after 6pm on Friday night and checked out at 945am on Monday. The hotel room we got was 2 bedroom/ 2 bath and it was beautiful! It had washer/drier, which we only used once to wash a few towels thinking we didn't have enough or that they wouldn't bring us new ones... but towards the last day, we found more towels inside the cabinets!! We stayed in building #5 on the fifth floor and our view was nice. (facing the lake) The bed was comfortable but I don't think there's enough pillows though. The jacuzzi was nice but the shower in the master bedroom, the curtain wasn't long enough so the water got outside. The front door wasn't very secured, it only had one lock and it was low enough for my two yr old to open it. (And she did plenty of times!) They need a chain lock or something more secured. There was two elevators in our building but one wasn't available all the time. I think it was Sun morning, that we got in one elevator with another family and the elevator stopped at each floor on its way down but we couln't let anyone else in, including the housekeepers because the elevator was full. (I wonder how long the housekeepers had to wait to get to where they needed to go!) The staff was friendly especially the Spanish, older gentleman at the bar. (Nor sure if he's name was Eddie) We ordered food to go on Sat and Sun and he was there both times and he remembered us by the second day. The food was good BUT the price was a bit too high. We went to the pool on Sat and Sun and it was awesome! There was a DJ on Saturday and he was playing different games. I like how they have different activities every day throughout the day.. Unfortunately, we weren't able to do any of them. We did watch the puppet show while we waited at the bar for our food and the show was good, my daughter enjoyed it. **If you go to the pool, you have to ask for a towel at the activity center and they'll ask you for your room #. Once you are done, you have to make sure you tell them that you returned the towel or they'll charge you for it. (You return the towels at a bin close to the activity center)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and location but beware the sales pitch.”
Reviews.Author: fild
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms or should i say apartment. ours didn't look as if it had been used before so everything worked fine and was clean and tidy. good location too only 5 mins from sea world and disney. 15 mins from universal. free parking too. staff generally helpful and when we asked for additional things such as coffee they arrived at our room very quickly. we were in block 7 which overlooked the building site which wasn't a particulary good view. workers started around 7am but due to the jet lag we were usually awake by then and it gave us the kick to get up and go early to the parks so didn't cause us any problems. beware the vacation ownership sales pitch though. lasted around 2 1/2hrs but as long as you continually say you're not interested they eventually get the message and let you go. you get a free breakfast and $75 towards attraction tickets which is well worth the hassle if you're already staying there. all in all a good base to do the parks from but if you're looking for a nice peaceful resort to spend time around it's not the place for you at the moment.

HotelInfo.Name: Bluegreen Fountains Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 12400 South International Drive, Registration: 12450 S International Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
